reviewnospace: Amazing Museum. So many great works of Dali in one place. The art hypnotizing you. The museum is at Figueres, a charming little village.
titleopinion: Dalli is Amazing. Amazing Museum. So many great works of Dali in one place. The art hypnotizing you. The museum is at Figueres, a charming little village.

reviewnospace: A trip to this museum is a bit surreal, but then that is the point. Dali designed the building as a theater to exhibit his artworks. There is a large panorama of his works that trace his artistic progress from his early years to the last years of his life. The museum includes sketches, sculptures, paintings, murals, holograms, photographs, magnificent artistic jewelry, and of course surrealistic creations. Also on display are paintings by other artists from his personal collection. The museum is easily visited from Barcelona as a day trip.
titleopinion: The Sensational Salvador Dali. A trip to this museum is a bit surreal, but then that is the point. Dali designed the building as a theater to exhibit his artworks. There is a large panorama of his works that trace his artistic progress from his early years to the last years of his life. The museum includes sketches, sculptures, paintings, murals, holograms, photographs, magnificent artistic jewelry, and of course surrealistic creations. Also on display are paintings by other artists from his personal collection. The museum is easily visited from Barcelona as a day trip.

quote: A Beautiful Museum And Worth Every Moment
reviewnospace:
This is a really fun museum and incredibly interesting. Here's a few important pointers:
1. Buy your ticket and be there first thing in the morning. This is a popular destination, so there may be many "tour bus tourists" arriving, so first thing or end of the day may be your best bet for less crowds.
2. If you put a Euro in the car, Make sure someone is standing at the window of the hearse to let you get your picture. I did this and other tourists made sure to take advantage of the photographs I wanted to take inside the vehicle when my surprise started. The coin slot is at the front of the car.
3. This museum was built around Dali's tribute to his late wife. So the, unless they change his art, it would be hard to design it more accessible to wheelchair.
4. If you drive here, make sure to drive to his home as well. You are definitely missing out if you don't take a drive further North to see his home. It is very interesting too.
5. Make sure to look for all the "secret" ways to look for things. Dali wanted his audience to understand that there is more than one way to look at something.

That was very interesting too.

quote: Well worth the trip from Barcelona
reviewnospace: It is a great demonstration of Dali's unique art and business talent, and showcases his diverse production, with many well-known examples of his style. It is more than just a building full of paintings, as the building itself has been designed/transformed by Dali and the museum to a large extent expresses his ideas. In multiple ways the building is integrated with the art. It was a pleasant surprise to tour the museum, especially when compared to the rather meager Dali exhibition across the Barcelona Cathedral. There are many hours to spend here, I would probably come back if I was near Figueres again.

Try and spend the day here and stop on Girona.

quote: Wow what a great place to visit
reviewnospace: This was a great place to visit. I was going to say museum but this is a sensory overload. I just loved wandering from room to room. Be sure to take time and get the full impact of the artwork and the visual illusions presented. This is the kind of place that you just have to stroll thru and maybe backtrack once or twice to be sure you see it all. If you have to skip anything skip the jewels but if at all possible see it also. It was so nice we were going to catch a train late that day back to Barcelona so we took our luggage to the Dali Theater and they nicely had a large check room. Also check out the church outside the front entrance to the museum.

quote: Dali Museum Figueres and Dali Home Cadaques
reviewnospace: Great day trip (about 11 hours total) to Figueres and Cadaques. While museum was very interesting and worthwhile, it would be difficult to decide whether the home in Cadaques OR the trip over the mountains and down to Cadaques and Port Ligat was the highlight. BOTH GREAT. Wonderful views. Guide Enrique was engaging and knowledgeable about Dali and his wife Gala (I believe he used the word egomaniacal). So no whitewash here! Very happy with Explore Catalunya tour!

reviewnospace:
The content and exhibits aside, as the guide says, this museum is “the largest surrealistic object in the World”.

So, if you only take time to properly explore the courtyard and stage/cupola, the visit is well worth it. But please, do go and visit the rest of the mueum as even if it is not to your taste, you are bound to find some picture, exhibit or hidden corner which will imprint the Museu Dali on your memory.

Unlike many museums, you are not given a map or guide at the ticket office. You find these by turning back on yourself, to the right after you have had your ticket checked at the entrance barrier. There are information leaflets and maps in many languages.

There are quite a few staircases and steps to manoeuvre, something to be aware of if you are infirm or find stairs difficult.

You can buy a ticket in advance on the internet to reduce queuing times in peak season. As we were here in February this wasn’t an issue for us. Our apartment overlooked the front of the museum and it seemed to us that the number of people entering was much reduced after one o’clock.

There is now a permanent exhibition of Dali's jewellery and this is also well worth a visit. You have to leave the main museum and use a separate entrance; the price of entry is included in the museum entrance fee.

When you’ve finished, a walk around the outside of the building is worthwhile.
Enjoy your visit! Oh yes, CAMERA!

There is now a permanent exhibition of Dali's jewellery and this is also well worth a visit. When you’ve finished, a walk around the outside of the building is worthwhile. Enjoy your visit! Oh yes, CAMERA!

reviewnospace: The Teatre-Museu Dalí is surely one of the more exceptional and inspirational museums of Europe and well worth a visit even if you´re not a Dalí aficionado. If you are, it´s an absolute treat. The sheer scope of the exhibits is astonishing, ranging from lesser known works to some of his most famous, highlighting the full extent of his artistic genius. It´s one of those places where you could spend days and never get bored, and it certainly is a place to come back to. The buidling is a former theatre that was turned into a piece of art in itself in typical Dalí fashion. The Museum is popular so be prepared for crowds and in particular scholl classes.

reviewnospace: This museum proves that Dali was a champion of self promotion and marketing. It does indeed present a number of very interesting sculptures and drawings in a peculiar environment that only Dali could dream up. And it's a great site for photos. One or two paintings caught my eye - particularly his portrait of Gala done with spheres. BUT if you want to see great Dali paintings, go to the Prada in Madrid, MoMA in New York, or the National Gallery in Washington DC.

BUT if you want to see great Dali paintings, go to the Prada in Madrid, MoMA in New York, or the National Gallery in Washington DC.

quote: A glimpse in the creative mind of Dali
reviewnospace: I grew up with the paintings of Dali, but to see them with your own eyes is amazing. The museum truly gives you a glimpse in the mind of this creative master artist. It's surprising from the very first moment. Especially look at the details of the paintings. The visit takes about 2 hrs. Tip: Combine dinner and a night visit to the museum, less crowded and a very special atmosphere with the lighting in full effect. I promise you'll have a great evening!

quote: This was my first visit to the museum
reviewnospace:
Of course, before you go, you don't know what really to expect. I think the museum is really well done. I loved the layout of the museum. A lot of things are incredible, and totally wacky, in a good way. Such a fun museum, a lot of laughs and wonder. I liked how there's a lot of hands-on things to see, which makes the museum interactive.


My only suggestion is bring some small change, because there's a few things that you can (but don't have to) pay for inside, which is just like the icing on top, just adds a little bit more fun to the museum.

Otherwise, loved the museum, and would definitely go back, when we can.


So much fun!!

Lastly, it's an easy walk from the high speed train station to the museum and nicely situated in the center of the small town.

reviewnospace: This is ABSOLUTELY a must see on any short visit to Barcelona! It is very easy to get there. When you go to the train station in Barcelona (Sants), you will have two options: the fast train or RENFE. I personally took RENFE, because I paid for a two way trip only 24 euros! It takes around 2 hours to get there by train. You do NOT buy the tickets before the day of the travel. You just show up to the train station and go between counters 1-6 and ask for a two way ticket to Figueres. The great thing is that there is no time printed on the ticket, so you can take the train whenever you like. When in Figueres, it is very easy to find the museum by just following the signs. To be honest, I pretty much knew I wanted to go to this Museum, but then after going there, I can't believe how much people miss out on, by not visiting this museum. I find the price to be pretty cheap for what it offers (reduced 10 euros, normal price 14 euros). This museum is different from other museums, as it does not merely display Dali's works, but the Theatre-Museum ITSELF, IS a work of Dali! The interiors are all displaying his sketches, paintings, jewelry, furniture, etc. The experience of walking through the walls of this structure cannot be summed up in words. You just have to go see it for yourself, and allow the experience to consume you!

In my books the best gallery in Europe!!

reviewnospace:
Checked in for our tour at Tours4Fun office. This organization runs several different tours related to Barcelona and the surrounding area. Wendy was our tour guide on our Costa Brava Day Trip with Salvador Dali Theatre-Museum tour. She lead the group of 13 on a short walk to an awaiting bus. It was a two hour trip via toll road to our first stop in Figueres for the Dali Theatre-Museum. Arrived in Figueres at 1045 and had a few minutes for a coffee, bathroom break before entering the Theatre-Museum. There was also an exhibit of his jewelry, which we were not aware he was even in to. We did not
have time to see this exhibit. Our guide took us through the museum and then turned us loose until we met at 1300 to leave. Well worth the time to visit this most unusual collection of art.

reviewnospace:
One of the greatest museums I´ve been to, not only by the amount of art, but also by the variety.
The building itself is an experience. We booked electronic tickets a day in advance (in October) and entered the museum at 09.30 a.m., so we had a relatively quiet start before the crowds and school classes came.
Didn´t know before that Dali was also a designer for jewelry. Normally I am not a great fan of jewelry but the exhibition (outside the main building) is fantastic.
titleopinion: One of the greatest museums!. One of the greatest museums I´ve been to, not only by the amount of art, but also by the variety.  The building itself is an experience. reviewnospace: We were in a bit of a rush because we booked tickets also for the Dali House in Cadaques (which has a very strict entry time) and we hit traffic driving out of Barcelona so were later than we expected getting to Figueres. In any case, the museum was pretty cool with lots of crazy exhibits.
titleopinion: Not your average art museum. We were in a bit of a rush because we booked tickets also for the Dali House in Cadaques (which has a very strict entry time) and we hit traffic driving out of Barcelona so were later than we expected getting to Figueres. reviewnospace:
This was a very interesting visit for my husband. The quirkiness of the place is what makes it special.

It's quite a unique experience. Not your typical museum.
titleopinion: Spain Getaway. This was a very interesting visit for my husband. The quirkiness of the place is what makes it special.  It's quite a unique experience. Not your typical museum.

reviewnospace: This was our second visit - admittedly 30 years apart but warm memories from years ago had kept a return on our bucket list - and it goes back in with a hope for the next time. Sr. Dali was an incrediblely productive multimedia artist. There are hundreds of prints, paintings, installations, sculptures and more displayed in the surrealist's recreation of the WWII relic theatre. The guide map suggests that just wandering around is compatible with Dali's idiosyncratic style but we followed the floor plan guide because we wanted to be sure we saw everything. On our recent visit there was a display of Dali's jewellery in a small side exhibition room - a treat in itself. Unfortunately, there was no audio-guide but we had ridden from Barcelona via Catalunya Busturistic and the guide on the bus brought us into the entrance hall and gave a brief introduction. One thing he pointed out was was the larger than life size picture of of Dali's wife, Gala, 'Gazing Out to Sea' - it is pixilated and so if you squint or look at it through your digital camera, it becomes a picture of Abe Lincoln. The man's creativity is astounding....
titleopinion: An Astounding Opus!. reviewnospace: We had no real expectations of this museum, having just arrived by bus to the town and stumbled upon the museum, but it was amazing. Very quirky, with a diversity of different artist styles.

reviewnospace:
We traveled to Barcelona knowing that we must take a day trip to the Dali Museum. We didn't register for a tour but instead rented a zip car and drove up there. It's approx. 1.5 hours from Barcelona so if you're not interested in traveling with a group I highly recommend renting a car although it might make it more expensive.
The museum was everything we expected and more! This is truly a Theatre. Take your time there and enjoy the works of this genius.
The town itself is very nice, if you have time to stroll that's a fun thing to do.
Buy tickets in advance. Admission to the theatre museum includes entrance to the jewelry museum. If you wish to visit Dali's home you'll have to buy a ticket separately.

The museum was everything we expected and more! This is truly a Theatre. Take your time there and enjoy the works of this genius. reviewnospace:
i had been once before 6 plus years ago and my husband had been told by a couple of
different people to definitely go. i was surprised he wanted to go but we did.
took the fast train from barcelona and 1hr and 30-45 minute ride. then got off and walked 15minutes to the museum. we had been told at our hotel in barcelona the train
would stop right in front of the museum. this is not so. but it was still neat to walk the
street in figueres and stop and have coffee at a local place and then when leaving
we went down their "rambla" and stopped and ate. very enjoyable day. of course
the museum is quite unique. much to my surprise my husband enjoyed it and since
returning home has talked it to friends. glad we did it.

reviewnospace:
One can't help but be impressed with the creative genius of Salvador Dali, even if his works are not your "cup of tea." This museum visit exceeded my expectations and brought a smile to my face -- how can one NOT smile when viewing the sometimes absurd visions before you?

We went early in the day to avoid the crowds and had to engage in some backtracking to make sure we visited all of the rooms (follow the numbers!), but I am so glad we came here and spent a couple of hours roaming in an alternate artistic universe.
titleopinion: An amazing artist. One can't help but be impressed with the creative genius of Salvador Dali, even if his works are not your  cup of tea.  This museum visit exceeded my expectations and brought a smile to my face -- how can one NOT smile when viewing the sometimes absurd visions before you?  We went early in the day to avoid the crowds and had to engage in some backtracking to make sure we visited all of the rooms (follow the numbers!), but I am so glad we came here and spent a couple of hours roaming in an alternate artistic universe.

reviewnospace:
This museum is very easy to access from Barcelona - take the high speed rail for a trip totaling around 50 minutes. The museum is walking distance (20 min or so) from Figueres' train station.
I should have known not to expect a regular museum. This museum is built in an old theater, and takes advantage of the layout to introduce you to different pieces of work in different rooms and floors. It is almost maze-like and can seem overwhelming at first. Just follow the numbers to make your way through the museum. Bring some change with you - there are fun little mechanical pieces that cost anywhere from .20 euro to 1 euro. My husband and I spent about 2 hours in the museum, and could have easily spent more time if it was't getting more crowded by the minute.
Arrive early to avoid the lines. Be aware that if you want to buy tickets online, you can only do so for an earlier entrance time.
They do allow photography in the museum, but please don't be the person who takes photos of every little thing. Take pictures of what moves you, but spend time in the present and enjoy the amazing and prolific artwork around you first and foremost.

You can go there by fast train (55 minutes from Barcelona, 36€ round trip). The Museum is not very large but it has some of the famous Dali paintings/ art works. The building itself is very interesting. You will spend about an hour there.

quote: Interesting - but only if you're fans
reviewnospace: Personally I'm not a Dali fan. I like art but not crazy. So I guess I'm not really the target audience of this museum, as I like different styles of art. Overall it was nice and interesting, and there were several paintings I did like a lot. But most of it wasn't my cup of tea, so I would recommend making sure it is your style before making all this long way just tor this one place. Also remember it is extremely popular with tourists: even though this was the beginning of November, there were a lot of groups and it was sometimes hard to move.

reviewnospace: We went on a weekday afternoon 90 minutes before closing and had not pre purchased tickets online; the ticket line was a block and half long but moved rapidly. Despite the very large crowd (it would have been nicer without), we were able to enjoy the tour, well laid out on the guide map and gain some appreciation for the mind bogglingly wide imprint of output left by Dali. After closing, fun to wonder through nearby alleys and squares in downtown Figueres for coffee and pastry. Garage parking next door made it easy to reach.

quote: Hands down the best museum I have visited. GO!
reviewnospace:
This is more than a museum of art it's an experience.

We visited on a very busy national holiday in Spain and despite the numbers I still enjoyed it. So much that I hope to go again at night time to see the buildings lit up!

Unless you really know your Dali this place will take you by surprise as there is plenty of his mad genius on display but so much more. The building is jaw dropping with an open circular courtyard featuring golden mannequins, a floating boat in the air, a car with rain running inside and that's just for starters. Everywhere you look there is something to amazing to marvel at. The huge domed area undercover has huge large paintings and then there are a series of rooms showing the many different stage of his work from the early surreal to the thoughtful war painting period.

My favourite part was the Dali jewels which is housed in a separate side of the building with a small entrance. One person enters at a time via a revolving door so the drama is immediate. Once inside it's darkly lit and each case shows his amazing jewellery designs with many of his sketches by the side to show his plan of each piece - fantastic! I As you an imagine these are no ordinary sets of earrings and necklaces and some have clockwork movement.

I can't speak highly enough of this visit and if you are in Girona or Barcelona or over the border close by in France it's well worth a drive. In the town there are plenty of lovely restaurants to make a day of it or go to his house nearby - sadly we didn't have time on this trip.

If I had one criticism I would have liked more information about the paintings. The entry was very busy and I didn't see any guide books and sometimes walking from room to room there wasn't a great deal of explanation and it was all so intriguing I wanted to know more.

quote: More interesting than Picasso and Miro Museums in Barcelona
reviewnospace:
My husband wasn't excited at first about spending so much money to buy 1st class express train tickets from Barcelona to Figueres 2 days before visiting the Dali Museum. He agreed afterwards that the visit was worth it.

There was only one negative about our visit. We found out later during our late lunch that Thursday was either a free or discounted day for students and pensioners to visit the museum (as told by waiter in Catalan). The smaller museums we visited limited groups to 8 people. Unfortunately for other visitors on that day, there were groups of 20 to 30 students or pensioners piled into small exhibit rooms at the Dali Museum. It was loud and very crowded, which was an unpleasant experience for us.

Instead of finding Dali's artwork crude and obscene as I was forewarned, I was amazed by his originality, creativity and sense of humor. One must look beyond what the artwork portrayed to appreciate the artist.

I recommend getting discounted tourist tickets for the express train from Barcelona to Figueres ahead of time. According to my tour guidebook, regular trains take twice as long, about 2 hours from Barcelona to Figueres. Don't forget to get a Figueres map at the train station tourists information office. We took a taxi from the train station to the museum and walked back since we couldn't find a taxi stand. The fare was expensive for the short taxi ride there. Walking back to the train station through a park and residential areas took us less than 20 minutes.

reviewnospace: If you are "doing" the Dali area including the Castle where his wife lived and Port Ligiat where Dali bought a row of Fishermans cottages to make his home, then this is a must to see. It has a lot of important works by other artists as well, an incredible jewellery room with prices all designed by Dali and is set in the old theatre where Dali first exhibited and now restored to make an amazing museum/gallery. You can park easily as well in the adjacent underground car park.

You can park easily as well in the adjacent underground car park.

quote: Very interesting - suitable for both grownups and kids
reviewnospace:
We came with our three kids, ages 10 - 19 and we all had a great time. We had a wonderful guide Anna who gave us a private tour and added a lot of interesting points. Really fun!
Well worth the visit.
titleopinion: Very interesting - suitable for both grownups and kids. We came with our three kids, ages 10 - 19 and we all had a great time. We had a wonderful guide Anna who gave us a private tour and added a lot of interesting points. Really fun! Well worth the visit.

reviewnospace: If traveling in the Costa Brava - you must stop here to see this museum. Town nothing special but the museum itself is! Gorgeous venue for Dali's works. Very well appointed museum. Highly recommend for those art/culture lovers.
titleopinion: road trip thru Costa Brava. If traveling in the Costa Brava - you must stop here to see this museum. Town nothing special but the museum itself is! Gorgeous venue for Dali's works. Very well appointed museum. Highly recommend for those art/culture lovers.

reviewnospace: Kids didn't like it too much, but I did. Not too crowded (hurray!). The ticket entitles you to visit the Dali jewel museum too.
titleopinion: Cool visit. Kids didn't like it too much, but I did. Not too crowded (hurray!). The ticket entitles you to visit the Dali jewel museum too.

reviewnospace:
We toured the Dali Theatre-Museum as a family and came away with a new appreciation of the art of Salvador Dali. Such symbolism, humor, and even sadness showed in his pieces. We loved the jewelry display, and were happy that our guide told us about it - if we were on our own, I'm not sure we could have seen it.

Taking the time to visit this museum was truly a highlight of our trip.
titleopinion: What an amazing talent.. We toured the Dali Theatre-Museum as a family and came away with a new appreciation of the art of Salvador Dali. Such symbolism, humor, and even sadness showed in his pieces. We loved the jewelry display, and were happy that our guide told us about it - if we were on our own, I'm not sure we could have seen it.  Taking the time to visit this museum was truly a highlight of our trip.

reviewnospace: Lots of others have said it, but I have to repeat. This is an endlessly interesting place. Dali may have been a disturbed genius (or not), but his work is unique, The museum displays are numerous and well done. However, I highly recommend a good tour guide to explain the displays in light of Dali's life and personality. Otherwise, it can just be "a bunch of strange stuff". (A lot of it IS strange stuff, but it's not without meaning and clearly tells a lot about the artist.) I'd also recommend a trip to Dali's home, which is also quite fascinating, although not that easy to get to. It's about 1/2 hour by car over the mountains to the sea shore. Beautiful views along the way.

quote: Go early to beat the crowds!
reviewnospace:
Really quirky Dali museum with both the building decoration and art by Dali. Glad we went on an early tour out of Barcelona as it gets super crowded and quite difficult to see much otherwise. It's quite a small building with lots of different rooms.
Our guide was good and we had individual earpieces.
titleopinion: Go early to beat the crowds! . Really quirky Dali museum with both the building decoration and art by Dali. Glad we went on an early tour out of Barcelona as it gets super crowded and quite difficult to see much otherwise. It's quite a small building with lots of different rooms. Our guide was good and we had individual earpieces.

reviewnospace:
Wow, I had no idea of all the mediums that Dali worked in. This museum is a great showplace for his work. There are also several other artists that are featured.
We arrived early and there was already a line and this was in lare October. I can only imagine how busy it might get in the summer.
There are several floors and I did not see an elevator. There is art work from throughout his life. And we can't forget the building itself.
There are chairs in several areas so you can sit and rest or study the art in more detail.
I came away with a much better appreciation of Dali.

reviewnospace: Yes , go , it's as wacky as they say. Go early as it gets busy quickly. We took the 0825 high speed train from BCN Sants and were at the museum just after it opened. There is a bus from the station which drops you nearby and is cheap. We were back at station by 1130 and spent the afternoon in Girona on the way back. The museum doesn't have all the best of Dalis work but what it does have is fascinating enough to make it worth a visit.

quote: Fantastic Visit-Highly Recommend a Guided Tour!
reviewnospace: This museum was fantastic and unlike anything I have ever experienced. I honestly hesitate to call it a museum because of the unique experience that it offers to visitors is so far from a typical museum visit. As Dalí's final masterpiece, this museum offers so much to see and experience. I highly recommend a guided tour to make sure that you pick up on all the interesting bits that you might miss while being overwhelmed by such an expansive and impressive building. The museum lacks many of Dalí's "most famous" works but the experience this museum gives its visitors far outweighs this negative.
titleopinion: Fantastic Visit-Highly Recommend a Guided Tour!. This museum was fantastic and unlike anything I have ever experienced. I highly recommend a guided tour to make sure that you pick up on all the interesting bits that you might miss while being overwhelmed by such an expansive and impressive building. The museum lacks many of Dalí's  most famous  works but the experience this museum gives its visitors far outweighs this negative.

reviewnospace: It seems everything about Dali is surreal! Even if you are not a big fan of Dali's work, you will be impressed by his art and jewelry displayed here, as well as his design of the building. Everywhere you look there's something astonishing to capture your attention. We went with a small tour group from Barcelona so our tickets were included, but if you're going on your own, buy tickets in advance. It's a popular site and is often crowded.
titleopinion: Surreal Museum!. It seems everything about Dali is surreal! Even if you are not a big fan of Dali's work, you will be impressed by his art and jewelry displayed here, as well as his design of the building. Everywhere you look there's something astonishing to capture your attention. We went with a small tour group from Barcelona so our tickets were included, but if you're going on your own, buy tickets in advance. It's a popular site and is often crowded.

quote: A fantastic treasure house and well worth a visit
reviewnospace:
The Dali Museum has a wonderful and huge collection of works by Dali (and a small amount of his own collection) and reflects the wide range of this important art polymath (and admitted self-publicist). The collection is in the old town museum which became his home, workplace, gallery and shrine. The entry ticket also gives access to the Dali jewellery collection nearby. While booking a time slot is advisable in peak months, it is possible to just turn up and get in. It is, however, always busy, and queuing to see some of the exhibits is inevitable. It is definitely worth it.
Figueres is not the easiest place to get to if you do not have your own transport. A one day package tour (for example from Barcelona) is a convenient option, and usually also covers a visit to the beautiful small city of Girona. Independent travellers can also go by the frequent train service between Barcelona and Figueres. Note that the high speed train (to Paris) goes from Barcelona-Sants to Figueras-Vilafant, which is on the west side of Figueras, but there is a regular bus from the station to the centre. The slightly slower and cheaper regional train from Barcelona-Sants (and Gracia) goes to the nearer, old Figueres Railway Station on the east side of town - an easy walk to/from the centre. Both these trains stop at Girona so a side trip there is possible, if you leave early enough.

While booking a time slot is advisable in peak months, it is possible to just turn up and get in. It is, however, always busy, and queuing to see some of the exhibits is inevitable. It is definitely worth it. Figueres is not the easiest place to get to if you do not have your own transport. The slightly slower and cheaper regional train from Barcelona-Sants (and Gracia) goes to the nearer, old Figueres Railway Station on the east side of town - an easy walk to/from the centre. Both these trains stop at Girona so a side trip there is possible, if you leave early enough.

quote: It's as good as they all say it is!
reviewnospace:
Awesome museum. 1-1.5 hours was plenty of time for us for our visit. You can't escape the crowds. You just have to deal. Avoid the tour groups, there isn't a lot of room to maneuver. Go early.

I had trouble figuring out their website - it isn't user friendly. Don't worry about buying tickets in advance - their system stinks.

It's an easy day trip on the high speed train from BCN to Figures. Go see the museum. have lunch. take in some artist shops. take the train back and you'll have plenty of time to see and do things in BCN in the late afternoon.

Enjoy Figures!

quote: when one lifetime dream suddenly came true..
reviewnospace:

Yes... too many people and endless crowds, but Salvador has earned it, and, of course, I am not the only one who wants to look with my own eyes at his works. i don't think it is a huge disadvantage
The atmosphere is magnific, especially near the tombstone with the name and the date of death of the artist. It was the logical end of the excursion, but the beginning of the rethinking.
I was given what I had expected. I am totally sure I'll come back here soon.

quote: A museum not to be missed, but those crowds....
reviewnospace: We visited the museum as part of a tour out of Barcelona. It was one of the main highlights of our visit. The facility is truly amazing and the exhibitions of Dali's works was like a dream. We've visited the Dali Museum in St. Petersburg, Florida, but this was so much more, a testament to the man's creative genius. The only negative was that the crowds of tourists were excessive and detracted from what would have otherwise been a supremely pleasurable experience. The museum is also a bit confusing, which made it difficult to locate the stairs to the third and fourth levels. Nevertheless, it is a museum not to be missed. Be sure to visit the jewelry exhibit, which has a separate entrance. We had never seen Dali's jewelry creations, and they were exquisite.

of the strange genius of man and paintings / scultures.This was highly beneficial and the almost three hour tour was a shed load of information.Would not have understood why this little guy was such a genious without it and also not discovered the hidden dimensions of certain types of his paintings. Rained inside the Limo (his own cadillac) It can get busy and they do appear to control visitors,
Facts quoted by an earlier Canadian visitor are totally rubbish.Nothing has shrunk.
Only quibble was paying extra for the seperate Royal ? Jewellery rooms.
All in all a memorable worthwhile visit to a piece of history.

reviewnospace: My wife and I had been looking forward to visiting this Dali museum for quite some time as my works for the second largest Dali museum in St. Petersburg, FL. We surely were not disappointed. The museum is an old theatre which Dali converted to a museum to exhibit some of his extensive works. We were fortunate to have one of the museum staff, as a favor to my wife, escort us and explain about the museum and Dali's art pieces. Interestingly, the museum does not offer docents or audio guides to provide any explanation for what you will see. This is really a shame as Dali art really does require explanation to begin to appreciate it. To get a tour, you must hire a licensed guide beforehand (highly recommended). Also, there is a separate exhibition (and separate fee) of Dali jewelry. If you have made the journey to see the art, be sure to also see the jewelry. Also, if possible, buy your tickets on-line so that you will have a time to visit; otherwise, you risk a long wait to get into the museum. Overall, this was an excellent visit and a wonderful legacy left by Dali.

reviewnospace: We last visited the museum 25 years ago, around the same time of year, and there were only 1/10th as many visitors. Perhaps part of the problem is people stopping to take photos with their cell phones/ cameras. We also thought there were fewer of his famous paintings on display than the last time we visited. Likewise the Lincoln in Dalivision is smaller than we remember and now there is a charge of .20 Euro to look through a viewing scope to see the Lincoln image, where as during our last visit the room was larger and there was an area designated to stand and squint to get the complete image. The visit was a disappointment mainly due to the overcrowding.

quote: Everyone should go - At least once!
reviewnospace:
This was by far the highlight of my holiday! I've long been an admirer of Dali's work and as a fan this was high on my to do list! The museum itself is as amazing from the outside as it is from the inside. Dali was asked to provide some artwork after a fire but went one better and designed the whole building, with its bread and eggs!

It was a lot of walking and many staircases, (my Fitbit racking up almost 14k steps for the day). We came here on an excursion with the hotel from Lloret de Mar taking in the Dali & Gala's castle before coming to the museum.

The art on display is amazing, from sculptures, huge art pieces, a full ceiling and many many paintings, some more familiar than others, a small glimpse in to Dali's mind! I bought prints from the castle and was glad I did as the prices changed a little at the museum, but there are shops in the town selling similar things for less it pays to shop around.

A fantastic day out whether you're a Dali fan or not!

I bought prints from the castle and was glad I did as the prices changed a little at the museum, but there are shops in the town selling similar things for less it pays to shop around.  A fantastic day out whether you're a Dali fan or not!

quote: A super experience ... felt like Dali was there!
reviewnospace:
Magic place with the museum built within an old theatre.
The building is round & has 3 floors with many different rooms & themes. The centre of the building is open to the sky
Shows how prolific Dali was in his life. A surprise around every corner.
Its so popular we queued for almost one hour to get in but worth it. Its the best laid out museum I have seen.
Do not miss if in the area.

But that minor issue aside if you love Dali you have to come here and see an abundance of creativity.

titleopinion: Dali is Mad. Definitely worth a visit. The price of the museum entrance was good value. It was much more expensive getting the train from Barcelona. Absolutely loads of exhibits to admire even if you are not necessarily a fan of Dali. . We arrived at around 11:00. Very busy but didn't take long in the queue.

reviewnospace: We had heard how wondrous this was but visiting it ourselves was something else! Dali was inventive,innovative, crazy, versatile and prolific. The museum was testament to this and is brimming with his work. Whilst his work speaks for itself, a little more explanation as you walked around would have been helpful. Overall, an excellent place to visit.
titleopinion: Astonishing!. We had heard how wondrous this was but visiting it ourselves was something else! Dali was inventive,innovative, crazy, versatile and prolific. The museum was testament to this and is brimming with his work. Whilst his work speaks for itself, a little more explanation as you walked around would have been helpful. Overall, an excellent place to visit.

reviewnospace: The Dali Museum has plenty of Dali artwork, which ranges from the routine to the outright bizaar! Much of it is thought provoking, some is devilishly clever and some is just plain weird. Be prepared for some crowded spaces, but the reasonable admission price and interesting art pieces makes it worth a visit if you're in the region.
titleopinion: Entertaining and Thought Provoking Artwork. The Dali Museum has plenty of Dali artwork, which ranges from the routine to the outright bizaar! Much of it is thought provoking, some is devilishly clever and some is just plain weird. Be prepared for some crowded spaces, but the reasonable admission price and interesting art pieces makes it worth a visit if you're in the region.

reviewnospace: Magical, weird and wonderful. Right out of Dali's head, every detail has a bit of Dali in it. Definitely a must see if you are near Barcelona!
titleopinion: Its a magical place. Magical, weird and wonderful. Right out of Dali's head, every detail has a bit of Dali in it. Definitely a must see if you are near Barcelona!

quote: The Legacy of an Incredible Life
reviewnospace: This is a magical, crazy, over-the-top experience. Some profoundly beautiful work combined with gaudy, goofy stuff. Ever the showman, Dali created this place and it fits his reputation well. Lovely, tacky, gimmicky and spooky...just like the man. We loved it!!
titleopinion: The Legacy of an Incredible Life. This is a magical, crazy, over-the-top experience. Some profoundly beautiful work combined with gaudy, goofy stuff. Ever the showman, Dali created this place and it fits his reputation well. Lovely, tacky, gimmicky and spooky...just like the man. We loved it!!

reviewnospace:
I wasn't a Dali fan but this museum and the fantastic private tour guide we had really changed my mind. She was so knowledgeable and passionate about Dali that I was able to appreciate his work on a whole new level and understanding. He created this museum, every inch of it is his masterplan and it truly is something to see.
Lots of fun.
titleopinion: A great museum!. I wasn't a Dali fan but this museum and the fantastic private tour guide we had really changed my mind. She was so knowledgeable and passionate about Dali that I was able to appreciate his work on a whole new level and understanding. He created this museum, every inch of it is his masterplan and it truly is something to see. Lots of fun.

reviewnospace: From Barcelona, this is a great day trip. You can take the train to Figueres and walk up to the museum which has a fantastic collection of Dali's works and installations in a wild and crazy building.
titleopinion: A Must for Dali Fans. From Barcelona, this is a great day trip. You can take the train to Figueres and walk up to the museum which has a fantastic collection of Dali's works and installations in a wild and crazy building.

reviewnospace: A day trip to Figueres to enjoy Dali. Easy, well marked walk from the train station. The museum itself is beautiful and the collection amazing! A multi-media experience of Dali that left me smiling for days. Lots of lithographs and many of his famous pieces. His jewelry collection also was worth seeing; truly a master at whatever he put his energies to. Be prepared to be engaged in some of the exhibits for a few euros some of his artwork will move and other pieces require you to view them from various perspectives. Left the museum a bigger fan of a true genius!
titleopinion: Fun in Figueres . A day trip to Figueres to enjoy Dali. Easy, well marked walk from the train station. The museum itself is beautiful and the collection amazing! A multi-media experience of Dali that left me smiling for days. Lots of lithographs and many of his famous pieces. His jewelry collection also was worth seeing; truly a master at whatever he put his energies to. Be prepared to be engaged in some of the exhibits for a few euros some of his artwork will move and other pieces require you to view them from various perspectives. Left the museum a bigger fan of a true genius!

reviewnospace: It is about 2 hours outside of Barcelona by train. It was amazing!Surelly worthed the trip as you can see some of the most well known masterpieces of Dali. There was and a place with the jewlery he made and it has an extra ticket. You shold visit both and the house looks great. Also the gift shop is really nice and well priced. It's a must-see museum when you visit Barcelona.

reviewnospace: Extensive works by Salvador Dali located in his home town. Take an hour or two and visit this museum. Wide variety of his works on display.
titleopinion: Well Worth Your Time. Extensive works by Salvador Dali located in his home town. Take an hour or two and visit this museum. Wide variety of his works on display.

reviewnospace: WE loved this museum! Learned a lot about Dalis various styles . We found it helpful to read about some of the pieces beforehand so that we knew what to look for once in the museum . The jewelry exhibit is to die for!!!
titleopinion: Great museum. WE loved this museum! Learned a lot about Dalis various styles . We found it helpful to read about some of the pieces beforehand so that we knew what to look for once in the museum . The jewelry exhibit is to die for!!!

reviewnospace: If you are anywhere near Figueres, Spain, you should make sure that you visit the Dali Museum. We knew a little about Dali, but we had no idea of the range of his work. His paintings are only a small part of his output. We were astonished at his jewellery work, for instance. The Museum is on any floors , and you need to allow 2 to 3 hours at least. You can book on line.....the queues can be very long. Go into the town after your visit sat here are a range of good restaurants.

quote: early visit to the Dalai museum
reviewnospace: This is something you need to visit if you are in this area, but please pre book as it gets very busy and queue's can be huge, the painting and sculptures are fabulous there is too much to say about this place just go and see for yourself, if you are a Dali fan

reviewnospace: If one finds himself in the area this museum is a must-see. The technical ability of Dalí to master so many different materials is mind boggling and his imagination in the compositions is grandiose. Recommended.
titleopinion: Must see!. If one finds himself in the area this museum is a must-see. The technical ability of Dalí to master so many different materials is mind boggling and his imagination in the compositions is grandiose. Recommended.

reviewnospace: On a serious note - I really enjoyed it. An interesting variety of his work, his own collection and influences. His best work is probably scattered around the globe, however a good comprehensive collection of works nevertheless. A visit should take 1-2 hours and this would include entry to the Dali jewels. I didn't go in. Plain old too tired.

quote: A piece of art in itself
reviewnospace: It's worth it just to see this museum as a piece of art in itself. So quirky! Expect lots of people and expect to have to queue up to see the Mae West face. But if you are patient you will get pics without loads of people in them. And I loved that they don't allow selfie sticks! Hooray!!! They are such an annoyance!

reviewnospace: Just go see this! I'm not an artsy sort of person typically and whilst I try to see galleries and museums, I often tire quickly. Not here. I think this was the best value arts museum I've been to. One friend of mine said to me that she'd been 5 times...I thought she was kinda crazy but I get it now!

quote: As surreal as you might expect!
reviewnospace: Always wanted to get to this museum and finally did. Have been a fan of Dali's for many years and to experience his museum was a real treat. Just don't expect to see all of his famous paintings as they are elsewhere. We got there early and within an hour it was getting a bit crowded for photos.
titleopinion: As surreal as you might expect!. Always wanted to get to this museum and finally did. Have been a fan of Dali's for many years and to experience his museum was a real treat. Just don't expect to see all of his famous paintings as they are elsewhere. We got there early and within an hour it was getting a bit crowded for photos.

reviewnospace: Really enjoyed visit to the Dali gallery today. Allow at least 2 hours for a visit and park in one of the streets nearby for free. We booked in advance which alowed entry at a specific time and avoided queueing for entry - well worth doing. I'm a massive Dali fan but two of our party who were not so familiar with his work were also impressed. The exhibit in the main square of the car has a secret - put a euro in the slot to find out what it is. Definately recommend the museum and look forward to visiting the other Dali sites in the area of interest at some point.
titleopinion: Fabulous - but book in advance. Really enjoyed visit to the Dali gallery today. Allow at least 2 hours for a visit and park in one of the streets nearby for free. reviewnospace: This is the second time we have visited Dali Theatre in Figueres. I totally recommend this magnificent museum from stunning sculptures to beautiful paintings, not forgetting the very unusual and amazing pieces of jewellery.
titleopinion: Dali Theatre . This is the second time we have visited Dali Theatre in Figueres. I totally recommend this magnificent museum from stunning sculptures to beautiful paintings, not forgetting the very unusual and amazing pieces of jewellery.

quote: Fabulous but crowed even in September
reviewnospace:
Great collection - very extensive
The huge Sculptures in particular and the museum building overall is very impressive.
The collection covers all periods and pretty well all the various styles, experiments and materials Dali used. A second building has the amazing jewellery he designed.

I suggest you get there before 9am as the gallery is soon filled to the point that the crowd interferes with the experience.
titleopinion: Fabulous but crowed even in September. Great collection - very extensive The huge Sculptures in particular and the museum building overall is very impressive. The collection covers all periods and pretty well all the various styles, experiments and materials Dali used. A second building has the amazing jewellery he designed.  I suggest you get there before 9am as the gallery is soon filled to the point that the crowd interferes with the experience.

quote: Amazing Place to Visit but beware of crowds!!!
reviewnospace:
We have been to the Dali Art gallery in Montmatre, Paris and had such a wonderful inspiring time and were wanting more Dali experience. As we were in the right area we decided to immerse ourselves in Dali again. There is a very handy car park ( not too expensive) close by. We were not prepared for the huge quantity that of Dali's work that is on show. His diversity is exceptional.
While I highly recommend this Dali immersion I can't stress enough that if it is at all possible for you to get there at 9 am when it opens GO THEN.
We went early September expecting it to be not as busy BUT we were wrong. We arrived at about 11 am and there were people everywhere including numerous tour groups. In fact it was difficult to see things, cameras were poked in front of you everywhere, people were shoving and pushing and speaking noisily - the people aspect was awful!! And yet despite the maddening crowds I would not have wanted to miss it. You really need to allow 2-3 hours to get around this vast exhibition. Also, don't expect politeness from all the staff.
titleopinion: Amazing Place to Visit but beware of crowds!!!. We have been to the Dali Art gallery in Montmatre, Paris and had such a wonderful inspiring time and were wanting more Dali experience. We were not prepared for the huge quantity that of Dali's work that is on show. His diversity is exceptional. While I highly recommend this Dali immersion I can't stress enough that if it is at all possible for you to get there at 9 am when it opens GO THEN. We went early September expecting it to be not as busy BUT we were wrong. We arrived at about 11 am and there were people everywhere including numerous tour groups. In fact it was difficult to see things, cameras were poked in front of you everywhere, people were shoving and pushing and speaking noisily - the people aspect was awful!! And yet despite the maddening crowds I would not have wanted to miss it. You really need to allow 2-3 hours to get around this vast exhibition. Also, don't expect politeness from all the staff.

reviewnospace:
Amazing place, really gives you a look into Dali's mind. It's also nice to see that there's a sort of chronological order to follow in order to understand better what's going on.
We had a guide to explain the museum, we had her as part of a tour that left from Barcelona, and it made the difference.
titleopinion: Incredible. Amazing place, really gives you a look into Dali's mind. It's also nice to see that there's a sort of chronological order to follow in order to understand better what's going on. reviewnospace: We loved this museum/theatre - it really is a performance. From the moment you get in you are immersed and it is a grand spectacle, as you would expect from Dali. There are so many twists and surprises, I could have happily spent many more hours there and would return. It kept my younger children engaged too, for the several hours that we were there - until the desire for food began to outweigh the pleasure of viewing the art!!

There are so many twists and surprises, I could have happily spent many more hours there and would return. It kept my younger children engaged too, for the several hours that we were there - until the desire for food began to outweigh the pleasure of viewing the art!!

reviewnospace: I did not expect it to be so big! I loved this museum! We went in may, not too many people and not too hot.
titleopinion: Cool!. I did not expect it to be so big! I loved this museum! We went in may, not too many people and not too hot.

reviewnospace: Went with my husband and 8 year old, and all of us enjoyed the visit. The courtyard when you first walk in is simply amazing and there is so much to see even just in that one space. The collection is vast and you could easily spend hours walking around. Make sure and bring 20 cent pieces - there are a few places where you'll need it to see some surprises. Also buy your tickets online in advance--we were able to walk right in and the line to buy tickets there was pretty long.
titleopinion: Wow! Worth the trip.. Went with my husband and 8 year old, and all of us enjoyed the visit. The courtyard when you first walk in is simply amazing and there is so much to see even just in that one space. The collection is vast and you could easily spend hours walking around. Make sure and bring 20 cent pieces - there are a few places where you'll need it to see some surprises. Also buy your tickets online in advance--we were able to walk right in and the line to buy tickets there was pretty long.

quote: Worth the time and effort to get there
reviewnospace: First, I am a Dali fan. The trip by train to Figueres takes about an hour. We spent about 2 and half hours in the museum. It is important to follow the guide and go though the museum by the numbers. There are 22 seperate areas + the jewelry annex to see. Some of this was very new to me. Wonderful and moving art about WW11 and the holocaust that was very moving. Dali was an amazing genius of an artist. This museum was well worth the time to see. Loved it.
titleopinion: Worth the time and effort to get there. First, I am a Dali fan. The trip by train to Figueres takes about an hour. We spent about 2 and half hours in the museum. Wonderful and moving art about WW11 and the holocaust that was very moving. Dali was an amazing genius of an artist. This museum was well worth the time to see. Loved it.

reviewnospace: I went to this museum via a Shearings coach, it started in 1974 on the site of a theatre. The museum contains the works of Salvador Dali from his artistic career. There are some interesting if not strange items on display, it is a fascinating place to visit. The museum is unusual in it's design even from the outside. Highly recommended.
titleopinion: Visit to Dali Museum.. I went to this museum via a Shearings coach, it started in 1974 on the site of a theatre. The museum contains the works of Salvador Dali from his artistic career. There are some interesting if not strange items on display, it is a fascinating place to visit. The museum is unusual in it's design even from the outside. Highly recommended.

quote: Worth a trip - the guy is bonkers and a genius!!
reviewnospace:
Family visit (4 kids aged 9 - 13). Spent a good few hours wondering round. Some of the stuff is average then some is staggering! Very much a "marmite" view...clearly the guy is mad but a genius also. If in the area it is certainly something worth seeing.
Plenty of shops, markets and cafes near by so can easily spend 1/2 day here.

reviewnospace: We landed in Figueres last at night and walked around, stumbling on the Dali museum...it was closed but we looked around...it was surreal at night, alone, quiet, wonderful. The next day, we went as tourists inside and it did not disappoint! Reasonable entry price, got a brief introductory review and explored on our own. Very comprehensive collection of his lifetime of work - a must see!
titleopinion: Amazing. We landed in Figueres last at night and walked around, stumbling on the Dali museum...it was closed but we looked around...it was surreal at night, alone, quiet, wonderful. The next day, we went as tourists inside and it did not disappoint! Reasonable entry price, got a brief introductory review and explored on our own. Very comprehensive collection of his lifetime of work - a must see!

reviewnospace:
We didn't prebook our tickets to the museum, but got there about 10am. There was only a small queue of about 5 or 6 before us.
It is an interesting museum, the building itself being of interest as well as Dali's unusual art works.
The only down side is the amount of people squashed in the sometimes small spaces, so sometimes difficult to see the exhibits. Also that some of Dali's most famous works are not here but in other museums around the world.
We left at about 12.30 when the queues outside had become very long.
Tip: No need to prebook, just get there early!
* Park at the free parking area in Carrer del Rec Arnau, a short walk away.
It had plenty of spaces available early in the day, whereas the paid parking nearby was hectic.
titleopinion: Worth the trip.. We didn't prebook our tickets to the museum, but got there about 10am. There was only a small queue of about 5 or 6 before us. It is an interesting museum, the building itself being of interest as well as Dali's unusual art works. The only down side is the amount of people squashed in the sometimes small spaces, so sometimes difficult to see the exhibits. Tip: No need to prebook, just get there early! * Park at the free parking area in Carrer del Rec Arnau, a short walk away. It had plenty of spaces available early in the day, whereas the paid parking nearby was hectic.

quote: Beautiful and overwhelming - Not good for people with limited mobility
reviewnospace: Beautiful and crazy place, a bit overwhelming at times, A great concentrate of Dalì's vision of art and life, which takes the visitor through the many shades of the genius. It isn't a friendly place to people with limited mobility, since there are several stairs that may be too much. No elevator available. It is big and inclusive. I went there after visiting the Gala and Savador Dalì's house in Portlligat and I must say that I found that house more touching. Nevetheless, the teatro-museo is beautiful and should be visited if possible. Buy the tickets online in advance.
titleopinion: Beautiful and overwhelming - Not good for people with limited mobility. reviewnospace: Excellent museum a must see for any art or dali fans. We prebooked our tickets online to avoid queuing with our children which was well worth doing. Fantastic works and a thoroughly enjoyable trip. Some pieces can be moved by inserting 20 cents so keep a couple on you when you hand your bag into the cloakroom.

Fantastic works and a thoroughly enjoyable trip. Some pieces can be moved by inserting 20 cents so keep a couple on you when you hand your bag into the cloakroom.

reviewnospace:
A must visit to a rather indifferent Catalonian city that was privileged to be the birthplace of an ingenious artist.
Many elements of the artist's personal history and pieces of art are to be found to this museum.
titleopinion: A tribute to a genius. A must visit to a rather indifferent Catalonian city that was privileged to be the birthplace of an ingenious artist.  Many elements of the artist's personal history and pieces of art are to be found to this museum.

reviewnospace: A very different museum which is deifnatly worth the visit. Even though its a one artist museum there is a grand variaty of things which could fit to different tastes for the arts! We went to Figueres specifically for the museum and do not regret it at all!

reviewnospace: I have visited this museum two times already and never stops surpring me. An excellent museum put together most imaginatively. My compliments and good wishes.

reviewnospace: Dali was a genius !!!! Nice jewellery, good location with nice restaurants at the back of the museum. Figueres itself is very nice to visit.
titleopinion: Amazing museum. Dali was a genius !!!! Nice jewellery, good location with nice restaurants at the back of the museum. Figueres itself is very nice to visit.

reviewnospace:
I enjoyed my visit to this museum, but it is a little strange. The art is displayed in circular corridors so it makes every area very crowded. There was some great stuff there but no information, so I didn't learn anything about Dali. However, I still enjoyed it and its worth a visit, and it was nice to potter around Figures little shops and restaurants too.

We didn't buy advance tickets as they are only timed for a 20 minute window which we worried we would make it for. So we arrived at 9.30 and there was a queue of 10 people, but by the time we left at 11.30 the queue was right around the block.

If you are driving head for Carrer del Rec Arnau where there is a big free car park and loads of free street parking and its just a few streets north of the museum (about 5 mins walk), rather than using the expensive city centre multi-storeys.

reviewnospace: nice and good museum, interesting to see all his work and try to understand his mind. Take a couble of hour but the time gone fast

reviewnospace: Buy your ticket in advance otherwise you'll be standing in a line for ages. Take a guided tour, you'll get information that you can't find it by yourself.
titleopinion: Take a guide tour. Buy your ticket in advance otherwise you'll be standing in a line for ages. Take a guided tour, you'll get information that you can't find it by yourself.

reviewnospace:
There was quite a queue to get in to this popular museum, and when it gets very busy they can introduce timed admission. We queued for about 45 minutes to get tickets but once inside soon forgot about our wait as there is lots to see. The galleries are numbered with a suggested visiting order so you shouldn't miss anything.
Bags are not permitted inside but a free staffed cloakroom is provided. Bags can be collected upon exiting with your token (It was nice to walk around without my bag anyway).
Photography is permitted but not with flash to protect the artworks. Toilets are provided in the lower part of the museum near to the entrance.
Tickets can be purchased in advance

A very busy but none the less fascinating museum/gallery
Worth queueing for.
titleopinion: Mad genius. There was quite a queue to get in to this popular museum, and when it gets very busy they can introduce timed admission. We queued for about 45 minutes to get tickets but once inside soon forgot about our wait as there is lots to see. The galleries are numbered with a suggested visiting order so you shouldn't miss anything. Bags are not permitted inside but a free staffed cloakroom is provided. Bags can be collected upon exiting with your token (It was nice to walk around without my bag anyway). Photography is permitted but not with flash to protect the artworks. Toilets are provided in the lower part of the museum near to the entrance.  Tickets can be purchased in advance  A very busy but none the less fascinating museum/gallery  Worth queueing for.

quote: Magical, intriguing museum showing a great selection of Dali's artwork
reviewnospace: Booked tickets online (easier to get during busy vacation periods. The building in itself is already worth the visit - amazing with this glass coupola. Inside you can see some of the earlier black and white works of Dali but also the famous painted ceiling striving to look like the Sistine chapel in Rome and many other paintings. Don't miss Dali's jewels, the entrance to this separate exhibition is included in the entry price. These jewels are amazing and so inventive.
titleopinion: Magical, intriguing museum showing a great selection of Dali's artwork. Booked tickets online (easier to get during busy vacation periods. The building in itself is already worth the visit - amazing with this glass coupola. Inside you can see some of the earlier black and white works of Dali but also the famous painted ceiling striving to look like the Sistine chapel in Rome and many other paintings. Don't miss Dali's jewels, the entrance to this separate exhibition is included in the entry price. These jewels are amazing and so inventive.

quote: Perfect place to fully envisage the world of Dali
reviewnospace:
The Dali museum is built according to the directions of Dali himself and gives a great insight in the man and his art. Beautiful pictures and sculptures show the development of this great artist and his own style. You will see from the biggest of painting to tiny small paintings with enormous attention for detail.

Be aware that some of the most famous pictures are often lend out to other musea and might not be present during your visit (hence the 4 star rating)
titleopinion: Perfect place to fully envisage the world of Dali. The Dali museum is built according to the directions of Dali himself and gives a great insight in the man and his art. Beautiful pictures and sculptures show the development of this great artist and his own style. You will see from the biggest of painting to tiny small paintings with enormous attention for detail.  Be aware that some of the most famous pictures are often lend out to other musea and might not be present during your visit (hence the 4 star rating)

reviewnospace: Amazing place. Set out in a really interesting way. A little expensive (well it IS Dali...) but very interesting, with some of his best known works e.g. Mae West, The Spectre of Sex. Alas, no Autumn Cannabilsm or Persistence of Memory - except in tapestry form). If you book in advance you need to hang around the advance ticket door (to the left of the main entrance), and they will let you in just before your allotted time. Saves queueing in the blazing heat.

reviewnospace: Beautiful, saw it few years back, must visit again, so many things to see, speechless, recommend for everyone no matter the age or preferances towards art, this just has to be seen.

reviewnospace: Perfect place for art, hystory in very specific synergy and display, very, very impressive and large facility, great for stop-over during travel

reviewnospace:
The Dali museum is crazy and beautiful. We went at our daughter's (6) pace so faster than we would normally, but there is so much to see that it is almost too much to take in.

Go early in the day - it opens at 10. And gets very crowded quickly
titleopinion: Great place to visit. The Dali museum is crazy and beautiful. We went at our daughter's (6) pace so faster than we would normally, but there is so much to see that it is almost too much to take in.   Go early in the day - it opens at 10. And gets very crowded quickly

reviewnospace: You listen and read about this museum, know something about Dali and have seen his work before, but anyway, once you enter the door - you're stunned! It is definitely diferrent from everything I have previously seen in museums. Even his works, because in this setting, they just seem to belong. Everything I thought was mysterious or unclear about Dali's art just clears and comes to its place. The inner garden and the great room in the basement are, naturally, the most beautiful. The artworks there are fascinating, both because of their grandeur, as well as the manner they were created. But, the building itself is also magnificent, with narrow hallways and dark, mysterious rooms. The whole collection is beautifully arranged in this unusual space. To put it shortly - for any art lover, this museum should not be missed! And the important addition - it is CROWDED, so either come early (10 a.m. like we did and waited only 5 minutes in line) or pre-book the tickets. You'll need at least two hours to see everything, so take some water in summer months because it gets warm inside some smaller rooms. I read some comments that it can be claustrophobic but I definitely didn't have that feeling, even though I don't like to be in a crowd. It's just important to plan the visit and prepare to enjoy some of the most impressive art you'll ever see!

reviewnospace:
From Barcelona its a two hour train.
Easy to arrange at £32 each person return.
The museum was easy to find (15 min walk) with a Tourist Information site in the railway station with a map of the town provided.
The Dali museum was great (book in advance) we did not and had one hour queuing in the hot weather !
Entry was reasonably priced with plenty to see inside and shops to buy!

The museum was easy to find (15 min walk) with a Tourist Information site in the railway station with a map of the town provided. The Dali museum was great (book in advance) we did not and had one hour queuing in the hot weather ! Entry was reasonably priced with plenty to see inside and shops to buy!

reviewnospace: Having looked up the museum online I noticed that they offered evening visits, so thought that this would be nice. I am so glad that I did. The museum takes on a life of its own at night, quite a magical place, my wife had quite an emotional response to it. The free glass of Cava sitting on the terrace watching a film of Dali's renovation of the teatro really added to the whole experience.

The museum was great experience for all of us although as others wrote here before there are no explanations at all (you can't even understand who is the artist who created each piece of art).

reviewnospace: Well worth a visit whether you are a fan or not. Once you have seen this exhibition you will be a fan!
titleopinion: Surreal. Well worth a visit whether you are a fan or not. Once you have seen this exhibition you will be a fan!

reviewnospace:
If you're visiting Barcelona add an extra day to do a day trip to figueres so that you can visit the Dali museum.

The works on show are absolutely stunning. Whether you get him or not the sheer breadth of art is amazing.

When you think Dali you think surrealism but there's so much more to him.

Bring some dollar and 20 cent euro coins as some exhibits are better enjoyed when a small coin donation is given.

Words really can't express how amazing this place is!
titleopinion: Absolute must do. If you're visiting Barcelona add an extra day to do a day trip to figueres so that you can visit the Dali museum.   The works on show are absolutely stunning. Whether you get him or not the sheer breadth of art is amazing.   When you think Dali you think surrealism but there's so much more to him.  Bring some dollar and 20 cent euro coins as some exhibits are better enjoyed when a small coin donation is given.   Words really can't express how amazing this place is!

quote: Great museum. Get there early to avoid long queue
reviewnospace: Not a huge fan of Dali really, but was nearby and decided to go with the family. Really glad we made the effort as it was a great morning. A huge collection of his work - though many of his most famous pieces are in New York or London. There's almost too much to see. We arrived at 10am in August and queued for only 20 mins, but when we came out at 12:30 I'd estimate the queue to be at least 2 hours long. It's a great setting for the museum too. Would really recommend.

quote: A must-visit for any fan of Salvador Dali's work

reviewnospace:
Uncle Salvador liked putting a big show, and oh my this is one.

Visited the museum by night, which is magical. The guided tour is well worth it. Would also suggest staying a bit later, as the museum empties around midnight and you get the whole place on your own. Truly incredible. Loved it.

Would also suggest staying a bit later, as the museum empties around midnight and you get the whole place on your own. Truly incredible. Loved it.

quote: A Wondeful Way to Enter the World of Dali
reviewnospace: Surprise, after surprise, after surprise, even if you know Dali's work. It is well worth visiting. Dali's genius with message, use of light, optics, space is apparent throughout the theatre-museum. It is both!

reviewnospace:
Very busy, the line for tickets was 60 or 70 long at 10am so buy your timed tickets on the internet and miss the queue. The two adjacent car parks are very expensive and were full. The first is very tight for a large car, be warned. However free car parking is available within five minutes walk. - Rec Arnau on the satnav.
To the museum - what a brilliant variety of art. From the weird to fun and then serious. Something for everyone.

reviewnospace: Prolific artist with work displayed over several floors. Some huge statement pieces and there again some amusing "interactive" pieces. Over a decade has passed since I last visited this awesome museum. I hope it won't be another ten years before I see it again
titleopinion: Dali does not disappoint. Prolific artist with work displayed over several floors. Some huge statement pieces and there again some amusing  interactive  pieces. reviewnospace: Whether you're passionate about Dali''s work or just casually want to explore it, this museum is good fun for all. It may not have the majority of his most famous pieces but there's plenty to appreciate. Location is also great -- may bars and restaurants around it, in the charming little Spanish roads.

It may not have the majority of his most famous pieces but there's plenty to appreciate. Location is also great -- may bars and restaurants around it, in the charming little Spanish roads.

reviewnospace:
For the funs of Dali it is a must to visit his "home". For the rest it will be an experience...
Nothing less than you could expect from this genius artist.
The building itself as well as the contents of this museum pays back the visitor.
Early drawings and paintings up to latest creations of this unique artist are all here.
You need time to carefully study
And understand Dali 's art, however even a short visit will give you an idea if his magic world.
Just keep eyes and mind open...

You need time to carefully study And understand Dali 's art, however even a short visit will give you an idea if his magic world. Just keep eyes and mind open...

reviewnospace: This is a really cool place if you are into Dali. Since Dali oversaw its building and curation, it is kind of like a monument to himself, and it is no less than you would expect. Many many great works, from throughout his career, in many media, well presented and laid out, in a spectacular old building in Figueres. There was a special exhibit on Dali's jewelry which we loved, wish we hadn't done it first but we kind of stumbled into it upon arrival. We enjoyed the easy day trip from S'Agaro where we were staying and we thought this museum was much better and better organized than the Museo Picasso in Barcelona, but both are worth seeing. My 16yo daughter is heading back to her visual arts high school magnet this week with all kinds of inspiration! Dali was such a wonderfully eccentric and fascinating figure, this is an amazing tribute to his talent and artistic ego...
