reviewnospace: What can I say, you have to know the life and art of Salvatore Dalí. An amazing experiencing seeing his art over the years. His major art obviously is in collector hands. But Dalí designed the art for this museum. He also designed the building to his crypt.
titleopinion: Must see...Figueres Spain. What can I say, you have to know the life and art of Salvatore Dalí. An amazing experiencing seeing his art over the years. His major art obviously is in collector hands. But Dalí designed the art for this museum. He also designed the building to his crypt.

reviewnospace: It is as much an experience as a museum/gallery. Designed by Dali himself, it aims to be a surrealist object rather than a gallery, and provides an extraordinary setting for all the works that are displayed. Dali always surprises you: he appears as mad as a box of frogs but produced some amazing works that both delight and disturb. He is sometimes over the top - as in the gallery of photos of his moustache in different positions - but there are some little treasures, like the jewellery (a brooch of ruby lips and teeth of pearls, literally). It did shock us to see Dali's own tomb in the place - this was possibly not his own choice, since he always wanted to be buried beside his wife, Gala, at their castle in Pubol, out in the countryside. The Theatre-Museum is a very popular attraction, so book in advance, or get there early if you don't want to queue for hours in the sun.
titleopinion: Unique and eccentric experience. It is as much an experience as a museum/gallery. Designed by Dali himself, it aims to be a surrealist object rather than a gallery, and provides an extraordinary setting for all the works that are displayed. Dali always surprises you: he appears as mad as a box of frogs but produced some amazing works that both delight and disturb. He is sometimes over the top - as in the gallery of photos of his moustache in different positions - but there are some little treasures, like the jewellery (a brooch of ruby lips and teeth of pearls, literally). It did shock us to see Dali's own tomb in the place - this was possibly not his own choice, since he always wanted to be buried beside his wife, Gala, at their castle in Pubol, out in the countryside. The Theatre-Museum is a very popular attraction, so book in advance, or get there early if you don't want to queue for hours in the sun.

reviewnospace:
Once of the best museums we have ever been to. We have purchased tickets online in advance worrying of huge line up during high season. Once we got there, we understood that tickets at the entrance are actually cheaper and the line to get that wasn't too bad ( around 30 mins wait). The museum itself is a unique collection of
interesting paintings, sculpture, engineering art, and other works to see. There you can also see jewellery works of Dali and a dedicated floor to his paintings dedicated to Aliyah. Definitely a museum worth visiting, no need to buy tickets in advance.
titleopinion: Unique and absolutely amazing!. Once of the best museums we have ever been to. We have purchased tickets online in advance worrying of huge line up during high season. Once we got there, we understood that tickets at the entrance are actually cheaper and the line to get that wasn't too bad ( around 30 mins wait). The museum itself is a unique collection of  interesting paintings, sculpture, engineering art, and other works to see. There you can also see jewellery works of Dali and a dedicated floor to his paintings dedicated to Aliyah. Definitely a museum worth visiting, no need to buy tickets in advance.

reviewnospace:
Book your tickets a few days early and pick your time. DON'T WAIT IN THAT LINE! Breeze past the hoards of people to more hoards inside. Just a few tips.
1. Don't try to follow some flow of traffic within. There is not a pattern flow. People do get a little pushy in the entrance but then it's much easier.
2. Children under 2 are often wigging out. Poor things can't even see the weird painting and they'll probably have nightmares. They will love it later but not under 6. Just don't do it!
3. Do the Museum FIRST and the jewellery SECOND. This little tidbit was from a doorman. More time needs to be spend doing all the floors. And the suggested itinerary is actually nice to have.
4. You'll probably need 3hrs to do both. We did it with our 8 & 9 year olds. Saw the good stuff and more.
5. As others say, read SOMETHING about him. Read wikipedia or something similar. Make it a treasure hunt for all.
6. Oh, there is parking all around. If you've got a bigger car you'll look a little longer. Or bring a can opener.

reviewnospace: Be aware that local organised groups and advanced ticket sales get priority so if you are staying local and want to pop in ! Don't you will just end up waiting hours and then it closes !
titleopinion: Warning 2-4 hour waiting . Be aware that local organised groups and advanced ticket sales get priority so if you are staying local and want to pop in ! Don't you will just end up waiting hours and then it closes !

reviewnospace: This is a truly amazing museum. Take a guided tour, otherwise you will miss so many interesting details about his art work and stories about Dali and his life. I think Dali is our times Leonardo da Vinci. You must visit if you are in the neighborhood.

reviewnospace:
Dalí-lover or not... if you like things that are obscure and strange, you will LOVE this place.

One of my favorite places in Spain!!
titleopinion: Absolutely amazing!. Dalí-lover or not... if you like things that are obscure and strange, you will LOVE this place.   One of my favorite places in Spain!!

quote: One of the best museums I have ever been
reviewnospace:
Situated in a small town of Figueres, I would not expect a huuuuuuge line for tickets at the Dali Museum. My girlfriend and I arrived there around 13.00 and had to wait on line for about 2hrs to get tickets. So I STRONGLY recommend to get tickets online and at least a day before. But make sure you arrive there on time. Because if you are late for more than 30minutes for the time your tickets are for they are cancelled and you wont be able to get in. Theoretically, but practically you can negotiate with guards at the entrance.
Frankly speaking, I am not a big fan on museums, but Dali impressed me a lot. So far I think this museum is my favorite. Many interesting paintings, sculpture, engineering art, and other works to see. There you can also see jewellery works of Dali.

reviewnospace:
Having returned from my holiday I am compelled to leave a review because my wife's review has been removed .
We visited the Dali Museum on 4th August with my daughter , who is a wheelchair user and four other family members . At the entrance we were told that access to the museum for wheelchairs can be made through a side entrance and was shown the way by a member of the museum staff . We were ushered into a narrow overcrowded corridor and then informed that wheelchair access is only possible to a small part of the exhibits and to follow the person to the ticket office to purchase the tickets .
The place was packed ...too many people crammed into narrow corridors , not an environment suitable for a wheelchair user at all. Once at the ticket office we informed the museum manager , who was taking the money for entrance tickets , about it's unsuitability and that we had decided not to see the exhibition . He then refused to let us out until we paid him €70 even though we had only walked 30 meters down the corridor from the side entrance to the ticket office , had been in the place for 3 mins and then took my bag as soon sort of ransom . He was a rude , odious , horrible individual who had no customer skills what so ever . In the ensuing 20 mins he would listen to no reason and continued demanding the €70 , which we eventually paid to get my bag back and gain an exit for my daughter in her wheelchair.
Can not comment on the exhibition as we did not see it .
A horrible, horrible experience in an overly crowded building , managed by a Basil Fawlty manager and made to pay €70 for the pleasure ......AVOID IT LIKE THE PLAGE .

reviewnospace:
Not a fan of Dali but my wife was keen to see it and, given it was on our way home, seemed silly not to stop by. Very imaginatively displayed and wide variety of art. I liked a lot of his early stuff which seems less self-indulgent and pretentious ( or at least that's how it seems ). Really glad I went. The building in itself is interesting inside and out. One remark was that there was not much by way of explanation,just titles. Think I would have liked to have had an audio guide. It does feel a little like: this man's a genius and great son of Figueres: don't question it !

One final trip: paying car park right next to museum which feels like Dali designed it. Convenient but a tight squeeze !
titleopinion: Better than expected. Not a fan of Dali but my wife was keen to see it and, given it was on our way home, seemed silly not to stop by. reviewnospace: we were on a great tour of Spain, Portugal, Gibraltar with a sharp guide who obtained tickets in advance. I was familiar works but the volume and staging were well worth the time. Unlike far too many so-called nonrepresentational artists, Dali's technical accomplishments as well as his compositional content continue to amaze. Whether viewing his oils, statues, holographic presentations, installations (especially the multilevel series of sculptures and paintings - one is left in awe of this artist.

And the line is very long, not like other attractions in Catalonia where there is time reservation based on statistics

reviewnospace: Took a day trip via Viator and everything worked perfectly. The package included taxi to train station, hour train to Figueres, guided tour of museum. The museum was very interesting, also for our younger children of 9 and 13. I had read up on Dali beforehand and that was very useful.
titleopinion: A must see! . Took a day trip via Viator and everything worked perfectly. The package included taxi to train station, hour train to Figueres, guided tour of museum. The museum was very interesting, also for our younger children of 9 and 13. I had read up on Dali beforehand and that was very useful.

reviewnospace: very interesting and uniqe museum.A must to see.i pre orderd tickets on the interenet and queed lines.
titleopinion: great museum. very interesting and uniqe museum.A must to see.i pre orderd tickets on the interenet and queed lines.

reviewnospace: I took a train from Barcelona Sants, and the trip took only about an hour. Then it was a pleasant 20 minute walk to the museum. The town has excellent signage, making it difficult to get lost. Loved the walk through the town, passing a market, some great shoe shops, a shop that sold ribbons and sewing trims (something I was looking for if I came across it) There was a line up for tickets but it moved quickly. The route through the museum goes up and down levels, and while each room is numbered I think I missed some. The 2nd part of the museum was next door and featured beautiful jewelry pieces Dali designed. I noticed there were lots of cafes in the area, but I was heading right back to Barcelona. This was a great museum, and a must see.
titleopinion: Great day trip. I took a train from Barcelona Sants, and the trip took only about an hour. Then it was a pleasant 20 minute walk to the museum. The town has excellent signage, making it difficult to get lost. quote: Not into art but very interesting....
reviewnospace: OK I flunked out of Art at school, and really had little interest in it. But I have to say this place is worth the visit. Even with three kids in tow it was a great experience. Four floors of bonkers art!!!
titleopinion: Not into art but very interesting..... OK I flunked out of Art at school, and really had little interest in it. But I have to say this place is worth the visit. Even with three kids in tow it was a great experience. Four floors of bonkers art!!!

reviewnospace: An extraordinary experience. We went to the night viewing in August and "dived in" to Dali's world. There are many early works, some very beautiful: especially featuring his wife. Best bit was at 12.15 am when all the guided tours had finished. And in the little square on the way out, a glass of cava listening to music chosen by Dali with his glittering "compound eye" dome and starry sky overhead. Truly theatrical, as Dali promised in the name of his museum.
titleopinion: Cant be missed . An extraordinary experience. We went to the night viewing in August and  dived in  to Dali's world. There are many early works, some very beautiful: especially featuring his wife. Best bit was at 12.15 am when all the guided tours had finished. And in the little square on the way out, a glass of cava listening to music chosen by Dali with his glittering  compound eye  dome and starry sky overhead. Truly theatrical, as Dali promised in the name of his museum.

quote: Great museum - even better if you know something about Dali
reviewnospace: We got the fast train from Barcelona Sants (return tickets about 34 euros each). Journey takes less than an hour but then you have to get a bus / taxi. We got the bus there (less than two euros each) but then had a small problem finding museum as not far but not signposted too well. Museum does not allow on line booking at peak times to be prepared to queue as only one ticket window. Once in it is crowded (often with tour groups) but not too bad. Lots of great art - which is what you want. No café or refreshments inside - several on square outside. Got taxi back to train station - nine euros.
titleopinion: Great museum - even better if you know something about Dali. We got the fast train from Barcelona Sants (return tickets about 34 euros each). reviewnospace:
Definitely Worth the visit. We spent 1-2 hours in there.
Tip: take the fast train from Barcelona at 8:25am which arrives at 9:20am. buy museum tickets in advance for 9:30am. It was very busy when we left.
titleopinion: Very good day trip. Definitely Worth the visit. We spent 1-2 hours in there. Tip: take the fast train from Barcelona at 8:25am which arrives at 9:20am. buy museum tickets in advance for 9:30am. It was very busy when we left.

reviewnospace:
we rent a car for one day and got to the museum
it iwas great attraction for us and very interesting.
it is best to book your tickets in advance as they get sold out
it is 2 hours drive from Barcelona we had a GPS and it was very easy to find
after the museum we got to quadakas (his house) and then to Girona
it was a great trip with the car.
i advice to rent a car and get to this 3 locations
Girona was the best of this day
titleopinion: great attraction for all. we rent a car for one day and got to the museum it iwas great attraction for us and very interesting. it is best to book your tickets in advance as they get sold out it is 2 hours drive from Barcelona we had a GPS and it was very easy to find after the museum we got to quadakas (his house) and then to Girona  it was a great trip with the car. i advice to rent a car and get to this 3 locations  Girona was the best of this day

reviewnospace:
We arrived at the museum and when the guard saw that my mother had a walker he directed us to where we could enter without standing in the long line for tickets. That was great. We entered and I purchased our tickets. We viewed his work on the first floor and asked about an elevator. None but a ramp to the second floor. That was ok but there were steps to each room and no ramp to the exhibits on the third floor. We were looking forward to going to the museum and it was marred by this. My mother sat in the second level lobby next to a gentleman in a wheel chair. I hurried thru so they my wouldn't be left alone. They never said anything when I purchased the tickets.

I loved it, but I need to score it lower necessitate of this.

quote: not worth the hassle or expense.
reviewnospace: The reason for the poor rating is that there are so many people you cannot stand still for 30seconds to look at the paintings or drawrings. The corridors are very narrow so you have to either keep moving or wait for the people in front to move on. We bought our tickets on line for an alloted time but still the place was rammed with tourists. Tickets and train tickets cost 100 euro for two people. It was a horrible experience and I hope the people who run this place limit the amount of peolple who enter at any one time more so than they are doing so now. If you are planning a trip from barcelona then I would not waist your time and money doing this trip.

reviewnospace: We visited the museum on a rainy day and can say it was worth the drive. It was fascinating. He clearly had a strange mind. Some of the displays were bizarre but he was obviously talented.
titleopinion: Interesting and at times strange . We visited the museum on a rainy day and can say it was worth the drive. It was fascinating. He clearly had a strange mind. Some of the displays were bizarre but he was obviously talented.

quote: Mind-Bending Eye Candy for the Open-Minded
reviewnospace: Dali is Dali, that said, a visit to his Theatre-Museo in Girona will push the envelope of surrealism for even the most prepared visitor. I loved this place. The visit was an experience. Take the time just to look at things from across the rooms and from multiple perspectives-this place we created to be explored like no other museum I have encountered!

I loved this place. The visit was an experience. Take the time just to look at things from across the rooms and from multiple perspectives-this place we created to be explored like no other museum I have encountered!

quote: Touristic and artistic trip to mind of Dali..
reviewnospace: It was fascinating,strongly recommend to see his world, surprising art works,decoration..indeed everything..and don't pass Dali jewels,it was awesome..
titleopinion: Touristic and artistic trip to mind of Dali... It was fascinating,strongly recommend to see his world, surprising art works,decoration..indeed everything..and don't pass Dali jewels,it was awesome..

reviewnospace: Wow, this museum is so interesting! It's located in the centre of Figueres and it will blow your mind!
titleopinion: Awesome museum!. Wow, this museum is so interesting! It's located in the centre of Figueres and it will blow your mind!

reviewnospace: We just spent 3 hours at the Dali museum, what an incredible talent & body of work enhanced in a fantastic environment designed by the man himself. It's hard to describe or give it justice with amateur photos, but I highly recommend you visit with plenty of time to spare so you have time to pause, sit & enjoy it. There is some wheel chair access, its air conditioned and it is just amazing! You don't really need a guided tour.

It's hard to describe or give it justice with amateur photos, but I highly recommend you visit with plenty of time to spare so you have time to pause, sit & enjoy it. There is some wheel chair access, its air conditioned and it is just amazing! You don't really need a guided tour.

reviewnospace:
For my 3de visit there I came with my children.
They enjoyed this place as much as me!
If you pass near to figueres you must stop there!
The visit take around 2 hours without guide.
titleopinion: Wonderful place. For my 3de visit there I came with my children. They enjoyed this place as much as me! If you pass near to figueres you must stop there!  The visit take around 2 hours without guide.

quote: Book online in advance to avoid huge queues
reviewnospace: Allow a minimum of 3 hours to see this museum. There are multiple rooms with thousands of pieces to see. Definitely book online in advance. We went to the E-Ticket window, showed my phone and walked straight in the door. The queue for tickets on the day was at least 100 metres long by 10am

reviewnospace: This museum was designed by Dali and it is a whole experience of his art, the setting, the way works are displayed. Some of his art has moving parts and are coin operated, so good to have some coins with you. We went late in the day and stayed at Hotel Duran for the evening.
titleopinion: Not your average art museum. This museum was designed by Dali and it is a whole experience of his art, the setting, the way works are displayed. Some of his art has moving parts and are coin operated, so good to have some coins with you. We went late in the day and stayed at Hotel Duran for the evening.

reviewnospace: I stayed at hotel Duran and came for the museum on the next day. The whole thing was such a nice experience... The museum is quite big, I stayed in there around 3 hours and an extra one to see the Dali jewels museum, so you can visit the whole complex in an afternoon or morning, but Figueres is such a cute town it is worth spending the night and going to dinner at the Duran restaurant. Also if you'd like something in the museum shop it seems that you can only access it from inside the museum, so better take it! I couldn't stop thinking about the little elephants...
titleopinion: Really, you should go. I stayed at hotel Duran and came for the museum on the next day. The whole thing was such a nice experience... quote: Very nice collection of Dali's work
reviewnospace: Very well preserved, well managed and easy to reach via public transport, this comprehensive collection of Dali's work is indeed a must visit for all art lovers. The adjascent Dali Jewels show is an additional icing on the cake!
titleopinion: Very nice collection of Dali's work. Very well preserved, well managed and easy to reach via public transport, this comprehensive collection of Dali's work is indeed a must visit for all art lovers. The adjascent Dali Jewels show is an additional icing on the cake!

quote: If you love Dali you MUST go here.
reviewnospace: Love this place, having seen Dali's interview on video about when he found this building & the things he had planned, as a 12 year old kid it planted a seed, which 1 day I knew I would bloom into seeing it for myself. A must for any Dali lover, It does get very busy so plan your day wisely.

reviewnospace: Unbelievable experience. Try to go in the early hours as it gets crowded later. This guy was the man with unlimited creativity..
titleopinion: Vrazy crazy crazy . Unbelievable experience. Try to go in the early hours as it gets crowded later. This guy was the man with unlimited creativity..

reviewnospace: Well if you don't already know, words cannot express the artistic genius that Salvador Dali is. This museum will give you more than a glimpse of his psyche and talent. So if you are in Spain EVER then definitely make it a point to see this museum!! Dali created this museum and it covers much of his early works. But be advised that there are lot of stairs and as far as I observed no elevator.

But be advised that there are lot of stairs and as far as I observed no elevator.

quote: Amazing collections of Dali Art and Jewelry
reviewnospace:
This museum is very popular during summer tourist season so online booking is a must to save time. I am glad we did because ticket line was quite long when we got there.

We were told to start with the Jewel room and wow I didn't know Dali designed such an amazing and eclectic sets of jewelry pieces. This talented artistic man never cease to be amazing.

The museum itself had so much of his work in different levels of the building but we only had 2 hours so we tried to only spend time on his work, not by other artists but one can easily spend a good 3-4 hours just taking in all the twisted genius of a man's work. We were all glad we made the trip out there while visiting Barcelona.

reviewnospace: Well worth a visit, I'm not an art person and I had to get my teenage daughter to explain a lot to me (!!!) which was worrying but really enjoyed my time there. To say the guy had issues and was complicated is probably safe enough but open your mind and have a ball!
titleopinion: Interesting . Well worth a visit, I'm not an art person and I had to get my teenage daughter to explain a lot to me (!!!) which was worrying but really enjoyed my time there. To say the guy had issues and was complicated is probably safe enough but open your mind and have a ball!

reviewnospace: So worth the drive from Barcelona... Go with a guide - Dali's work is best seen with an expert who can explain some of the complexities of his art. And give yourself enough time to really explore the museum. The breath and depth of Dali's work is impressive and so much more than melting clocks!
titleopinion: WOW!. So worth the drive from Barcelona... Go with a guide - Dali's work is best seen with an expert who can explain some of the complexities of his art. And give yourself enough time to really explore the museum. The breath and depth of Dali's work is impressive and so much more than melting clocks!

quote: Amazing Art; go early to avoid crowds
reviewnospace:
The museum has an astounding collection of Salvador Dali's art - paintings, sculptures, jewellery and other creations.

Much of it is totally bonkers - fun, silly, sometimes risqué - but always amazing and intriguing. The 'serious' items are really amazing - he was an accomplished painter.

The actual museum is a bit of a rabbit warren - lots of rooms connected by corridors and stairs. It can be quite claustrophobic to be stuck on the stairs while some guided tour marches past.

Great for children of all ages, limited access for wheelchairs or people who need assistance walking.

Much of it is totally bonkers - fun, silly, sometimes risqué - but always amazing and intriguing. The 'serious' items are really amazing - he was an accomplished painter.  The actual museum is a bit of a rabbit warren - lots of rooms connected by corridors and stairs. It can be quite claustrophobic to be stuck on the stairs while some guided tour marches past.  Great for children of all ages, limited access for wheelchairs or people who need assistance walking.

reviewnospace: If you are into art this museum is a must. The art itself is magnificent, and the same is to be said about the building. The museum displays the single largest and most diverse collection of works by Salvador Dalí, the core of which was from the artist's personal collection. One of the most spectacular museums I have ever been to. I wish I could be there on a day when there were less people there, but I guess it's not possible.
titleopinion: A must . If you are into art this museum is a must. The art itself is magnificent, and the same is to be said about the building. The museum displays the single largest and most diverse collection of works by Salvador Dalí, the core of which was from the artist's personal collection. One of the most spectacular museums I have ever been to. I wish I could be there on a day when there were less people there, but I guess it's not possible.

quote: It's Dali...what more is there to say?!
reviewnospace:
A lot of early work of this amazing artist, with only a few of his "famous" pieces.

Regardless, completely worth the trip. From Barcelona I took the train from Passieg de Gracia train station - no need to go to Sants. The trip was about 2 hours, but the high speed train (about 50 min.) is also available. The museum is then only about a 10 minute walk from the train station with signs guiding you all the way. It's my understanding the the high speed train drops you off at a different station further out of town.

I did not pre-book tickets for my Friday visit, but got there early enough to avoid any lines. The place gets a lot of visitors, so it can be difficult to really study a piece with so many people zipping by. And you know his detailed and symbolic work needs to be looked at slowly and carefully!

I didn't know that his jewelry collection was in a separate building and missed it. Also, Dali is entombed at his museum, but didn't locate any info about that. Or maybe I just missed it, too.

If you have the time, walk up the hill to Castell de Sant Ferran for an entirely different history lesson!

If you're a fan of his art or Surrealism in general, do yourself a favor and go to this museum! Oh yes, take some Euro coins too, as some of his art is activated by money (just like us all).

If you have the time, walk up the hill to Castell de Sant Ferran for an entirely different history lesson!  If you're a fan of his art or Surrealism in general, do yourself a favor and go to this museum! Oh yes, take some Euro coins too, as some of his art is activated by money (just like us all).

reviewnospace: We traveled to Figures from Barcelona on a regional train - taking about 1.5 hours. The museum, which was designed by Dali, showcases his art. Additionally, there is an adjoining museum of jewelry created by the artist. It is an easy 1/2 day trip from Barcelona and we would recommend it to visitors. We pre-purchased our tickets which made for easy access at the opening hour.
titleopinion: Unusual, quirky museum. We traveled to Figures from Barcelona on a regional train - taking about 1.5 hours. The museum, which was designed by Dali, showcases his art. Additionally, there is an adjoining museum of jewelry created by the artist. It is an easy 1/2 day trip from Barcelona and we would recommend it to visitors. We pre-purchased our tickets which made for easy access at the opening hour.

reviewnospace: This museum truly gives you the opportunity to understand how perspective was employed in Dali's works. It was just fascinating. So much to see. One could really spend some time here contemplating how deeply he delved into himself, reflecting inward and upon all of the craziness in Europe in his time period. We wish there had been an audio guide to give us more insight, being art enthusiasts, but totally amateur. The courtyard and entry hall to me, are the highlights, but there is so much more to see! It was a plus that we had not booked tickets ahead of time, but there was little to no line, and we got right in.
titleopinion: Mind Blowing. This museum truly gives you the opportunity to understand how perspective was employed in Dali's works. It was just fascinating. So much to see. One could really spend some time here contemplating how deeply he delved into himself, reflecting inward and upon all of the craziness in Europe in his time period. We wish there had been an audio guide to give us more insight, being art enthusiasts, but totally amateur. The courtyard and entry hall to me, are the highlights, but there is so much more to see! It was a plus that we had not booked tickets ahead of time, but there was little to no line, and we got right in.

reviewnospace: After a lovely visit to the Gala Castle at Pubol, hopes were high. Having my small handbag snatched away from me with purse, phone and everything, allegedly because it was a back back, was a bad start. Then entering the crowded museum with no direction and little interpretation made it very hard to get much out of the museum - as other reviewers have said, you can't even assume that the unlabelled works are by Dali and the layout is clumsy. I asked a friend to lend me the money for a (not cheap) guide book but it is not written as a practical visitor guide. When you add the off-hand / rude attitude of most of the staff, the overall impression was of having been ripped off and excluded from the Dali experience by lack of prior knowledge. The management of this museum have a lot to answer for.
titleopinion: Poorly managed and expensive. After a lovely visit to the Gala Castle at Pubol, hopes were high. Having my small handbag snatched away from me with purse, phone and everything, allegedly because it was a back back, was a bad start. Then entering the crowded museum with no direction and little interpretation made it very hard to get much out of the museum - as other reviewers have said, you can't even assume that the unlabelled works are by Dali and the layout is clumsy. I asked a friend to lend me the money for a (not cheap) guide book but it is not written as a practical visitor guide. When you add the off-hand / rude attitude of most of the staff, the overall impression was of having been ripped off and excluded from the Dali experience by lack of prior knowledge. The management of this museum have a lot to answer for.

reviewnospace: I somehow managed to persuade my mainly non-art loving (understatement) family to visit the Dali museum in Figueres! We arrived around 10:30am on the first Sunday in July after managing to park for free on a street about a 10 min walk from the museum! We were surprised to find only about 10 people in the queue so all headed into the museum on a family ticket - €58 for 2 adults and 3 teenagers. We spent an interesting and entertaining two hours meandering through the museum! I had studied Dali for A level History of Art many years before so knew a little of his work and thoroughly enjoyed the huge breadth of styles and medium on show - the only disappointment was that I was hoping to see more of his 'famous' paintings but they must be in museums around the world - I only recognised a version of the melting clocks piece 'The Persistence of Memory'. I have seen his 'Christ of Saint John of the Cross' in Kelvingrove Museum in Glasgow. The actual museum building is wonderfully eccentric, painted a deep rosy red with 'loaves of bread' stuck to the walls and huge white eggs perched on the roof! My family's comments included 'mad as a hatter!', 'what drugs was he on?' and 'total nutcase!' but they enjoyed their visit and can now boast that they have actually spent 2 hours of their lives in an art gallery - lol

reviewnospace:
We found the artwork fascinating and the museum well worth a visit. The only drawback being that there were no audio guides.
We tried to book online, but the website only had 9am and 5pm slots available which didn't suit us. We took a chance and arrived at the museum at around 10:30am. A short queue had formed by then, but we were in 20min later. By the time we left, the queue was much, much longer and snaking all the way down the road!!!! There are a number of parking garages behind the museum.
titleopinion: Fascinating . We found the artwork fascinating and the museum well worth a visit. The only drawback being that there were no audio guides.  We tried to book online, but the website only had 9am and 5pm slots available which didn't suit us. We took a chance and arrived at the museum at around 10:30am. A short queue had formed by then, but we were in 20min later. By the time we left, the queue was much, much longer and snaking all the way down the road!!!! There are a number of parking garages behind the museum.

quote: A must see! The genius in his own museum
reviewnospace: We are an art loving family, and our son who is 20 already visited the museum, but even his description didn't give it due credit. It is an amazing assemblage of the genius' work, done by him when he was still alive. The theatrical aspect of the museum is not lost on the artist, who was buried in it. I strongly recommend spending the money on a guided tour, as the paintings have so much hidden symbolism that it would take an extensive amount of time to decipher both the meaning and hidden messages in them. As a bonus, you get to skip the lines, and visit the jewelry museum of exquisite creations by the artist
titleopinion: A must see! The genius in his own museum. We are an art loving family, and our son who is 20 already visited the museum, but even his description didn't give it due credit. It is an amazing assemblage of the genius' work, done by him when he was still alive. The theatrical aspect of the museum is not lost on the artist, who was buried in it. I strongly recommend spending the money on a guided tour, as the paintings have so much hidden symbolism that it would take an extensive amount of time to decipher both the meaning and hidden messages in them. As a bonus, you get to skip the lines, and visit the jewelry museum of exquisite creations by the artist

reviewnospace: If you have never seen Dali's work this can be interesting. It was not our case. Reaction was like "OK... and?" Somehow we thought there is more of feeling, more of art or more madness since it is dedicated solo to Dali. So.. poor experience for me.
titleopinion: We expected more. If you have never seen Dali's work this can be interesting. It was not our case. Reaction was like  OK... and?  Somehow we thought there is more of feeling, more of art or more madness since it is dedicated solo to Dali. So.. poor experience for me.

reviewnospace: I was absolutely mesmerised by the quirky building and art. I spent many hours and took over 500 photos! We were the first time slot which allowed me to view a few corridors of art by myself. We had heard that student groups were loud and annoying, we did not find this, in fact they were very solicitous. I also enjoyed Dalis scrumptious and luxurious jewellery designs and pieces which are in a separate part of the museum. You exit from the museum proper and walk around the corner.
titleopinion: Do not miss it.. I was absolutely mesmerised by the quirky building and art. I spent many hours and took over 500 photos! We were the first time slot which allowed me to view a few corridors of art by myself. We had heard that student groups were loud and annoying, we did not find this, in fact they were very solicitous. I also enjoyed Dalis scrumptious and luxurious jewellery designs and pieces which are in a separate part of the museum. You exit from the museum proper and walk around the corner.

quote: Stunning experience for all Dali lovers
reviewnospace:
This museum is an amazing experience for anyone who likes Dali's work and probably for those who don't or don't know if they do!
A pilgrimage to Figueres to visit the museum is well worth the journey.
Take at least 2 hours to visit both the main museum and the jewelry exhibition next door
Also if staying in the area a visit to Cadaques to Dali's house will round of your trip and make an experience you will long remember
titleopinion: Stunning experience for all Dali lovers. This museum is an amazing experience for anyone who likes Dali's work and probably for those who don't or don't know if they do! A pilgrimage to Figueres to visit the museum is well worth the journey. quote: One of the best museum in whole spain
reviewnospace: First you need find a right entrance a prepare few coins (some 1 euro coins) for activation attraction inside which is not included in ticket price.
titleopinion: One of the best museum in whole spain. First you need find a right entrance a prepare few coins (some 1 euro coins) for activation attraction inside which is not included in ticket price.

reviewnospace: Town is great and museum is marvelous. Go and see if you are anywhere near of Girona. Dali was an extraordinary genius and the one of a kind.
titleopinion: Just great. Town is great and museum is marvelous. Go and see if you are anywhere near of Girona. Dali was an extraordinary genius and the one of a kind.

quote: Best place to see Dali's work
reviewnospace: i had heard so much about Salvador Dali from my father who loves art. This museum is truly reflection of his personality and showcases his best works in the best way. I was disappointed to see other artists work in this museum though. Also coming from Barcelona and seeing the Gaudi's house museums I feel there is more scope for the museum to improve. There can be electronic audio tour guides in various languages for example. Anyway, I am glad I found books on him in the museum shop.
titleopinion: Best place to see Dali's work. i had heard so much about Salvador Dali from my father who loves art. This museum is truly reflection of his personality and showcases his best works in the best way. I was disappointed to see other artists work in this museum though. Anyway, I am glad I found books on him in the museum shop.

reviewnospace: This Musuem was awesome in that it had a TON of DALI paintings, Art and other Treasures. You can read all about that in the Travel Books, My reason to Travel here was to see it ALL>>and it was worth it!! I do really enjoy Salvadore Dali and out of his world creativity. One Bonus that I was Not aware was that the Regular admission includes Tickets to his DALI JEWELS musuem. Amazing Jewelry that created from his Drawings. SUPER amazing. Bring a Good Camera for you will see some Amazing JEWELRY
titleopinion: SPAIN-2016. This Musuem was awesome in that it had a TON of DALI paintings, Art and other Treasures. reviewnospace:
I found many of the items on display to be challenging, not my style of art but this is where Dali lived and worked.

The pieces are diverse, everything from sculptures, paintings, sketches, and even the courtyard garden Dali is claimed to have built.
I can see many different influences in his work, obviously he developed his work through different periods and this is evident.
titleopinion: The kids loved it. . I found many of the items on display to be challenging, not my style of art but this is where Dali lived and worked.  The pieces are diverse, everything from sculptures, paintings, sketches, and even the courtyard garden Dali is claimed to have built.  I can see many different influences in his work, obviously he developed his work through different periods and this is evident.

quote: The museum as unique as his work!
reviewnospace: DALI didn't disappoint. The building itself and the layout of the exhibitsame were pure Dali. The different mediums he used and works were overwhelming that will leave you in awe of the man.
titleopinion: The museum as unique as his work!. DALI didn't disappoint. The building itself and the layout of the exhibitsame were pure Dali. The different mediums he used and works were overwhelming that will leave you in awe of the man.

reviewnospace: So glad we went to visit this museum. Was mind blowing and very powerful. There was so much to see and the price was very reasonable (€14 each). Would highly recommend anyone in the vicinity to visit. So many amazing pieces of art. You can easily lose a fair few hours exploring the art of this surrealist. It's a trip without even being on anything.
titleopinion: Falling down the rabbit hole. So glad we went to visit this museum. Was mind blowing and very powerful. There was so much to see and the price was very reasonable (€14 each). Would highly recommend anyone in the vicinity to visit. So many amazing pieces of art. You can easily lose a fair few hours exploring the art of this surrealist. quote: More amazing and enjoyable than I had ever imagined
reviewnospace: Hard to keep the smile off one's face as you see all the wonderful exhibits. Dali must have so enjoyed creating his theatre/museum. Apart from all the installations there are many wonderful paintings from the many different periods in Dali's life and works. The building itself seems a great joke and complements all the works inside. We spent over two hours there and could have stayed longer except it was becoming very crowded on a Saturday morning. Buy your tickets online and go early is my suggestion so you can really enjoy in detail these wonderful works
titleopinion: More amazing and enjoyable than I had ever imagined. Hard to keep the smile off one's face as you see all the wonderful exhibits. Dali must have so enjoyed creating his theatre/museum. quote: Explores Dali´s work beyond the familiar works
reviewnospace: Make sure you read the brochure before you start your tour. Certain rooms exhibit Dali´s work - but there are also rooms showing other artists! We liked the fact that it was not limited to the familiar works, but had various installations, sculptures - even jewelry. I could have benefitted from better interpretation/explanations of the different parts of the exhibit. Much of the museum is completely without commentary. You walk way having learned little about his life, or various periods - but you will have experienced his genius expressed in many different forms.
titleopinion: Explores Dali´s work beyond the familiar works. Make sure you read the brochure before you start your tour. Certain rooms exhibit Dali´s work - but there are also rooms showing other artists! We liked the fact that it was not limited to the familiar works, but had various installations, sculptures - even jewelry. I could have benefitted from better interpretation/explanations of the different parts of the exhibit. Much of the museum is completely without commentary. You walk way having learned little about his life, or various periods - but you will have experienced his genius expressed in many different forms.

quote: OK, It's Dali! What would you expect?
reviewnospace: This is at once a very interesting and a very frustrating museum. If you want to overdose on Dali (and why wouldn't you) then you really need to go here. The collection is extensive and marvelous. What is not marvelous is the layout of the museum itself, the lack of explanations (even dates and title are frequently missing) and in intermizing of the work of other artists without clearly identifying them.. You walk from room to room and often have to backtrack. You wonder into a room and find a work that causes you to say, "that doesn't look like Dali" and in fact it is not his work. This could be a great museum but it is not. It is a very good one if you like Dali.
titleopinion: OK, It's Dali! What would you expect?. This is at once a very interesting and a very frustrating museum. If you want to overdose on Dali (and why wouldn't you) then you really need to go here. The collection is extensive and marvelous. What is not marvelous is the layout of the museum itself, the lack of explanations (even dates and title are frequently missing) and in intermizing of the work of other artists without clearly identifying them.. You walk from room to room and often have to backtrack. You wonder into a room and find a work that causes you to say,  that doesn't look like Dali  and in fact it is not his work. This could be a great museum but it is not. It is a very good one if you like Dali.

reviewnospace: Learning about and seeing the wonders, creations, life would and artistic charisma of Salvador Dali was memorable and I would definitely return booking tickets before going made it especially more enjoyable as the queues can get long recommend going early morning to avoid the masses
titleopinion: Fantastic experience. Learning about and seeing the wonders, creations, life would and artistic charisma of Salvador Dali was memorable and I would definitely return booking tickets before going made it especially more enjoyable as the queues can get long recommend going early morning to avoid the masses

reviewnospace: We went to the Museum after going to the Dali house and found that underwhelming. The Museum is really a great place to tour. It shows Dali as the genius he is. The museum is well laid out with important art work displayed in thought-out manner. I would recommend all to go to the museum, and be sure to visit the jewelry building. My only regret is to not have had a tour guide.
titleopinion: Extremely Worthwhile visit. We went to the Museum after going to the Dali house and found that underwhelming. The Museum is really a great place to tour. It shows Dali as the genius he is. The museum is well laid out with important art work displayed in thought-out manner. I would recommend all to go to the museum, and be sure to visit the jewelry building. My only regret is to not have had a tour guide.

reviewnospace: We loved it! Although there are no guides it is a very interesting museum. A chance to open your head to new stuff. It is good to order tickets online to avoid the line
titleopinion: Great!. We loved it! Although there are no guides it is a very interesting museum. A chance to open your head to new stuff. It is good to order tickets online to avoid the line

quote: My favourite tour of the trip - an unexpected pleasure
reviewnospace: I loved this place. Had done no research prior to the visit and will admit to being Dali ignorant. Was just brilliant. I find his art captivating in its uniqueness and the Theatre is extremely well thought out. A must do if you are in Figueres.
titleopinion: My favourite tour of the trip - an unexpected pleasure. I loved this place. Had done no research prior to the visit and will admit to being Dali ignorant. Was just brilliant. I find his art captivating in its uniqueness and the Theatre is extremely well thought out. A must do if you are in Figueres.

quote: One of the three must-do's for Dali
reviewnospace: It's a dream inside. Literally, at moments you feel you may actually be touching the mind of Dali if you stop and really rest to look into and through his work. His absolute love/infatuation for Gala is unquestioned. Throughout the meseum Dali's brilliance is staring back at you at times satirical, painful, sharp, cutting and visionary. Most people go here not knowing he is buried here. You'll be surprised to see where he is interned - and captivated by those who don't know....idly walking past him and over him as they gaze around.
titleopinion: One of the three must-do's for Dali. It's a dream inside. Literally, at moments you feel you may actually be touching the mind of Dali if you stop and really rest to look into and through his work. His absolute love/infatuation for Gala is unquestioned. Throughout the meseum Dali's brilliance is staring back at you at times satirical, painful, sharp, cutting and visionary. Most people go here not knowing he is buried here. You'll be surprised to see where he is interned - and captivated by those who don't know....idly walking past him and over him as they gaze around.

reviewnospace: Took the family there on a trip from France into Barcelona. We all really enjoyed it, even my teenagers! Very well thought out and interesting. You get a real sense of who Dali was and there is even a room of photos celebrating his mustache! There are a number of cafes and restaurants just outside that make for a pleasant place to spend the day. Parking garages are plentiful nearby as well.
titleopinion: A fascinating museum!. Took the family there on a trip from France into Barcelona. We all really enjoyed it, even my teenagers! Very well thought out and interesting. You get a real sense of who Dali was and there is even a room of photos celebrating his mustache! There are a number of cafes and restaurants just outside that make for a pleasant place to spend the day. Parking garages are plentiful nearby as well.

reviewnospace: As you walk through the gates, you enter the mind's eye of Salvador Dali. An amazingly inspiring collection of his prolific and varied works including sculpture, paintings, jewellery, sketches and some unfinished work. Be sure to book online and collect your tickets at the door on time...oh...and don't bring a backpack. Be prepared to be mesmerised and make sure you book in for the "Joies" (jewels) as well!
titleopinion: Teatro Tantalises. As you walk through the gates, you enter the mind's eye of Salvador Dali. An amazingly inspiring collection of his prolific and varied works including sculpture, paintings, jewellery, sketches and some unfinished work. Be sure to book online and collect your tickets at the door on time...oh...and don't bring a backpack. Be prepared to be mesmerised and make sure you book in for the  Joies  (jewels) as well!

quote: RETURN TO DALI IN DIFFERENT SEASONS
reviewnospace:
Avoid the crowds in the off season and choose your hours carefully during the tourist season.

School holiday had not begun so the crowds were less and no school parties were inside, fortunately.

There is such an abundance here that more than one long visit is needed to do it a modicum of justice. Uplifting!
titleopinion: RETURN TO DALI IN DIFFERENT SEASONS. Avoid the crowds in the off season and choose your hours carefully during the tourist season.  School holiday had not begun so the crowds were less and no school parties were inside, fortunately.  There is such an abundance here that more than one long visit is needed to do it a modicum of justice. Uplifting!

reviewnospace:
Wow.
Whatever your opinion of Dali, this is definitely worth a couple hours.
Book ahead as the like gets really long towards noon.
Amazing collection.
titleopinion: Disneyland of art. Wow.  Whatever your opinion of Dali, this is definitely worth a couple hours.  Book ahead as the like gets really long towards noon.  Amazing collection.

reviewnospace: Weird and wonderful as expected, but much more in terms of content. Bonus was the jewellery - something I thought fabulous while also crazy, beautiful and fascinating. The theatre has a lot of installation scale work and a good selection of drawings but mostly the layout lets you enjoy the intended dislocated emotions of surrealistic shocks and the crazy, amusing yet disturbing, dream-like works all mixed up. He knew it would shock even repel as well as engage, but this collection also shows meticulous draughtsman-like execution, so you get the sense of all that mad talent you see in his masterpieces of paintings though these are not represented so much here.
titleopinion: Wow!! . Weird and wonderful as expected, but much more in terms of content. Bonus was the jewellery - something I thought fabulous while also crazy, beautiful and fascinating. The theatre has a lot of installation scale work and a good selection of drawings but mostly the layout lets you enjoy the intended dislocated emotions of surrealistic shocks and the crazy, amusing yet disturbing, dream-like works all mixed up. He knew it would shock even repel as well as engage, but this collection also shows meticulous draughtsman-like execution, so you get the sense of all that mad talent you see in his masterpieces of paintings though these are not represented so much here.

reviewnospace: Went to Spain to see 1. San Fermin festival (running of the Bulls), 2. Rioja wine country, and 3. Everything Dali and Gaudi. The Dali museum was amazing, as noted in another review, most of his famous artworks are not there, but his large installations and many sketches and unusual pieces can be seen.
titleopinion: Highlight of Spain Trip. Went to Spain to see 1. San Fermin festival (running of the Bulls), 2. Rioja wine country, and 3. Everything Dali and Gaudi. The Dali museum was amazing, as noted in another review, most of his famous artworks are not there, but his large installations and many sketches and unusual pieces can be seen.

reviewnospace: The museum has lots of really interesting art in it, but you are not always sure if it is the work of Dali or one of the other surrealist painters on display, although this was still a very enjoyable visit.
titleopinion: .... The museum has lots of really interesting art in it, but you are not always sure if it is the work of Dali or one of the other surrealist painters on display, although this was still a very enjoyable visit.

quote: It is a fine line between genius and madness - Dali hops back and forth with ease!!
reviewnospace: One of the greatest art museums/exhibitions in the world. Combine it with a visit to his house in Cadaques - less than 1 hr drive away. You must book in advance!
titleopinion: It is a fine line between genius and madness - Dali hops back and forth with ease!!. One of the greatest art museums/exhibitions in the world. Combine it with a visit to his house in Cadaques - less than 1 hr drive away. You must book in advance!

reviewnospace: Fantastic place to visit. Bit of a philistine when it comes to museums but this is the best by far. Go as early in the day as possible as it does get busy. Overheard the guide say they get 4,000 visitors a day! A lot of his famous work is in New York, of course, or in private collections( a travesty) but there's enough to keep you amused and realise the guy was a genius. Or was he on LSD! Just enjoy and remember, the guy is buried beneath the dome. Underneath the stage part. RESPECT
titleopinion: Brilliant zany artwork. Fantastic place to visit. Bit of a philistine when it comes to museums but this is the best by far. Go as early in the day as possible as it does get busy. Overheard the guide say they get 4,000 visitors a day! A lot of his famous work is in New York, of course, or in private collections( a travesty) but there's enough to keep you amused and realise the guy was a genius. Or was he on LSD! Just enjoy and remember, the guy is buried beneath the dome. Underneath the stage part. RESPECT

reviewnospace: I thinks the whole museum looks a bit like a circus or some kind of Disney World. But if you look through it and walk a bit further where the great mass of people stay away, there is a lot of beautiful and unknown work to discover. Dali was a genious and he behaved like a clown, but he was more than that. He knew how to draw and he used many techniques nobody seems to be interested in. Good for me, I had the whole gallery to myself while everybody was taking pictures of themselves around the car in the courtyard. All in all this museum is worth a visit if you appreciate the work of Dali. But go as early as possible before the crowd invades the museum.
titleopinion: Galleries with unexpected masterpieces. I thinks the whole museum looks a bit like a circus or some kind of Disney World. But if you look through it and walk a bit further where the great mass of people stay away, there is a lot of beautiful and unknown work to discover. Dali was a genious and he behaved like a clown, but he was more than that. He knew how to draw and he used many techniques nobody seems to be interested in. Good for me, I had the whole gallery to myself while everybody was taking pictures of themselves around the car in the courtyard. All in all this museum is worth a visit if you appreciate the work of Dali. But go as early as possible before the crowd invades the museum.

reviewnospace: Some of Dali's earliest work is here. Coupled with a visit to his residence near Cadaques, it is interesting to see his growth from tradiational to avant guarde. It is a little unclear on their website that the museum and house are not near each other. The Museum is in Figueres, while the house is in Portlligat, near Cadaques. We stayed in Figueres and mada a day trip out to the house with lunch and a stroll through Cadaques.
titleopinion: Raining Cadillac. Some of Dali's earliest work is here. Coupled with a visit to his residence near Cadaques, it is interesting to see his growth from tradiational to avant guarde. It is a little unclear on their website that the museum and house are not near each other. The Museum is in Figueres, while the house is in Portlligat, near Cadaques. We stayed in Figueres and mada a day trip out to the house with lunch and a stroll through Cadaques.

reviewnospace: We have been to the museum many times as it's not far from home for us and it's a great trip for friends visiting. It's a really funky place mostly designed and planned by Dali himself! Full of his art: paintings, concepts, jewellery, that Mae West sofa.... Fun for everyone and Figueras is a really nice town especially evening when the streets are busy and vibrant.

quote: A very interesting collection of Dali´s older and newer works in a very original setting.
reviewnospace: The Teatro-Museo Dali, where actually Dali is buried under the stage, is worth visiting for also those who may not have liked Dali´s art before. You may even change your mind! Also children appreciate the very original art works. Another positive factor is that this museum is not too vast so you do not feel too tired having wandered through the various levels and rooms.

reviewnospace: This museum, and the Dali Jewels next door to it, were fascinating. A great collection. I saw many works I had not seen before. We took the train from Barcelona and enjoyed watching the countryside roll by. Highly recommend this day trip. There are plenty of other places to explore and restaurants in which to find repast.

We took the train from Barcelona and enjoyed watching the countryside roll by. Highly recommend this day trip. There are plenty of other places to explore and restaurants in which to find repast.

reviewnospace: The organization of this museum was a bit odd - I guess in keeping with surrealism. The Dali collection was phenomenal. I'm not much of a fan of much of his sculpture. I think his work is more powerful in 2D and that the jumbled collections of bits and pieces look cheap and untalented. (Not impressed by the Mae West room.) But there was still lots of amazing art and even some sculpture that I enjoyed.
titleopinion: Worth a Visit. The organization of this museum was a bit odd - I guess in keeping with surrealism. The Dali collection was phenomenal. I'm not much of a fan of much of his sculpture. I think his work is more powerful in 2D and that the jumbled collections of bits and pieces look cheap and untalented. (Not impressed by the Mae West room.) But there was still lots of amazing art and even some sculpture that I enjoyed.

reviewnospace:
Wonderful - Worth the trip!
we ranted a car especially to drive from Barcelona to Figueres just to visit this museum
Dali work is amazing, the museum is crowded with Dali's art creations.
there some rooms that all the room is a single work of art, amazing!
titleopinion: Wonderful - Worth the trip!. reviewnospace: Even if you don't know Dali as the teenagers didn't we were with, they were fascinated with his work. Some of the ideas about art were bizarre and some were amazing. He had a genius creative mind and it was interesting to see every piece and how he finished them. From the movable jewelry to the car that rained inside, he was a master. Loved the eggs on the roof! If you enjoy art, this isn't very far out of Barcelona and worth the trip.

If you enjoy art, this isn't very far out of Barcelona and worth the trip.

reviewnospace: This museum was definitely a must visit for us and we weren't disappointed. The prices are great for such a massive and diverse museum however they should really allow less people in at a time because it gets super busy with seemingly bored-to-death school kids.
titleopinion: Best museum ever! . This museum was definitely a must visit for us and we weren't disappointed. The prices are great for such a massive and diverse museum however they should really allow less people in at a time because it gets super busy with seemingly bored-to-death school kids.

quote: An experience not to be missed.
reviewnospace: Managed to visit this museum on a Saturday morning before catching the bus to Cadaques, which meant we only managed to spend just over an hour there. I would say it really should be at least a 2 hour visit as there is so much to see & savour. Dali, through his work & exhibits, comes across as truly remarkable & talented artist indeed. Fascinating museum. In case you're not aware, after buying tickets online, you need to exchange 'paperwork' for actual tickets before you can enter museum. Just ask for location of ticket office which is around the corner from the entrance.
titleopinion: An experience not to be missed.. Managed to visit this museum on a Saturday morning before catching the bus to Cadaques, which meant we only managed to spend just over an hour there. I would say it really should be at least a 2 hour visit as there is so much to see & savour. Dali, through his work & exhibits, comes across as truly remarkable & talented artist indeed. Fascinating museum. In case you're not aware, after buying tickets online, you need to exchange 'paperwork' for actual tickets before you can enter museum. Just ask for location of ticket office which is around the corner from the entrance.

reviewnospace: Dali is one of my favorite artistes. Always wanting to visit the museum, it surpassed my expectations. We did not have tickets and were worried about the crowds, however, we got our tickets easily and sailed right in with no lines. We were there on a Friday afternoon. The museum is exquisite, fun and intriguing. Loved the area and will return.
titleopinion: A magical museum!. Dali is one of my favorite artistes. Always wanting to visit the museum, it surpassed my expectations. We did not have tickets and were worried about the crowds, however, we got our tickets easily and sailed right in with no lines. We were there on a Friday afternoon. The museum is exquisite, fun and intriguing. Loved the area and will return.

reviewnospace:
A friend told me that is the second largest visited museum in Spain. The place is nice, maybe the extensive tourism, big students groups is a problem, you can't enjoy the place and for me it was a little claustrophobic. Anyway is nice.

A must: Dali jewlery

Tip: take your ticket in advance and go early in the morning
titleopinion: Must see, so many tourists. A friend told me that is the second largest visited museum in Spain. The place is nice, maybe the extensive tourism, big students groups is a problem, you can't enjoy the place and for me it was a little claustrophobic. Anyway is nice.  A must: Dali jewlery  Tip: take your ticket in advance and go early in the morning

reviewnospace: Dali excelled at so many things but marketing himself as the center of the universe was his true talent. The car in the center of the entrance way with the long mast through it and the boat on top with the large tears falling from it. If you put a coin in a box on one side of the car it begins to rain inside and an umbrella opens on top of the mast. I'm not sure I really understand it but it's pretty amazing to see. The room immediately behind it with the picture of Gala that's an optical allusion as it turns into Abraham Lincoln when you look at it from 50 feet back of it. The painting of Dali and Gala on the ceiling looking up at the heavens with you looking up at them seeing them suspended. The allusion with the large lips sofa and fireplace like nose that turns into Mae West from a distance and from above. All of this and much more awaits you at the Dali Museum. Afterwards go into his Jewelers museum and see the very interesting and intricate pieces of jewelry he designed.
titleopinion: The ultimate in sensationalism. Dali excelled at so many things but marketing himself as the center of the universe was his true talent. The car in the center of the entrance way with the long mast through it and the boat on top with the large tears falling from it. If you put a coin in a box on one side of the car it begins to rain inside and an umbrella opens on top of the mast. I'm not sure I really understand it but it's pretty amazing to see. The room immediately behind it with the picture of Gala that's an optical allusion as it turns into Abraham Lincoln when you look at it from 50 feet back of it. The painting of Dali and Gala on the ceiling looking up at the heavens with you looking up at them seeing them suspended. The allusion with the large lips sofa and fireplace like nose that turns into Mae West from a distance and from above. All of this and much more awaits you at the Dali Museum. Afterwards go into his Jewelers museum and see the very interesting and intricate pieces of jewelry he designed.

reviewnospace: We are not museum goers but this was fantastic. Worth the trip to Figueres. What you see through the naked eye is not always what you see on your camera!
titleopinion: Amazing . We are not museum goers but this was fantastic. Worth the trip to Figueres. What you see through the naked eye is not always what you see on your camera!

reviewnospace: I have always been fascinated by Dali, but was only familiar with a couple of his most famous works. This theatre/gallery/museum (it's all of those things) apparently contains the most extensive collection of Dali's work anywhere, and it's quite breathtaking. I won't attempt to describe all that is there, I couldn't begin to do it justice - visit the website, or better still, visit the gallery. If you like surrealist art, that is - there was a chap there today who said to me plaintively, "what am I supposed to be looking at?" But if you enjoy Dali's art it's unmissable.
titleopinion: Astounding! . I have always been fascinated by Dali, but was only familiar with a couple of his most famous works. This theatre/gallery/museum (it's all of those things) apparently contains the most extensive collection of Dali's work anywhere, and it's quite breathtaking. I won't attempt to describe all that is there, I couldn't begin to do it justice - visit the website, or better still, visit the gallery. If you like surrealist art, that is - there was a chap there today who said to me plaintively,  what am I supposed to be looking at?  But if you enjoy Dali's art it's unmissable.

reviewnospace: Amazing building, great works inside. Friendly staff. The museum is very baby friendly (but need to take a baby carrier, lots of stairs). Disclaimer: you need to love Salvador Dali to enjoy it.
titleopinion: Fantastic museum. Amazing building, great works inside. Friendly staff. The museum is very baby friendly (but need to take a baby carrier, lots of stairs). Disclaimer: you need to love Salvador Dali to enjoy it.

reviewnospace: Dali was a talented artist who was a genius at marketing himself and this museum is a testament to that skill. It provides an overview of his career in an environment that is quite playful. This is not your typical museum. Everywhere you look there are surprises with unusual paintings and figures. My friend and I especially loved seeing his artworks realized in jewels. Fabulous!
titleopinion: Full of surrealist character. Dali was a talented artist who was a genius at marketing himself and this museum is a testament to that skill. It provides an overview of his career in an environment that is quite playful. This is not your typical museum. Everywhere you look there are surprises with unusual paintings and figures. My friend and I especially loved seeing his artworks realized in jewels. Fabulous!

quote: No guide books or audio guides are available.
reviewnospace: I am an art teacher. I have studied Dali. I was VERY excited to take my family to this museum. I just assumed that there would be an audio guide provided. Like at all of the other museums we have visited. But no. And the map they give you upon entry is less than helpful. We wandered through the exhibits wondering what we were seeing. Wondering about the back stories. There was nothing. Not until after we went through the entire museum, and were exhausted, hanging out in the gift shop, did I see a guide book for the museum. And by then, it was too late. DONT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE..... hire a guide or buy the book about the museum for 12 euros. But buy it BEFORE you go through the museum. Good luck....
titleopinion: No guide books or audio guides are available.. I am an art teacher. I have studied Dali. I was VERY excited to take my family to this museum. I just assumed that there would be an audio guide provided. Like at all of the other museums we have visited. But no. And the map they give you upon entry is less than helpful. We wandered through the exhibits wondering what we were seeing. Wondering about the back stories. There was nothing. DONT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE..... hire a guide or buy the book about the museum for 12 euros. But buy it BEFORE you go through the museum. Good luck....

reviewnospace: Having been to so many museums that we can't begin to recall, esp 20th century artists, we can honestly say we've never seen anything like it. Everything in the space he "touched" and it shows. Run do not walk to this spectacular space.
titleopinion: Unbelievable! . Having been to so many museums that we can't begin to recall, esp 20th century artists, we can honestly say we've never seen anything like it. Everything in the space he  touched  and it shows. Run do not walk to this spectacular space.

reviewnospace: This museum has everything you want from a Dali Museum. We did this museum as a side trip with Catalunya Bus Turistic and our guide Alex. If you use this company ask for Alex. Alex is also very knowledgable about Dali. A great easy day trip.
titleopinion: Great Museum. This museum has everything you want from a Dali Museum. We did this museum as a side trip with Catalunya Bus Turistic and our guide Alex. If you use this company ask for Alex. Alex is also very knowledgable about Dali. A great easy day trip.

reviewnospace: This was a great museum if you have any interest in Dali. It is loaded with his works from his early years until old age. It can get very crowed in the morning but we noticed that in the afternoon many of the large groups had left and there was no longer a line to buy tickets. It takes about two hours to see everything but can take longer if you want to study his works more carefully.
titleopinion: Unusal. This was a great museum if you have any interest in Dali. It is loaded with his works from his early years until old age. It can get very crowed in the morning but we noticed that in the afternoon many of the large groups had left and there was no longer a line to buy tickets. It takes about two hours to see everything but can take longer if you want to study his works more carefully.

quote: It's definitely a theatre!! worth the trip
reviewnospace:
Great museum and worth the trip out there (total cost about 50E, skip the overpriced tour companies). I think it is good to go through the museum more than once since there is so much to see you are bound to miss something, especially with Dali who likes to be clever with placement of images and implying meanings. There is a LOT to see. I would allow at least 3 hours for the museum and then an hour for a bite to eat and trip to the gift shop. It can get crowded so just plan for the need to be patient. His work is really fun! Outside the shop, there are lots of little shops and cafes, and of course places with souvenirs.

Museum tickets: Never hurts to buy tickets in advance (14 euro as of June 2016). It seems unpredictable for when it sells out and you're not able to buy on the day. I went in June, and saw availability for that same week. My friend didn't have luck when she went in December, they were sold out. Ticket 14€ as of June 2016. I recommend buying ahead of time. Also, I arrived about 25 minutes after my start time, but was allowed in no problem, and there was not a line at 10 am when I arrived.

Getting there: From the Barcelona Sants station /(Metro Blue line Estacio Sants station is connected to this train station), take the AVE high speed train to Figueres Villafant (Renfe.com). Trains are assigned seats. I was not able to purchase online and unfortunately the train I wanted to take was sold out so I arrived late. You need to buy round trips, €34. The high speed train is 55 minutes plus 15 minute walk. I think if you purchase the train ticket well ahead of time, it will permit you to purchase online. The trains are spacious and it's a smooth ride. You need to be boarded 2 minutes before departure, and allow time for bags to be screened via security. Many nice shops and cafe in the station. FYI, it's 50 cents to use the bathroom in this station. I spent 2 euro on the Metro trip to and from my hotel to the train station (buy the 10 ride ticket for 10 euro).

From the Figueres Villafont station, it is an easy 15 minute walk or so, but there are cabs outside the station as well.
