FYI, it's 50 cents to use the bathroom in this station. I spent 2 euro on the Metro trip to and from my hotel to the train station (buy the 10 ride ticket for 10 euro).   From the Figueres Villafont station, it is an easy 15 minute walk or so, but there are cabs outside the station as well.

reviewnospace: The best museum the art is out of this world and the jewellery just breath taking. Easy to get to from Barcelona, buy a train ticket from Barcelona to Figures ( leaves from Saints train station) about £35 return plus your entrance to museum. Or take a tour there are a few bus tours that operate to here, however for me I wanted as much time here as I could as there was just so much to see and take in
titleopinion: Amazing A must Go. The best museum the art is out of this world and the jewellery just breath taking. Easy to get to from Barcelona, buy a train ticket from Barcelona to Figures ( leaves from Saints train station) about £35 return plus your entrance to museum. Or take a tour there are a few bus tours that operate to here, however for me I wanted as much time here as I could as there was just so much to see and take in

reviewnospace: I regularly visit and revisit the museum. It is a work of art in its own right and will appeal to anyone. This is a place i like to bring visitors. Always impressive and enjoyable.
titleopinion: My favorite museum. I regularly visit and revisit the museum. It is a work of art in its own right and will appeal to anyone. This is a place i like to bring visitors. Always impressive and enjoyable.

reviewnospace: We were driving from Cardona, Spain to Collioure, France and, as we were passing Figueres, thought we would stop for a quick snack and drop into the Dali Museum. It is fantastic - Dali was a brilliant man and his artwork, sculptures and jewellery pieces are magnificent. This is a "must do" for any traveller in the area. And the snack in the outdoor restaurant nearby was good too.
titleopinion: What a Hoot!. We were driving from Cardona, Spain to Collioure, France and, as we were passing Figueres, thought we would stop for a quick snack and drop into the Dali Museum. It is fantastic - Dali was a brilliant man and his artwork, sculptures and jewellery pieces are magnificent. This is a  must do  for any traveller in the area. And the snack in the outdoor restaurant nearby was good too.

quote: Wow! Don't Miss Tjis Dali Experience
reviewnospace: If you are ever within driving distance of this tribute to surrealist master Salvador Dali Museum, it's well worth going out of your way to visit. The works of art are spectacular, and the Dali jewelry display is other-worldly in a dark accent lighted theater. Watch out for tourist trap gift shops in the surrounding area.
titleopinion: Wow! Don't Miss Tjis Dali Experience. If you are ever within driving distance of this tribute to surrealist master Salvador Dali Museum, it's well worth going out of your way to visit. The works of art are spectacular, and the Dali jewelry display is other-worldly in a dark accent lighted theater. Watch out for tourist trap gift shops in the surrounding area.

reviewnospace: We took a tour from Barcelona and it was definitely worth it. The works of art are displayed in a "Dali" type of arrangement. He was a very gifted artist with one unbelievable imagination. Didn't want to go into his separate jewelry museum, but I did and so happy that I did. This is a place to visit if you are in this area of Spain.
titleopinion: Worth the Trip From Barcelona. We took a tour from Barcelona and it was definitely worth it. The works of art are displayed in a  Dali  type of arrangement. He was a very gifted artist with one unbelievable imagination. Didn't want to go into his separate jewelry museum, but I did and so happy that I did. This is a place to visit if you are in this area of Spain.

reviewnospace: I knew very little about Dali, just an odd little man with a funny mustache and very eccentric art work. In other words, I didn't know Dali!! This man was a true artistic genius. Some of his work is almost classical in scope. Much of his work is eclectic and almost eccentric. But I felt all his work was very original with his own touch, sometimes satiric, sometimes historical but always interesting and thought provoking. We spent about 1 1/2 hours at the museum. I wish we had more time, there are over 3800 items to see. I would leave yourself at least three hours, and even then you won't be satisfied. The museum can get very crowded, so you need some patience. I think most people will at least appreciate his genius, if not enjoy his art.
titleopinion: Hello Dali, what an experience!!. I knew very little about Dali, just an odd little man with a funny mustache and very eccentric art work. In other words, I didn't know Dali!! This man was a true artistic genius. Some of his work is almost classical in scope. Much of his work is eclectic and almost eccentric. But I felt all his work was very original with his own touch, sometimes satiric, sometimes historical but always interesting and thought provoking. We spent about 1 1/2 hours at the museum. I wish we had more time, there are over 3800 items to see. I would leave yourself at least three hours, and even then you won't be satisfied. The museum can get very crowded, so you need some patience. I think most people will at least appreciate his genius, if not enjoy his art.

reviewnospace: Our tour bus drove 2 hours from Barcelona to visit this wonderful museum set up by the great artist Salvator Dali. You will see his paintings, sculptures, drawings,special designs and unthinkable inventions from this superb brain. One week will not be enough if you go and analyze every bit of his art. I followed my tour guide just to get the important information on some of them and finsihed the tour in an hour and a half, but it is not enough if you want to go deep. His love to his wife Gala is respectable and wonderful. Great place to visit and strongly recommended to everybody.
titleopinion: Dali Museum at its best. Our tour bus drove 2 hours from Barcelona to visit this wonderful museum set up by the great artist Salvator Dali. You will see his paintings, sculptures, drawings,special designs and unthinkable inventions from this superb brain. One week will not be enough if you go and analyze every bit of his art. I followed my tour guide just to get the important information on some of them and finsihed the tour in an hour and a half, but it is not enough if you want to go deep. His love to his wife Gala is respectable and wonderful. Great place to visit and strongly recommended to everybody.

quote: VERY unique museum 2 hours from Barcelona
reviewnospace:
We visited this museum on a group tour. It was a day trip from Barcelona and also included Dali's house in Port Legat and lunch in Cadeques. It takes roughly 2 hours to get to the Museum. The museum itself is amazing and very unique. The visitors become part of the exhibit as many of the aspects of the museum are in 3D, include sculptural elements, and must be experienced, walked through or viewed from certain vantage points to be appreciated.
There is a separate museum of Dali jewelry which is very good and worth it if you have time. There is a gift shop and lots of interesting rooms to explore. I would budget 2-4 hours depending on your interest level in Dali. His art and sculpture is very unique and interesting.
titleopinion: VERY unique museum 2 hours from Barcelona. We visited this museum on a group tour. It was a day trip from Barcelona and also included Dali's house in Port Legat and lunch in Cadeques. It takes roughly 2 hours to get to the Museum. The museum itself is amazing and very unique. The visitors become part of the exhibit as many of the aspects of the museum are in 3D, include sculptural elements, and must be experienced, walked through or viewed from certain vantage points to be appreciated. There is a separate museum of Dali jewelry which is very good and worth it if you have time. There is a gift shop and lots of interesting rooms to explore. I would budget 2-4 hours depending on your interest level in Dali. His art and sculpture is very unique and interesting.

reviewnospace: Small group visit, only 8 of us driving to Figures. The museum was amazing, the guide showed us how to see the hidden parts of his paintings, he was a very clever artist. His other works and lifestyle was also interesting so much so we just wanted to everything about him. We then drove to A beautiful shamal cove for a very tasty seafood lunch. Onward to Portlegit where Salvidore has his home, this too was unusual, 7 fishermen homes made into one. This tour was well worth the effort.
titleopinion: Worth the drive. Small group visit, only 8 of us driving to Figures. The museum was amazing, the guide showed us how to see the hidden parts of his paintings, he was a very clever artist. His other works and lifestyle was also interesting so much so we just wanted to everything about him. We then drove to A beautiful shamal cove for a very tasty seafood lunch. Onward to Portlegit where Salvidore has his home, this too was unusual, 7 fishermen homes made into one. This tour was well worth the effort.

quote: Enjoyable for art lovers... Go early though!
reviewnospace:
As someone who has studied art this museum was particularly fascinating... Absolutely loved the progression of works for both Dali and some of the other artists featured!
Do make sure you go early though
...the tourist groups are plentiful the later in the day it becomes.
titleopinion: Enjoyable for art lovers... Go early though! . As someone who has studied art this museum was particularly fascinating... Absolutely loved the progression of works for both Dali and some of the other artists featured!  Do make sure you go early though  ...the tourist groups are plentiful the later in the day it becomes.

reviewnospace:
We were fortunate to visit with a group from the Dali Museum in St Petersburg Fl
Dali himself was the architect for the museum and is also buried there. His works there are amazing. after you may want to have lunch at the Dalicatesin .
titleopinion: Don't miss. We were fortunate to visit with a group from the Dali Museum in St Petersburg Fl Dali himself was the architect for the museum and is also buried there. His works there are amazing. after you may want to have lunch at the Dalicatesin .

reviewnospace:
I love Dali so was excited to go here. We booked tickets for the museum in advance. On the website it says that doing this gives you quick entry. This is not true as the time on our weekday ticket was 9.30 (see website faqs) which is standard for weekday tickets. We had to queue up with everyone else as the time on our ticket had to be changed. Took longer to do this than buy the ticket at the desk. The ticket we should have booked in advance was the train ticket which cost a packet on the day.
Despite all this and despite the numerous bored school kids being dragged about by stressed teachers, we had a great time. It is a fascinating insight into Dali's world. The jewelry is my highlight. However the crowned heart was not pumping on our visit... We had to make do with a video.

reviewnospace:
This is a must-see! Each exhibit is more 'breathtaking' and quirky!
We stayed for over 2 hours and will be going back again!
Dali's changing styles were all represented - so creatively designed - by Dali himself!
Great souvenirs to buy in the museum shop as well!

reviewnospace: Lots of fun! And in case you think Dali just painted limp clocks, you will see that he was a very talented - and creative-artist. Make sure you book online before you go, as this museum is the second most-visited in Spain

reviewnospace: Salvador Dali was a genius when it came to his vision of all his amazing works of art. You could spend a couple of hours there. We went on a tour so went directly into the museum no wait time, but I would suggest to get your tickets ahead of time if not in a tour. Apparently, their is also a wonderful Salvador Dali museum in St. Petersburg Florida . If you stay in Barcelona for several days I would recommend taking the train or bus to Girona about 11/2 hrs from Barcelona and incorporate The Salvador Dali museum Which is approximately 1-2 hr by bus from Girona makes a nice days tour.

quote: A wow - whether you are a fan or not
reviewnospace: If more modern art museums showcased this sort of standard (even if the subject matter isn't to your taste) then perhaps more people would be engaged again by art! Most relatively modern stuff leaves me cold and seems a big con and pretty lacking in artistic skill and ingenuity and I'm not a huge Dali fan but his painting skills are truly superlative and his creativity is eternally interesting. Didn't understand much of it but was still fascinated, entertained, amused and often made to feel a bit spooked.Superbly laid out too in this beautiful building. A must see.

quote: Must see, but an audio guide?
reviewnospace: I could say nothing about it, as it left me speachless. Very nice way to honour Dali's genius, but some things should be explained while you are looking at them.
titleopinion: Must see, but an audio guide?. I could say nothing about it, as it left me speachless. Very nice way to honour Dali's genius, but some things should be explained while you are looking at them.

reviewnospace: We were unsure what to expect and thought it may be a bit of a tourist trap. Thankfully this was not the case, in fact, I think this is the best art museum, dedicated to a particular artist, I have ever been to. We spent over two hours there and that was not enough time to really see everything in detail. It truly is spectacular, having said that, I am a Dali fan! Be sure to book you tickets on the Internet well in advance of your visit otherwise you will not get in.
titleopinion: Wow, best art museum ever!. We were unsure what to expect and thought it may be a bit of a tourist trap. Thankfully this was not the case, in fact, I think this is the best art museum, dedicated to a particular artist, I have ever been to. We spent over two hours there and that was not enough time to really see everything in detail. It truly is spectacular, having said that, I am a Dali fan! Be sure to book you tickets on the Internet well in advance of your visit otherwise you will not get in.

quote: A rainy day at the Dali
reviewnospace:
We took a cab from the port of Roses, Spain to Figueres. It was worth the drive.
The museum that Salvador Dali built and organized himself proved to be quite an interesting visit. A prolific artist, Dali filled the building with works in various mediums
including oil paintings, sketches, metal works and furniture. There is even an old car with a statue mounted atop the hood. Also included in our ticket price was a Dali jewelry exhibit housed in a separate building. You could be there all day if you try to inspect everything.
titleopinion: A rainy day at the Dali. We took a cab from the port of Roses, Spain to Figueres. It was worth the drive. The museum that Salvador Dali built and organized himself proved to be quite an interesting visit. A prolific artist, Dali filled the building with works in various mediums including oil paintings, sketches, metal works and furniture. There is even an old car with a statue mounted atop the hood. Also included in our ticket price was a Dali jewelry exhibit housed in a separate building. You could be there all day if you try to inspect everything.

reviewnospace:
This must be seen, admired, reflected, digested!

While travelling from Carcassone to Barcelona, we spend half day here. Not only the museum-theatre but also the jewelery ehibition of the master was in display.

What can you say for this genious; see, admire, reflect and digest yourself..
titleopinion: Fantastic!. This must be seen, admired, reflected, digested!  While travelling from Carcassone to Barcelona, we spend half day here. Not only the museum-theatre but also the jewelery ehibition of the master was in display.   What can you say for this genious; see, admire, reflect and digest yourself..

quote: A wonderful day trip from Barcelona
reviewnospace: Taking the slow train from Barcelona, I arrived around midday expecting hoards of tourist buses and huge crowds. Maybe I was lucky, it was busy, but not jam packed. There were two people in front of me in the ticket queue. A word of warning, don't take any form of rucksack or backpack, as you will need to check it, they don't allow them. Once inside, this place is amazing. Take your time and look up, down and all around (as well as at the artworks) as Dali conceived the building and it has his trademark all over it. Climb the small stairs in the lips couch room to peer through the looking glass, and marvel at the holographic pieces scattered around. I would think even if you're not a massive Dali fan, the quirky building would be worth admission.
titleopinion: A wonderful day trip from Barcelona . Taking the slow train from Barcelona, I arrived around midday expecting hoards of tourist buses and huge crowds. Maybe I was lucky, it was busy, but not jam packed. There were two people in front of me in the ticket queue. A word of warning, don't take any form of rucksack or backpack, as you will need to check it, they don't allow them. Once inside, this place is amazing. Take your time and look up, down and all around (as well as at the artworks) as Dali conceived the building and it has his trademark all over it. Climb the small stairs in the lips couch room to peer through the looking glass, and marvel at the holographic pieces scattered around. I would think even if you're not a massive Dali fan, the quirky building would be worth admission.

Re visited after a decade
More crowded and less parking
Still able to get tickets at door without issue
Surrounded by usual array of touristy cafes and souvenir shops
But if you are into Dali, you must go to his birthplace

reviewnospace: Try to get there early, it gets crowded! Purchase a ticket which includes access to the Dali jewellery museum next door, breathtaking .
titleopinion: Fascinating. Try to get there early, it gets crowded! Purchase a ticket which includes access to the Dali jewellery museum next door, breathtaking .

reviewnospace: I was travelling with a group wine tasting our way around Cataluna. On the final day we sandwiched in a visit to the Dali Museum. My little knowledge of Dali had not prepared me for the wide range and versatility of his creations, most of which were not to my taste in spite of the fact that my taste runs to the bizarre but I have to admit I was very pleasantly impressed and found much to admire. We got there when the museum opened and I recommend that timing as the building isn't large and quickly gets overrun with tour groups.
titleopinion: Improved my opinion of Dali. I was travelling with a group wine tasting our way around Cataluna. On the final day we sandwiched in a visit to the Dali Museum. My little knowledge of Dali had not prepared me for the wide range and versatility of his creations, most of which were not to my taste in spite of the fact that my taste runs to the bizarre but I have to admit I was very pleasantly impressed and found much to admire. We got there when the museum opened and I recommend that timing as the building isn't large and quickly gets overrun with tour groups.

reviewnospace: Really told the story of his early work and classical art background and the move to his own style; really worth a visit as gives great understanding of his background.
titleopinion: Great museum. Really told the story of his early work and classical art background and the move to his own style; really worth a visit as gives great understanding of his background.

quote: Get a full time guide or don't go
reviewnospace: If you are going there without a full time guide, you will be lost. Very few paintings are described. We went with a tour called catalunya touristic n their guide gave us s preliminary introduction n left us on our own. And we basically scratched our head. Unless u r student of this form of art stay away from it. You hv better places to waste your time on around Barcelona.

reviewnospace: interesting place clearly worth the entrance fee. I am not much for museums but this place is really worth the visit.
titleopinion: worth the trip. interesting place clearly worth the entrance fee. I am not much for museums but this place is really worth the visit.

reviewnospace: First, you MUST buy ticket online. My daughter and I were there on a blustery May morning, and still, there was a long line to buy tickets. The museum is relatively small with some narrow doorways and stairs. People consistently block these passages as they line up their cell phone for selfies, and traffic comes to a standstill. Unfortunately, photos without flash are allowed. The museum is really, really special. In addition to the varied Dali lithos, oils, photos, sculptures, he designed many life sized works that only he could have conceived. There's a face that is best seen from a platform that's 2 meters above the museum floor. His old Cadillac, complete with a mannikin driver, sits in the entrance, watched over by golden statuettes and dozens of bathroom sinks. There's section that depicts Dali whimsically posing with his famous mustache in different configurations and styles. Places like the Louvre and El Prado are sombre and "formal." The Dali Museum is a kick in the pants- it's weird, whimsical, fun, and interesting. @.5 hours passed very quickly. We didn't get an audio guide because other museums in Spain provided a lot of written information, both on a "period" or on individual pieces. That is not so here; there's is very little written guidance, and the brochure is not much more than a road map. Also, interestingly, the works are not presented in chronological order. For a relative art novice like me, it would have been helpful to see Dali's progression into surrealism from the 1920's forward. I'm sure that the museum's designers had a plan in the museum's layout; I just couldn't figure out any pattern; maybe that's the way Dali wanted it. The town itself is cute and easily walkable. There's an interesting assortment of shops, and there are plenty of good restaurants and cafes. On the Saturday we were there, there was no vehicular traffic on most of the streets in the center making a stroll around town a lot of fun. We took the AVE train from Barcelona Sants. This train takes 50 minutes instead of over 2 hours for the local train, but it stops at Figures Vilafont station, a very long walk from the museum. There's a bus every 20 minutes for < 2 euros or a cab costs 11 euros. With the fast train, it's very doable to leave Barcelona at 10 AM and be back by 4 PM. The limiting factor is museum ticket availability. Buy museum tix online first, then the train tickets. RENFE's website is not very friendly. I couldn't get it to accept any US credit cards. For just a couple of dollars more, you can buy from Petrabax, RENFE's US online ticket agency. This is a "must see."

reviewnospace: loved this museum so much. Dali accomplished his goal of making a totally interactive theatric experience for the visitor. It was totally worth the 2 hour train ride to Figueres, really happy we decided to visit!!
titleopinion: Theatrical interactive museum experience. loved this museum so much. Dali accomplished his goal of making a totally interactive theatric experience for the visitor. It was totally worth the 2 hour train ride to Figueres, really happy we decided to visit!!

reviewnospace:
I have been a fan of Dali since I was 12 years old in High School in the UK. I love the variety of his work:
Conventional painting
Surrealism
Sculptures
Installations
Jewellery
Murals
Lots of different sizes and materials - gold, wood, paint, plastic, diamonds, rubies, bronze... wow

There is so much to see in this museum. If I could give it more than "Excellent" I would. Having read other reviews, I was expecting it to be very crowded with huge queues. We didn't have that experience. It was busy, but not overwhelming.

We went on a Tuesday during term time and arrived close to 10:30am. There was a short queue to get our tickets and then we were in. If you really want the guided tour, either pre book one or get the audio guide. We decided not to as the whole place is a visual treat and I don't think you need the extra information.
Allow 2 to 3 hours there. There are plenty of cafes open nearby serving European and Catalan food, Sangria and pleasant coffee.
Take your time afterwards exploring the outside of the museum which is just as beautiful. Don't miss the Jewels museum - the eye and the lips are really something else!
Kids under 10 are likely to be bored. Everyone else who is able bodied will love it. There are lots of stairs as you view a lot of the art from different aspects.
I loved it, would definitely go back and bring my family.
Getting there - it is about 2 hours out of Barcelona by the normal train which costs about 32 EURO return. It is a very enjoyable train trip and you get fabulous views of the Pyrenees between Girona and Figueres. The high speed train is 50 minutes but you will need to buy in advance as these sell out quickly. If you want a no fuss tour, there is an expensive tour that will collect you at your hotel and do everything for you including museum entry.
Not to be missed. A day trip of a lifetime. 12/10

reviewnospace: Luckily, we were there in April on a weekday, so it was not overcrowded. This is a definite must see, because it is so unique. There is a courtyard area, with an old car and statue of a woman made out of metal. My favorite room was the Mae West room, where you wait in line to climb camel stairs to look down on the face of Mae West. It was worth the long wait in line. We did not buy tickets online, but I advise that you do. I will never forget this place!!
titleopinion: A Most Unusual Museum. Luckily, we were there in April on a weekday, so it was not overcrowded. This is a definite must see, because it is so unique. There is a courtyard area, with an old car and statue of a woman made out of metal. My favorite room was the Mae West room, where you wait in line to climb camel stairs to look down on the face of Mae West. It was worth the long wait in line. We did not buy tickets online, but I advise that you do. I will never forget this place!!

quote: An immersive visit to one of the most imaginative artists ever known
reviewnospace: Art museums are usually airy, sombre, austere kinds of places. Not this one. The Dali museum brings the playfulness of Dali's work into the setting and visitor experience. While it did get a bit crowded at points... just come early and enjoy one of the more unusual, and fairly extensive, collections you can find. No it is not the British Museum, but yes it is so, so much more than a one room gallery.

reviewnospace: This museum is just cool! The pieces of art are impressive. The renovation of the theatre is cool. Thoroughly enjoyed our private tour. Biggest problem is that they let in waaaay too many people for the size of the hallways. We were there early when it first opened and by the time we left at 11:30, I could hardly move! Don't let that stop you from this masterpiece!

quote: It's why you go to Figueres!
reviewnospace: The art is amazing. Where did he get his ideas from!? I think Dr. who producers got a lot of their ideas from here! I don't like art galleries or museums but here could spent hours studying the art and see something new the more you look!

quote: Such a broad range of work
reviewnospace:
What a great place to visit as part of a rainy day trip from Girona. Apart from work in his famous surrealist style there are many art works from other periods as well as other very creative pieces including jewelry, sculpture and photography.

Although we hadn't booked online we managed to avoid a long cue for tickets by arriving just after the 9.30am opening time. By the time we left the cue was pretty long so there is a some good advice to heed - Book on line or else be early.

reviewnospace: I drive here with family. The museum is easily a 2-3 hour stop. Be ware that there is very little to eat in the surrounding area on "off" hours. Restaurants close between lunch and dinner.

reviewnospace: Truly a theatrical experience! There are a number of exhibits that leave you shaking your head in wonder. The afternoon we were there, it was overrun with French high school students. Glad we went to experience Dali!

reviewnospace: We spent six days in Barcelona and finally decided to go out of town to see something else. You should love this museum if you are a fan of Dali or surrealism.

reviewnospace: I have paid 12 Euros to visit the museum as the last thing for me in Figures, did not have much time however I regret for not visiting it earlier as 45 Minutes were not enough to see what Dali had made. I loved his Cadillac car which was an art. Many ladies are made as legends. I do not advice kids to go with their parents, especially Muslims as ladies were drafted naked... still will go once more.

reviewnospace:
Do you like Dali? Then you will love this wondrous museum that he orchestrated himself. Our friend, who was born in Barcelona, loves to say that Dali and Gaudi are the "Two Monsters of Barcelona."

We paid a visit to the Dali Museum by heading there from Barcelona on the fast train. You can save time and consternation by booking both the train ride and the museum tickets online prior to going.

Our visit there occurred as it was raining, so what perfect indoor fun it was. By the time we finished cruising through the museum, and then the theater, the rain had stopped and we were able to take exterior photos of the property that gleamed after the rain had washed it.

We are so glad we went. The only con was that there were hordes of school children who seemed bored and some really stank due to a bad diet of burgers and fried foods, I'm guessing. They congested all the hallways and seemed oblivious about making way for other people coming in the other direction. At that age, it's all about them, I know. But it would have been nicer without them.

For more of my reviews on Fun & Romantic Places to Be, as well as Vintage Travel Tales, check out World Traveler Reviews dot com.

reviewnospace:
If you enjoy bad service, cramped hallways of poorly hung art and fighting your way to look at Dali's artistry from an inch away, then this is the museum for you!
The only interest the museum has, is making money, they do not care if they go over capacity, which seems to be all the time.
The art is hung in hallways so tiny that you can barely stop to actually see some real beauty without being knocked or pushed.
Tourists are constantly trying to take photos, even though it is prohibited and the staff on floor do not seem to care.
Poorly managed, overcrowded, expensive and frustrating.
The collection is absolutely stunningly impressive - the only positive point.
NOT WORTH THE VISIT.

The collection is absolutely stunningly impressive - the only positive point.  NOT WORTH THE VISIT.

reviewnospace:
This is without doubt an inspired collection of Dali and other selected artists that is worth seeing. However, there are two issues that could somewhat blight the occasion.
Firstly the museum details on the exhibits are sparse which is slightly frustrating - making the purchase of an explanatory book in the gift shop afterwards a necessity.
Secondly - on our visit the museum was packed with unruly, uninterested school parties, whose noise and sheer volume was annoying and distracting.
It would be a whole lot better for everyone if they allocated a specific day for school parties.
Get there as early as possible.

Result is a disaster you can't appreciate what you would like to see. don't imagine you could take pictures just not possible. perhaps at opening time in winter it could be better, don't want to imagine summer time. Do all people survive this visit?

reviewnospace: Worth seeing, once in a lifetime experience. Different from any art museum or gallery I have been to.
titleopinion: Impressive. Worth seeing, once in a lifetime experience. Different from any art museum or gallery I have been to.

reviewnospace:
This was an easy and enjoyable day trip from Barcelona. We caught a 7:20am train from Barcelona Sants Estacio. Be sure you board the train early and check your ticket for your seat assignment. The train arrived at Figueres-Vilafant early enough for us to stroll leisurely into town (the route to the museum is well signed) and enjoy a quick breakfast before heading to the museum. We purchased tickets online for 9:30 entry.

The museum is trippy, as any Dalí fan might expect. We took in and savored the artwork, but felt we didn't learn much about the man himself. There are pieces in the museum we felt we had not previously seen in books, which was particularly nice. Don't miss the opportunity to see this wonderful museum if you are visiting Catalonia!

reviewnospace: If you like the work of Salvador Dali and you are staying near Figueres the Dali Theatre Museum is a must. I have to confess that I like some of Dali's work but not all and I found our tour absolutely fascinating. Do get a guided tour, you learn so much and the guides are friendly and very knowledgeable about Dali and Surrealism. The museum is very busy especially at peak periods so it might be wise to go out of season. It's an ideal attraction if the weather is bad as most of the exhibits and displays are inside.

I have to confess that I like some of Dali's work but not all and I found our tour absolutely fascinating. Do get a guided tour, you learn so much and the guides are friendly and very knowledgeable about Dali and Surrealism. The museum is very busy especially at peak periods so it might be wise to go out of season. It's an ideal attraction if the weather is bad as most of the exhibits and displays are inside.

quote: Super collection, but far too many tourists
reviewnospace: This was a SURPRISE : we didn't expect such a spectacular collection of Dali oeuvres, BUT there is absolute no filtering of access. School busses, tourist busses, individual connaisseurs, families with small kids - thousands of people; you have difficulties to make turns to see the art displayed in taking turns. A pity that most of them are too ignorant to appreciate.
titleopinion: Super collection, but far too many tourists. This was a SURPRISE : we didn't expect such a spectacular collection of Dali oeuvres, BUT there is absolute no filtering of access. reviewnospace: To my shame, I had never heard of this museum but went with friends who live fairly close by. It was totally amazing. Despite the fact that it was extremely busy, we weren't rushed and there was still plenty of space to view everything. The paintings were sublime, the creative works of art were as witty as one would expect. A complete surprise for me was the jewellery. I don't know why I hadn't anticipated the same sort of wit there, but it was all so cleverly executed. I don't say I liked everything in the museum, but I could nevertheless appreciate the work involved. If you are ever in the area, this museum is an absolute must.

reviewnospace: If you like the works of Dali,don't miss this. Our tickets were for the first time in the morning, which was good. Even then it was crowded. The entire museum from outside to everything within is a Dali creation. There is one whole room dedicated to his wife Gala. Another room with his tributes to Velasquez. We spent a good 2 hours including the jewelry collection.

reviewnospace:
Really enjoyed the visit. I hadn't realised how much work Dali had produced and such a variety. It was a shame about all the school groups - far too many at one time allowed in - maybe they should be limited in number and given time slots?
Good value for money - we paid €10 each as pensioners.

It was a shame about all the school groups - far too many at one time allowed in - maybe they should be limited in number and given time slots?  Good value for money - we paid €10 each as pensioners.

reviewnospace: Yes, it was packed with large tours and yes,they don't provide you with much information, but don't let that keep you from visiting this unique museum. We left with a greater appreciation of Dali as an artist and some inspiration to add to our own artistic pursuits. We arrived around 10:30 and there was a very short line to purchase tickets. I would suggest getting there when they open to avoid the tour groups. I agree with other reviews, you should not miss the jewels.

quote: Glad we made the drive up from Barcelona
reviewnospace: I was reluctant to make the drive up from Barcelona, but my wife and daughter convinced me to do so, and it was one of the highlights of our trip. Easily the most entertaining museum visit, as a trip through the mind of Salvador Dali is an amusing jaunt into an unusual place. This was a great way to spend a day.

reviewnospace:
Fantastic museum - very cool. Make sure you get there early as it gets very busy with zillions of French and Spanish schoolies. The jewellery exhibition which is separate is worth going to see. I didn't know he made jewellery - the pieces are stunning. Loved it.
Good car parking right next door.

reviewnospace: Amazing yet always crowded. The excellent Toy Museum nearby is half price with your Dali ticket. The only negative was that there wasn't much hands-on stuff.

quote: Excellent overview of Dali: a "bucket list" must see
reviewnospace:
The museum presents an excellent overview of some of the variety that Dali engaged in- and he tried his hand in much more than "just" painting!

Prior to visiting we watched an excellent BBC programme (Salvador Dalí: A Master of the Modern Era) on youtube which helped prepare us for the breadth of understanding of his art and life. The museum then presented the eccentricity, and also what I might call the more serious side, of his tremendous contribution to art. Don't get distracted by the kitsch, there is also amazing depth and on display. Thus, I am starting to appreciate how amazing he was, and will need to explore more of his works in Madrid and New York.

Figueres is easily connected to Barcelona via the Renfe train, and a great stop for a night or a week. Worth the trip from Barcelona. This is a "bucket list" must.

We booked first available tickets (online) for the morning and avoided long queues (even in April!).

Figueres is easily connected to Barcelona via the Renfe train, and a great stop for a night or a week. Worth the trip from Barcelona. This is a  bucket list  must.  We booked first available tickets (online) for the morning and avoided long queues (even in April!).

quote: crazy or genius? you need to see in order to decide.
reviewnospace: Took the fast train from Barcelona (about 40 min) to Figueres just to see the Dali Museum. It is amazing to see Dali's creations as they are so unique and diverse. He painted realistic paintings and at the same time created the most surrealistic settings. It is small but impressive place. Do not miss the entrance for the jewelry exhibition.

reviewnospace: This is a really fun, easy day trip from Barcelona. Skip guided, hand-held tours leaving from Barcelona - it's very easy to get to via the train. The Theatre-Museum is very interesting and fun - I think it's more about being an immersive, surreal experience, than the paintings of Dali, as the painting collection isn't all that great. Nonetheless, our group of two moms, and two 18 year old daughters all thoroughly enjoyed our time there. Don't miss the Dali jewel collection, accessible through another entrance outside the museum!

The only negative was the crazy line to get in. Expect to wait at least a hour. The line is intimidating, but it does move.

quote: A museum like you have never seen it before
reviewnospace:
With few days to visit Barcelona, I took the decision to take a train (1 hour trip to Figueres from Barcelona's train station) and go visit the Theatre-Museum, I have to say that I did not expect even a 1% of what I saw that day, I was impressed with everything, starting with the exhibition of jewels designed by the same Dali, plus all the museum that just seemed to transport you to Dali's dreamed place (you can imagine how crazy and insane this was).
I definitely recommend spending a day of your itinerary in this wonderful place, no matter if you are not a traditional museum lover, this will be a keeper in your memory, appreciating all the phases of the life of this splendid Spanish artist.

Really beautiful experience!

quote: SUBLIME BEYOND SURREAL - BUT WOE THE HORDES OF STUDENTS
reviewnospace:
A treasure trove beyond compare but choose the visiting hour carefully. My experience was marred by hordes of noisy jostling school children and several coach loads of insouciant students - they scarcely paid attention to the works of Dali, the Master.

The extent and varied nature of his work is revealed in his theatre museum. It is tiring as there is so much.

Do not miss out on the adjacent building housing the work in precious stones and metals - the jewels of the crown.

The old theatre structure works well for the displays in grand rooms and winding corridors, used by Dali like he used his house in Port Lligat, a 15 minute drive away across the mountain to the coastal villages on the other side of Roses.

Combining the two over a two day period is worthwhile, staying overnight in Cadaques or Roses to take advantage of the sea air, but there are many delights in Figueres and an abundance of good restaurants and shops.
titleopinion: SUBLIME BEYOND SURREAL - BUT WOE THE HORDES OF STUDENTS. A treasure trove beyond compare but choose the visiting hour carefully. quote: Mind Bending, must see with a good guide
reviewnospace:
My wife and I had a general knowledge of Dali and his works, as many do. We were prepared to be impressed by the museum he created. The tour [Viator] and in particular Feliciano, our guide, made the tour much more than the itinerary would suggest. The day's weather was rainy and overcast. We were to see the Theater Museum, Dali's shore house and the Village of Cadaqués.
Feliciano, was knowledgeable about Dali and shared his knowledge with the group in a very friendly and jovial manner. He made everyone feel at ease and had a way of paying individual attention to each participant - no easy when you have an international collection of tourists.
The museum itself is a must see. Seeing it with a guide like Feliciano, you understand what you are seeing and the mind of the mad genius that created all you are seeing.
The tour is not ant art lesson. It has the requisite tourist stops so you may contribute to the local economy. The right guide is indispensable in making this tour a memorable experience.

quote: Dont be put off by the "Theatre" name
reviewnospace: We were looking for the Dali Museum so kept avoiding this as we didn't think it was the right place - but it is. Knockout displays beautifully shown off in the old theatre. A couple of areas with non-Dali items were not clearly identified, Lots of info in English but not a coherent trail through the exhibits. Well worth the trip out from Barcelona on the high-speed train but be aware Figueres has 2 stations - one for the high-speed trains and one for the ordinary ones.

Well worth the trip out from Barcelona on the high-speed train but be aware Figueres has 2 stations - one for the high-speed trains and one for the ordinary ones.

reviewnospace:
When I think of Dali, I think of paintings and sketches. Yet this museum shows he was so much more than that. I loved his dragon sculptures as well as the masterpiece in the courtyard. Knowing he helped design the museum makes it even more precious. There were several pieces I didn't like, but that's the beauty of art-if one piece speaks to you, it's a success. More than one piece spoke to me. If you're anything of a Dali fan, GO! No excuses. And slow down, enjoy. My husband and I were amazed at the different things we saw from different vantage points in the museum.

We bought our tickets online and had zero wait to get inside. I highly recommend doing this.

reviewnospace:
This Theatre-Museum accommodate the most artworks of the career of Dali.
Figueres is a little town in Spain, near the frontier between France and Spain. It's the first town after the frontier "La Jonquerra", in the heart of Catalane.
The Theatre Dali is a ode of madness, he enchanted and let nobody indifferent,
All is like the artist Dali : eccentric.
Dali was born in Figueres 1904 and died 1989 and is bury in the museum.
Outside, the facade and decoration is still an attraction; On the roof I saw giant eggs
all around the construction; Inside you see first his black cadillac and of course all his paintings and madness.
This museum is a Theatre, a gigantic surrealistic object.
Dali was in, and is in.

quote: A wonderful day trip from Barcelona
reviewnospace:
This certainly ranks among the most unique museums one will encounter and left us with a new-found appreciation of Dali's work. There is a lot more to the experience than visiting the museum website can do justice to. Being able to see the wide range of his work made it clear that he wasn't just a surrealist but could create in any style that he chose.
The train trip was easy to negotiate and the walk to the museum wasn't difficult. We combined a late morning visit to the museum with an overnight stay in Girona on the way back to Barcelona. It made for an excellent little trip and we were very happy that we took the extra time to see the amazing Dali museum. Highly recommended (at least off-season).

reviewnospace:
Took a short drive (40 mins) from Argeles Sur Mer to Figueres to visit the Salvador Dali museum.

Really interesting and a good day out whether or not you are particularly interested in art. The variety of work (paintings, sculptures, jewellery, etc) is fantastic.

Parking (early July) was relatively easy (10 Euros) and entry was 12 Euros each (9 Euros concessions). One word of warning ... although Figueres and the Dali Museum are well signposted as you head South on the motorway ... once in Figueres it is a bit more tricky and we relied on the Sat Nav !

Figueres itself looks a nice little place itself. There are many catalan style restaurants that surround the museum so light refreshments / lunch afterwards is a good option.

We then drove 20 minutes to Roses, a small beach resort town ... just to have a look but it looks nice and maybe worth a separate day trip in the future.
titleopinion: Really enjoyable. Took a short drive (40 mins) from Argeles Sur Mer to Figueres to visit the Salvador Dali museum.  Really interesting and a good day out whether or not you are particularly interested in art. The variety of work (paintings, sculptures, jewellery, etc) is fantastic.   Parking (early July) was relatively easy (10 Euros) and entry was 12 Euros each (9 Euros concessions). One word of warning ... although Figueres and the Dali Museum are well signposted as you head South on the motorway ... once in Figueres it is a bit more tricky and we relied on the Sat Nav !  Figueres itself looks a nice little place itself. There are many catalan style restaurants that surround the museum so light refreshments / lunch afterwards is a good option.  We then drove 20 minutes to Roses, a small beach resort town ... just to have a look but it looks nice and maybe worth a separate day trip in the future.

quote: Even you're not a Dali fan, worth it
reviewnospace: As I visited the palace theatre in low season, no need to buy tix online in advance. It saves me some 7€ as no surcharges for buying at the entrance pt and I got reduced fare for my mum that was not available on web. A pity that we went on Sun when all shops in the little town closed. The egg-looking appearance is not seen at the entrance. It's at the back when you're approaching the jewel exhibition. Also fun for non artistic lovers or Dali fans. Amazing thoughts behind the exhibits. No wonder it's one of the top most visited museums in Spain. Can easily find it by following the directions on streets after leaving the regional train station.

reviewnospace:
This museum is testament to Dali's everlasting quest for extravagance, in life and in death - how many people buried in their museums do you know! Endowed with a very non-standard way of thinking the man didn't really need to commercialize it to such degree as turning pretentious and pompous.

There are not many famous paintings in this museum but it's still an interesting place. The jewelry collection is quite remarkable too. It's not the kind of museum one would visit time and again, seeing it only once would suffice.

I intentionally avoided going there during Christmas week after reading those reviews about hour-long lines. We went there first week of January and there was just one couple in front of us at the ticket office. The combination ticket costs €14. If you go by car there's a fairly inexpensive parking garage right behind the museum, just follow the signs.

Fortunately, we had a guide who was able to explain and give us context, background and symbolism behind most of his works.

quote: A wonderful short day trip outside Barcelona
reviewnospace: We took the train from the central station in Barcelona (near plac d' Espania) to Figueres, home of the Dalvador Dali museum. The round trip train fare was about $45.00 USD and is about an hour + depending on whether you take the local train or express (TGV). Its a short walk from the train station to the center of town (maybe 1/2 mile). We took a taxi in and he definitely took us the long route, only to discover how close of a walk it was ( for the walk back to the Figueres station!) Not really much to do in Figueres aside from the Dali Museum but that alone well worth the day trip. The museum is pretty incredible. So much of Dali's work all in one location.

reviewnospace:
The museum is approximately 90 minutes from Barcelona. It's located in the charming town of Figueres where Dali was born, and there are several tours out of Barcelona that include this museum on their day trip itinerary.

If you go, tour the jewel museum (separate ticket) in the back of the museum, where going through the door is an experience unto itself.

Since pictures speak louder than words, I'm attaching a several to this review.

It's located in the charming town of Figueres where Dali was born, and there are several tours out of Barcelona that include this museum on their day trip itinerary.  If you go, tour the jewel museum (separate ticket) in the back of the museum, where going through the door is an experience unto itself. quote: "Art and Genius in one Mind" Dalí Theatre and Museum
reviewnospace:
- The Best attraction in Catalunya. 12-hours activity. Never miss it.
- The museum is located in the small Catalonian town "Figueres", 120 km north of Barcelona.
- I went with the Catalunyan Bus Turistic. It is easier, more comfortable with an excellent tour guide specially for the important topics in the museum, added to be the cheaper (65 €) than the Renfe (rapid train), I got two discounts; one from the hotel and the other from booklet of the bus touristic. The trip included a nice stop for a guided tour in Gerona too. Includes the tickets to Dali Museum and Jewlery museum (14 €).
- I took the bus from Catalunya square and retuned there. (8 am to 7:30 pm).. Needs reservation ....
- The museum displays most diverse personal collection of works by Dalí, paintings from all decades, Dalí sculptures, 3-dimensional collages, mechanical devices, and other Dalí's greatest works.
- Dalí is buried in a crypt below the stage floor and the glass geodesic dome cupola.
- The Jewlery museum displays a collection of jewelry he designed.
- The museum is one of the most rich experiences in all my travels.

(8 am to 7:30 pm).. reviewnospace: Our son lives in Barcelona so we try to get here once a year and we havent had the chance to visit the Dali museum before this. l It is a commitment: a 1 hour train ride costing $32 round trip each, a bus ride into the city for another euro per person each way, we unfortunately arrived with 3 groups of very exuberant french students, but the otherwise empty museum (I would hate to be here in the summer) was a unique pleasure. Dali apparently designed it himself and it is unique. The amazing range of his imagination and skill is breathtaking. Even tho I have seen a wonderful Dali retrospective in Atlanta, it did not hint at his amazing range. Over all, it was well worth the trip and the expense. I highly recommend you keep this in your itinary if you are traveling to Barcelona.

quote: Best day trip from Barcelona hands down!!!
reviewnospace: You have options when it comes to taking a day trip from Barcelona, but the Dali Theatre and Museum should be your first choice, hands down. The building is a local theatre that burned down. Dali rebuilt it and made it his masterpiece. Everything is designed by him, and it's like stepping into Wonderland. Filled with secrets (his grave is unmarked, for instance, so visitors often step on him without knowing!) and eccentricities (Mona Lisa mustache, anyone?) it is one of the COOLEST places I've ever seen! Room 15 features a mural painted on the ceiling with Dali and Gala, Dali's body consisting of empty drawers turned upside down, as if to say, "this is all I have to give." And where did I learn these awesome tidbits, since there's no audio guide? I asked the staff, who I assume was made completely of Dali scholars as their passion for the art truly showed. They were also really excited to show me everything the museum had to offer and made it all a great discovery. If you have the full day, take the extra hour drive up to Dali's house and you'll understand just how he became the genius we all know and love today.

reviewnospace: I went to the Dali Museum in December 2015 with my mum, my young daughter age 4 and my son aged 12. We all enjoyed the experience very much. I was already an avid Dali lover; but of course the kids had not much experience. There was a lot of art work and instillations, and you could follow the progress through the museum according to the path laid out by Dali himself. We also managed to stop for Tapas at the little square next to the museum and that was lovely. There was a short queue even though it was the middle of winter, and also the signs to the museum where on the highway but after that we REALLY needed the GPS because the signs from the highway to the museum itself were scant and insufficient. Overall, this is an experience we will remember. I was really pleased also how much the kids enjoyed and appreciated all the artwork. Recommended.

reviewnospace:
This was another highlight of Barcelona for us. We travelled there a couple of days ago on a Sunday and everything was a breeze from the fast train, the bus pick up from the satin to the actual museum, I know that it is winter so I don't know how busy it gets at other times but we had no queues and were able to walk in without waiting . We were also able to view the exhibits leisurely and without any crowds. The actual works were amazing and I now have a new appreciation of Dali's works. When studying art at school they made such an emphasis on his surrealism work so that I didn't realize he had painted other styles What a relation.
My husband was a non Dali lover but after being here he too has come away with a totally changed attitude and was so grateful about joining me on the trip.
We had enough time up our sleeve to walk back to the station which is very easy and comfortable to do - allow 20 minutes.There was an excellent pinxto bar in town providing great service and excellent well priced pinxtos. I forgot to record the name but it is on the other side of the road to the cafeteria if hat helps.
This journey does take a day ( by the time you have the train ride on the rapid - an hur each way, plus the museum time) so it's worth going if you have a reasonable amount of time in Barcwlona otherwise you will be compromising visiting other Barcelona sights.

quote: A Must-See Dali Masterpiece! A Fantastical, Wacky, Bonkers, Arty Extravaganza!
reviewnospace:
FANTASTIC! Some of Dali's most wacky, bonkers & wonderful creations displayed in a converted theatre for an all-round auditorium-like viewing experience!
Of course, Dali himself was behind the design & layout of this place, so it really is the perfect space for a museum/gallery! It's not one of those stuffy old museums... here, you're allowed to take as many photos as you like of all the amazing paintings, fabulous sculpture & interesting artefacts, and staff on the doors & around the building are all very friendly, lending a generous spirit & open atmosphere to this fantastical Dali paradise!
Personal favourites include the central courtyard (open to the elements) where the old theatre stalls once sat. And of course the old stage area with that gorgeous, massive Dali painting overseeing all the modern day visitors to this glorious cacophony of surrealism! Definitely not to be missed! xxx

Of course, Dali himself was behind the design & layout of this place, so it really is the perfect space for a museum/gallery! Personal favourites include the central courtyard (open to the elements) where the old theatre stalls once sat. And of course the old stage area with that gorgeous, massive Dali painting overseeing all the modern day visitors to this glorious cacophony of surrealism! Definitely not to be missed! xxx

reviewnospace: If in Figueres, this is a must. I believe queues in summer can be horrendous but when I was there in winter, there were no queues and very few people inside. Nothing prepared me for the scale of some of the exhibits and there are some really wonderful paintings. It may not be for everyone as some of the other reviews indicate but if you are into Dali or simply open to a visual onslaught, then this is a must. I don't profess to be very knowledgeable about art but I did come away with my head reeling with all sorts of ideas. Beware if the carpark. It can become very costly. Better to park in one of the other car parks around the city or, if you stay at The Hotel a Plaza Inn ( highly recommended), you can park at a designated car park for 10 EU pd.

I believe queues in summer can be horrendous but when I was there in winter, there were no queues and very few people inside. Nothing prepared me for the scale of some of the exhibits and there are some really wonderful paintings. It may not be for everyone as some of the other reviews indicate but if you are into Dali or simply open to a visual onslaught, then this is a must. I don't profess to be very knowledgeable about art but I did come away with my head reeling with all sorts of ideas. Beware if the carpark. It can become very costly. Better to park in one of the other car parks around the city or, if you stay at The Hotel a Plaza Inn ( highly recommended), you can park at a designated car park for 10 EU pd.

quote: Nice collection of arts by Salvador Dali.
reviewnospace:
Honestly, I didn't know much about Salvador Dali (came here as part of a tour package) but I was excited about seeing the world famous and the superstar of surrealist art, the Melting Clocks.

In the end, with the help of the guide, I learnt much about this famous artist and more about his work of art. If you are around town, it is worth a visit. Otherwise, just come from afar if you love Dali's work (My parents and other group members didn't really appreciate surrealism so for them it was a waste of time).

reviewnospace: This is a fitting monument to the great man. Though he seemed a bit of a nutter he was highly talented, and you soon pick up on that in this once-monastery. There are sketches, paintings, and some exquisite jewellery to see as well as many sculptures and installations.. The only drawback I found was groups of people that wanted to take photos rather than look, which made for many blockages around the narrow passages.

quote: Not many of his best works
reviewnospace: My husband and I took the trip to the Dali Theater Museum from barcelona and were a bit disappointed with this visit since there were not many of his better known artworks on display and there was little information about his life and his art. I can understand that his best art is displayed in other museums, but I wish they had more information about him and his art. At least a chronological presentation would have helped, to allow us to see his development as an artist. I think Dali preferred his work shown in no particular order, but I wish there was more information given. The long travel from barcelona was not worth it.

quote: A Must See for Dali Lovers
reviewnospace: I have recently retired from teaching high school art for 22 years. Dali has always been my favorite and I must say that anyone who loves his work should put the Dali Museum on their bucket list. I live close to the Dali Museum in St Petersburg Florida and it is a work of art all by itself. Having been there many times I knew that his Mothership Museum in Figures was a - must do. This building houses an incredible collection of his works- from his early pieces to a separate building that has a collection of his custom jewelry pieces. I highly recommend a visit to this museum you will not be disappointed.

reviewnospace: Most of Dali's works are unforgettable and this museum is a collection of unforgettable things, starting with the exterior and continuing throughout. The surprise of the Abraham Lincoln portrait, the Mae West room, the many paintings of Dali's muse, Gala, the surprises go on and on, even including pieces of jewelry that were creative and beautiful, not zany like many of Dali's other efforts. If you're a fan of Dali's you will love this museum.

reviewnospace: This museum is not stuffy in any way as Dali's odd work and lifestyle are the feature. It is incredibly interesting and like his work great fun with the unexpected around every corner. If you are in the Northern Costa Brava this is a must visit. Closed on Mondays and expect queues.

It is incredibly interesting and like his work great fun with the unexpected around every corner. If you are in the Northern Costa Brava this is a must visit. Closed on Mondays and expect queues.

reviewnospace: Designed by Dali himself, the museum is an overwhelming experience - not just the paintings, but the sculpture, design, furniture...everything. Most paintings do not have a label and there are no audio guides available, as Dali wanted visitors to absorb his work in its entirety. We took a bus trip from Catalunya Bus Turistica from Barcelona and our tour guide briefed us the sequence of the rooms. It may be best to take a look at the museum website and also research significances of the symbols used by Dali beforehand for a better understanding.

quote: A Must See(And Experience) in Spain
reviewnospace: The Dali Theatre-Museum in Figueres was for me the highlight of our recent trip to Spain,and we had many great experiences during our 10 day trip around the country.I never fully appreciated the brilliance,psychological insight,and satiric humor of Dali until our afternoon long tour of this marvel,including the remarkable Museum of (Dali) Jewelry next door.The upraised boat with the blue plastic tear drops hanging from the boat's underside in the courtyard area reflecting his sadness over the death of his beloved wife Gala was very moving,and the room using various objects to comprise the image of Mae West was clever beyond imagination.Dali designed the museum and the placement of items himself,and his wit in doing so is on display throughout The museum is a short walk from the Figueres Train Station,a one hour ride on Renfe from Barcelona.Plan on having a great time here.

reviewnospace: Too crowded to the point of claustrophobia, incoherently curated ramshackle collection of mostly the dregs of Dali's work. The building is the highlight but after the initial very striking courtyard it disintegrated into a messy shambles with almost no written context to aid visitors. It left the unfortunate impression that Dali could not paint very well. None of his "great" Surrealist paintings were there. There was no information about his life. The jewels were hideous unless you are a fan of tacky bling. Go to any museum with a proper jewellery collection and you will see incredible craft and beauty - but not here.

reviewnospace:
Worthwhile making the effort to leave Barcelona. We were told all tours were full, but decided to make our own way anyway. We booked Renfe fast train online ( they tell you to print ticket out beforehand) but we saw people using eticket on mobile phone???? We easily caught a bus to within short walking distance of the Dali museum and arrived an hour earlier than opening and were in front of the queue ( we didn't have pre booked tickets online). There weren't too many people on this Wednesday.
Be warned they take your larger handbag and you need small change for the interactive exhibits.
Allow the plenty of time to get back to the train station as there weren't any taxis or buses to be had when we wanted them and we missed our train by 1 minute
You can walk but allow 20 mins!
The town is quaint with lots of atmosphere, Tapas etc so allow time to linger. Allow a full day is our recommendation but you could do it in less.

The museum itself is interesting, Dali was a "crazy" person- you see stuff there that are not common. Since i'm not an art expert at the end it kind of start being boring, but in general it was good experience. I wouldn't miss it.

quote: Do not go there if you are a lover of Dali
reviewnospace:
Yes, do not go, especially if you are a true lover of Dali, because:
- you will see only a few of his famous works - museum does not possess a good collection despite its name
- you will not be provided with a single piece of information on the works which are on the display
- even those works which belong to Dali and you could possibly admire are displayed in very narrow corridors there you cannot observe them
- museum is filled with works of other artists on which there is no information - who these artists are and why they are on the display
- museum staff is the most careless that we encountered during all our visit to Barcelona

Instead, if you are a truly lover of Dali:
- look for a good exhibition which purposely collected his works and head there - be it somewhere in a big cities of the world which are easily reachable nowadays.

TA is a great place to help others as long as we are sincere.

reviewnospace: Even if you are not a big fan of Dali, go. There are few museums designed by the artist as you will find here. It is representative of Dali's work in a way you will generally not see in any other museum. Dali was involved in both the design of the museum and how the work was installed. The jewelry exhibit is a must. Take the high speed train from Barcelona; you get there in about 50 minutes. After the museum take a walk around the town of Figueres and have a bite or a drink at one of small place around the area of the museum. You will enjoy yiuself.
titleopinion: Enjoy the imagination. Even if you are not a big fan of Dali, go. There are few museums designed by the artist as you will find here. It is representative of Dali's work in a way you will generally not see in any other museum. Dali was involved in both the design of the museum and how the work was installed. The jewelry exhibit is a must. Take the high speed train from Barcelona; you get there in about 50 minutes. After the museum take a walk around the town of Figueres and have a bite or a drink at one of small place around the area of the museum. You will enjoy yiuself.

reviewnospace:
With a very good train service from Barcelona and Girona or an easy drive from anywhere else in between - it is easy enough to come to Figueres and visit the Dali Museum. We didn't book in advance, but being here in September, it wasn't peak tourist time either, so to avoid long waits in the sun, it is easy enough to book online, even a day in advance. In typical Dali fashion, always the master of disguise...the building on the outside is square, but step inside and its round....always something to challenge your thinking... I found myself getting frustrated (not in a negative way tho) with his multi dimensional works I just could not see what others could...is it Lincoln or is it pixels with the back of a naked Gala? Whilst I could not see Lincoln, my camera did !?
Dali didn't want explanations of his works printed,he wanted people to come to their own decisions what the works meant, and what they were seeing - so if you are going on your own it would pay to read in advance - or have pages of a guide book with you - as personally I think you miss out on some of the experience and most of the context, not knowing what he was trying to portray.
The seemingly ordered approach to the building hides that fact that inside are a labyrinth of rooms, and you keep questioning yourself if you have seen everything.
Don't come expecting to see the best of his works here, there are some, but most are not....however what you will see is a good cross section of his paintings, art sculpture, furniture and some video works...and all in a very theatrical, very Dali setting.
To see the Dali Jewels exhibit, you will exit the main building and walk around the back - you at least need to see this, as whilst the front of the Museum is a traditional looking white/grey building, with of course a few 'quirks', for instance gold figures on the top edge holding baguettes !...the back is terracotta/red with white eggs and gold figures on the top edge --- A unique experience even for non-Dali fans.
titleopinion: Entertaining, surprising, confusing, amazing...... The seemingly ordered approach to the building hides that fact that inside are a labyrinth of rooms, and you keep questioning yourself if you have seen everything. Don't come expecting to see the best of his works here, there are some, but most are not....however what you will see is a good cross section of his paintings, art sculpture, furniture and some video works...and all in a very theatrical, very Dali setting. reviewnospace: Being in a house where sometimes in the past used to live one of the worlds most famous and most wanted artists was such a miracle. In every room and space you could see specific period of Dali's life. You would meet his whole life, problems he was dealing with and one of the most beautiful piece of art. Every picture hides a different story and its up to you to discover it on your unique way. Its not only interesting visit for the ones who appreciate art but also for the ones who doesnt have much in touch with. I felt the energy of the place and it really took my breathe, so I would recommend anyone to spend some time in this magical house of true art.

quote: Something totally different, new mind dimension!
reviewnospace:
This place will make you observe the world from a completely different dimension. You will be delighted, surprised, fascinated and astonished at the same time.
Even if you don't like Salvador's art, you will be impressed by his masterworks. His brilliant mind, unconventional ideas and different life philosophy makes this place so special and distinguish.
If you are staying in Barcelona, be sure to reserve one day to visit this awesome museum and walk down the streets of lovely Figueres, Salvador Dali birthplace.

You will be delighted, surprised, fascinated and astonished at the same time. Even if you don't like Salvador's art, you will be impressed by his masterworks. His brilliant mind, unconventional ideas and different life philosophy makes this place so special and distinguish. If you are staying in Barcelona, be sure to reserve one day to visit this awesome museum and walk down the streets of lovely Figueres, Salvador Dali birthplace.

reviewnospace:
To simply call Salvador Dali a surrealist would be like saying Thomas Edison made good peanut butter sandwiches.
Dali drew, painted, and sculpted in every style, including his own. He was also a master showman. He marketed himself brilliantly. When you enter the museum, which he designed, you enter a whole other world. It's the world of Dali. His talent was boundless, as is the organization of the museum, which seems to be a hodgepodge of his works. Don't be fooled. Everything is a setup for the next, or perhaps a coda for the previous work. Even his custom-made Cadillac has a catch to it. It rains inside. Se it. Enjoy it.
titleopinion: EXPECT THE UNEXPECTED. To simply call Salvador Dali a surrealist would be like saying Thomas Edison made good peanut butter sandwiches. Dali drew, painted, and sculpted in every style, including his own. He was also a master showman. He marketed himself brilliantly. When you enter the museum, which he designed, you enter a whole other world. It's the world of Dali. His talent was boundless, as is the organization of the museum, which seems to be a hodgepodge of his works. Don't be fooled. Everything is a setup for the next, or perhaps a coda for the previous work. Even his custom-made Cadillac has a catch to it. It rains inside. Se it. Enjoy it.

reviewnospace: We arrived in Figueres by train from Calella - train ticket cost around 20 euros per person roundtrip. From the station to Salvador Dali Museum I walk about 10 minutes (there are signs). I bought tickets on the Internet a few days prior to Salvador Dali Museum and jewelry collection. When arrived to the museum go on the ticket shop situated on its left side, for changing e-ticket to the access tickets. I visited the Dali Museum in about 150 minutes. For sightseeing, I used a guide downloaded from the Internet, which was very good. On leaving the museum I got it right and on the corner is the entrance to the museum's collection of jewelry. I recommend to visit that because it is beautiful.

quote: Blew My Expectations out of the Water
reviewnospace: I would not say I was an expect in Dali prior to visiting the museum. However, after visiting the museum I was blown away by his visionary. Dali certainly thinks outside the box and outside anywhere else I may imagine. The collection is vast and as varied as his lifestyle and imagination. The building itself is large and I recommend you schedule 3 - 4 hours to visit as you certainly can't rush this museum. We arrived very early in the morning to avoid line ups and congestion within the museum. We were correct because when we left at noon the line up was down the street. Don't go to Figueres without stopping by.

The building itself is large and I recommend you schedule 3 - 4 hours to visit as you certainly can't rush this museum. quote: Worth a side trip to Figueres
reviewnospace: I have never been a huge fan of Dalí and the surrealists; however, this museum is a thrill. It was completely designed by Dalí himself and is indeed a single integrated piece of art all by itself. The exterior is wonderful and entertaining, as is the sculpture around the front. Once you are in, the introduction explains that while a pathway is arranged from 1-22, Dalí himself would have rebelled at any kind strict sequence, so we did it all wickely-wackely and had a great time going against the flow of the visitors. Close to the end we realized we had missed one whole floor which provided us with a completely unexpected "dessert". It was also where we found most of the Bosch-like drawings and the melting clocks. Try to visit the museum when you are not pressed by schedule and take your time. Every minute you spend there is rewarded by new treats.
titleopinion: Worth a side trip to Figueres. I have never been a huge fan of Dalí and the surrealists; however, this museum is a thrill. Once you are in, the introduction explains that while a pathway is arranged from 1-22, Dalí himself would have rebelled at any kind strict sequence, so we did it all wickely-wackely and had a great time going against the flow of the visitors. Close to the end we realized we had missed one whole floor which provided us with a completely unexpected  dessert . It was also where we found most of the Bosch-like drawings and the melting clocks. Try to visit the museum when you are not pressed by schedule and take your time. Every minute you spend there is rewarded by new treats.

quote: Overwhelming in the sweep of the collection!
reviewnospace: It is here that one gets a sense of the sure hand that Dali had as a draftsman as well as his vision. Of course, there are the monumental and iconic pieces. To be in this place is to be subsumed inside the man's art, to be on display with it, and, perhaps, catch a glimpse of the world through his eyes, too. ... O.K., enough of that. ... While that's all true, it's also true that we waited in line for about 90 minutes to get in and, once inside the collection was overwhelming, eye-catching, and ultimately (for this patron) exhausting ... as was the crowd. Admission includes the graphic and sculptural art of the Museo, also the Joues (a separate collection of jewelry). We were exhausted by the main exhibits, so did not get to the Joues. During the spring and summer, we were told, plan to spend "the better part" of a day here, if you can.
titleopinion: Overwhelming in the sweep of the collection!. It is here that one gets a sense of the sure hand that Dali had as a draftsman as well as his vision. Of course, there are the monumental and iconic pieces. reviewnospace: Visited the Dali Theatre Museum on a rainy day in October. It is amazing and a "must do" if you are anywhere near in this area of Northern Spain. As well as the fantastic works of art, the actual setting and display of them in the theatre is a work of art in itself. This would be a great attraction whether or not you know anything about Dali or his life, but it is definitely doing some research around the man before you go, because it makes it much more interesting.

This would be a great attraction whether or not you know anything about Dali or his life, but it is definitely doing some research around the man before you go, because it makes it much more interesting.

reviewnospace:
This museum is awesome. We came by train from Barcelona (it took about 2 hours). We tried to buy the tickets online but there was a problem with the system and we coudn't. Keep in mind that this is a very busy museum and the ticket line is very long.
You can take photos inside and you don't have to pay an extra charge.
Definetly worth the trip.

reviewnospace: Came by train from Blanes, nice scenery, cheap and pretty fast (80km, took little over an hour, roughly 13 euros round-trip per person). Couple minutes queue (at around 11.30 am), decent entry-fee, bags not allowed but free lockerroom (although sign said 1 euro). Spent a few hours in the museum, gasping as the various creations, very entertaining and enlightening!! I can only say "go see for yourself!" :-)
