reviewnospace:
Figueres is a dainty little town, with a traditional Spanish personality, and a twist of madness. And yes you guessed it, this madness has been influenced by the crazy coconut Salvador Dali.

Dali is my favourite artist. He brings alive sexual desire with a theatrical flair. His creativity with the anatomy and physiology of the human body leaves you feeling amazed at its beauty, but yet questioning its possibility.

He had an uncanny ability to allow the taboo of sexual desire, masturbation and fornication - to be natural, normal and without shame or judgement. As it should be.

Dali's creativity stems far from the canvas, to sculptures, jewellery, theatre, movies and the list goes on.

I spent over 5 hours in the Dali Theatre- Museum, and this has been one of the highlights of my trip so far. It is worth the train ride from Barcelona to embrace the works of this genius.

Enjoy

quote: Enlightening : now I know who Dali was!
reviewnospace: The old theatre was where Dali wanted his showcase to be. Like him, it is a grand , dramatic representation of beauty specifically seen in his art, his jewelled pieces of sculpture, his film clips etc. He designed a room where he mimicked the ceiling of the Sistine chapel. It was incredible, very surrealist. His Works darken as the period of WW2 approached. I especially loved the series called Aliya. Watercolour drawings of concentration camp scenes, the ship :the Exodus and others about israel's creation. Of course there were lots of dripping clocks.A slow time consuming drive but well worth it.
titleopinion: Enlightening : now I know who Dali was!. The old theatre was where Dali wanted his showcase to be. Like him, it is a grand , dramatic representation of beauty specifically seen in his art, his jewelled pieces of sculpture, his film clips etc. He designed a room where he mimicked the ceiling of the Sistine chapel. It was incredible, very surrealist. His Works darken as the period of WW2 approached. I especially loved the series called Aliya. Watercolour drawings of concentration camp scenes, the ship :the Exodus and others about israel's creation. Of course there were lots of dripping clocks.A slow time consuming drive but well worth it.

It was actually created by Dali, so it’s very unique and fascinating, and really shows the brilliance of its work. Take your time to see everything, because from the floor you see one thing, but as you go up and take a look on the same piece, the perspective it’s completely different. I really loved jewelry museum as well. A little crowded (that’s the negative part).

It gets a little crowded when a big tour moves through it but if you just hang back and let them pass it becomes a magical place again.

reviewnospace: We caught the train from Barcelona to Figures to see this museum. The museum is about 1 mile from the train station and you walk through the town. The museum was heavily visited on our weekday trek. It is very eclectic and shows the range in Dali's artwork. There are a lot of stairs to navigate and the museum is a lot of rooms and hallways, with both indoor and outdoor venues. There is a section of the museum devoted to jewelry which is amazing. Dali's other works included paintings, sculptures, etchings, etc. It is amazing that he was able to accomplish so much creatively.

quote: A fascinating museum, unique and entertaining
reviewnospace: We were amazed by this Museum. We knew of Dali's paintings but did not appreciate how talented and varied an artist he was. The courtyard of the museum with the huge sculpture of the boat balanced on a car was fascinating and there were a number of other interesting sculptures around the museum as well some exquisite artworks. The jewellery was a big surprise, beautifully designed and made, we had no idea that Dali was so creative and brilliant. Even if you are not a fan of his surreal paintings, this museum is well worth a visit for the diversity of the art on display.

Even if you are not a fan of his surreal paintings, this museum is well worth a visit for the diversity of the art on display.

reviewnospace: This place is totally surreal and has genius written all over it. Not only the pieces inside which are unique in scope and inventiveness, but the actual museum itself is the perfect venue for the contents. I would go out of my way when in Catalonia just to visit Figueres and this museum. Dali himself designed everything, the museum and the art contained therein. Don't miss the jewels either, housed right next door and you can get in with the same ticket. They add further genius to Dali and his talent. Whether or not you "like" his work, this museum is a must on anyone's list. Please visit, you will not regret it!!!

reviewnospace: If you are a fan of the work of Salvador Dali, there are two places in the world that you must visit. One is in St Petersburg, Florida. The other is the Teatro Dali in Figueres. Figueres is a wonderful little city and the museum is a great excuse to visit. The collection is extensive. The museum will be packed. And make sure to add the Dali jewel collection at the end of the tour. His renderings of his more famous pieces in jewelry form is absolutely amazing.

And make sure to add the Dali jewel collection at the end of the tour. His renderings of his more famous pieces in jewelry form is absolutely amazing.

quote: A Bore...Save your Money and Have a Couple of Drinks or Coffees Outside in Figueres
reviewnospace:
Save the 12 euros apiece for admission. I've also been to the Dali museum in St. Petersburg and I know more than most about both Dali and 20th century art, so it's not like I am ignorant about the subject. The initial impression of the space itself is impressive and, after that, nothing. Some random other artists interjected totally out of context and without any information. In fact, information generally was sadly lacking.

A "must see"? Hardly. Skip it. You truly won't regret it.

reviewnospace: We are fans of Dali's work and had been wanting to go there for a while. We were going to Girona so we took a couple of days to visit it and we were so impressed! His work is truly amazing and so is the museum. We would recommend getting the audio guide to make it a complete experience, it is worth it. A must if you are visiting Barcelona, Girona or any near by town, trains are easy to get even though we rented a car (also a good idea of you like road trips).

reviewnospace: Found Dali more fun and playful than I expected. Overall well organized, easy to see and do. First off there is the "car", a lot of fun. Museum was a theater before it was a museum. The original stage is also a spectacle.
titleopinion: A must see indeed. Found Dali more fun and playful than I expected. Overall well organized, easy to see and do. First off there is the  car , a lot of fun. Museum was a theater before it was a museum. The original stage is also a spectacle.

reviewnospace: Clearly this is an art museum which will entertain the most hardened critic; Dali's enormous creativity provides many pieces that will bring a smile to almost anyone's lips. And they are displayed, often well displayed, in an interesting building. Having said that I understand that many of the works are reproductions - and even with my limited knowledge of Dali it was obvious that many of his most famous (best?) works were not here. But the worst criticism on the basis of our visit is that the numbers of visitors allowed in at any one time is far, far to many. There was only one ticket office open and only one turnstile available to leave (which might even be a problem in the event of an emergency). And the numbers were such that one couldn't really appreciate the works or comfortably read many of the captions. One couldn't help but feel that maximising income was the institution's major objective rather than allowing people to celebrate Dai's creativity and legacy. Obviously if your in Figueres you have to go, but try and identify a time with the least visitors.
titleopinion: Good but some buts.... But the worst criticism on the basis of our visit is that the numbers of visitors allowed in at any one time is far, far to many. Watch Dali's paintings, statues, installation art, jewellery designed by him and even furniture.. I always knew Dali was a genius, but this is a solid proof :)
Wanna go there again after studying more on him :)

I really enjoyed his jewelry. If you take a walk after the museum, go further than the streets and square next the museum. Nice shopping in Fuegeras.

reviewnospace:
Good:

- Very nice museum, a lot to see and discover
- Enough parking just next to the building
- The museum offers a free vestiaire where you can leave your backpack. (it's actually mandatory for one to leave their backpacks in that vestiaire)

Bad:

- Long waiting line but I guess this is normal for a museum like this. There were enough places next to the line to get some water or a coffee while waiting.
- In the afternoon more and more people entered the museum which resulted in a lot of pushing. Especially when groups pass you with a guide. If you are lucky, the guide is talking in a language you actually understand.... Free info.

quote: In order to understand Dali, you must book a guided tour, it changes the entire experience
reviewnospace:
I knew that Salvador Dali museum is an easy trip from Barcelona by train, and I also heard that people weren't impressed by this museum.
Since I never understood Dali till this trip, I preferred to book a guided tour since it was a family tour with 2 young kids.
We biked via hola shalom company and they took us in a great tour via Girona to Figueres.
The tour guides was excellent and finally I could really understand both Salvador and Gala and the various painting from different periods.
I really recommend taking a guided tour and not an audio guide, since the experience is totally different.

quote: An impressive museum, but there are things they could improve upon
reviewnospace: Given that the layout for the Dali Theatre & Museum was dictated by the Maestro, himself, there are some things they could improve upon. The exhibits were amazing and I would be foolish to try to critique them, what I wish was an option was the ability to rent one of those hand-held wands with an earpiece that shared information about the exhibits. Sadly, the exhibits only had the name and not much else on the placard to tell you anything. I felt that I was only getting a small fraction of the story because of this. It is definitely worth visiting, but the museum needs to bring some technology into the 21st century!

reviewnospace: Wow factor x 10, loved it, you have to make a visit. Give yourself plenty of time to take it all in.

reviewnospace: Anyone with a passing interest in art should visit this. Fantastic and wonderful, from cars that rain inside to glittering flamingos you can only see through an obscure peephole to gaunt and moving paintings of war and persecution, to statues, giant paintings, sculptures and hundreds if not thousands of pieces that demand to be looked at closely and understood. You can take all day and will still miss a huge amount. Dali was a master across so many art forms and the fact that some of his more "famous' pieces are not there is frankly irrelevant. Worth the air fare alone!

You can take all day and will still miss a huge amount. Dali was a master across so many art forms and the fact that some of his more  famous' pieces are not there is frankly irrelevant. reviewnospace: For anyone with a slightest interest in art, surrealism or Dali himself, the museum in Figures simply has to be on the 'to-do' list whilst visiting Catalonia. Words and superlatives cannot convey what a unique experience it is to take a step inside the world and mind of one of the most influential surrealists of recent times, and the museum offers great value for money too. I would advise booking ahead of your anticipated visiting time though, as due to the museum's popularity it is often difficult to buy a ticket on the door and get in straight away.

Well worth a little drive from wherever you were/are heading!!

quote: You must see this if nothing else.
reviewnospace: What a revelation this trip was! This was a full day trip from Barcelona and although it took some time getting there, it was well worth it. We were astounded at how forward-thinking Dali was and had no idea of how much he has contributed to hte art world and the world in general. 3D paintings before 3D was even thought about and pictures that changed if you viewed them through a camera! We were gob-smacked at some of the thing Dali did in his lifetime. QWe also visited the Dali Jewellry Museum next door and had no idea he did this. Some of the pieces were fantastic and none of it could be worn as day-to-day jewellry. We were so impressed, we have invested in a Dali book to learn more about him.

reviewnospace: This is a good place to visit for Dali aficionados. The idea of a museum inside of a theater is really cool. We saw a lot of art that we'd seen before, but also some things we'd never seen. It was really cool to be able to explore Dali's art from a 3D perspective as well. The museum is crowded on Saturdays and the path through the museum could be more organized.

quote: Imagine seeing Dali when you are the only person in the room!
reviewnospace:
I was traveling with my 25 year old grandson. When he was 13 we were in London together and stumbled on an exhibit of small Dali pen and ink drawings. There began his connection to Dali. So it was special that when we decided to meet in Spain, we were able to visit the museum in Figueres.

Almost everyone who commented on the Teatro-Museo complained about the crowds. So many people traveling today, especially in August, and they all want to visit the same 10 sites. How to avoid that?

I read that there were night hours at the Museum. I was able to book tickets for the museum and an English language tour for a day that fit our schedule. Night hours are from 10:30 PM to 1 AM, (pretty amazing hours for a NYer!). At the start of the evening it was crowded, but the museum staff kept saying how fortunate we were to be there when it was relatively empty!

The tour was really wonderful and informative. We learned so much about the museum and Dali's involvement in every detail of its construction. It lasted from 10:30 to midnight. Then we were invited to the courtyard for a glass of champagne.

After midnight the crowds began to dissipate. By 12:30 there were so few people that we were able to enter galleries alone. What a special gift to be alone with our thoughts in front of Dali's works of art.

If it fits it in your plans, do go at night. Tours are offered in several languages and are a nice addition. But definitely buy your tickets in advance.

The museum tickets also includes entrance to an adjoining site, Dali's Jewels. Interesting, but if time is limited, skip it and stay in the main building.

reviewnospace: The Dali museum was really enjoyable, more than many others I've been. There is so much variety in his work, and so many small details to see that could easily be potentially missed. My only gripe with the experience was that the amount of tourists pushing their way through made it a bit difficult to appreciate those details. All in all though, this is a great museum to experience and I would recommend going really early or really late to appreciate it properly.

The only thing I didn't like : it was incredibly crowded, it was hard to move and breathe in there, there was no control at the door (I even heard some of the museum guards complaining about that) they just kept letting people in. Children were running unattended, touching the exhibits, it was a mess.

quote: I was blown away by the multitalented Dali!!!
reviewnospace:
My wife wanted to visit the Dali Museum during our Barcelona 2015 trip. I went along with the idea to enjoy with Jill her love of Dali's work. I was blown away!!!!!

I had relatively little knowledge about Dali's art, other than a Dali display in the museum in Budapest last year.

I found out later, that he set up the museum for the community of Figueres by himself. The museum is the perfect place to experience Dali's fun loving art.

I was delighted to discover the many kinds of art he was so great at. Dali was even a goldsmith. His work is exquisite.

One of the most unique museums in Spain! It's like if you see the word through Dali's eyes. The museum is extremely popular so be smart and don't go during high season (July/August) there are long cues for entering the museum and with 30 degrees it's not that pleasant to wait.
So or book tickets online in advance or go at night! The museum reopens at 22:00 till 00:30 and it's more quiet than during the day in high season.

Read something about Dali before visiting or book a guided tour so you can experience the museum at its best.
Student discount is available.

A small museum in a small town with a big name artist hosting the only show in town. This draws big BIG crowds. It's hard to buy tickets on the day, booking online in advance is the way to go. I found that the Jewellery room was much better the main space.
The staff were friendly and the price was reasonable. But my word, the crowds was too much. No way to take in and digest any art show.

reviewnospace: We stopped by the museum on a whim and were thrilled with the experience. A brilliantly curated selection of Dali's work in a surreal walk through. If you appreciate Dali this is a must if you are in the vicinity.

reviewnospace: This man - Dali - was (and is) unique in its kind and a phenomenan. Gorgeous museum, paintings, sculptures, jewels, etc - wonderful. Not to forget the museum itself which is spectacular itself.

quote: Weird, fascinating. Worth visiting. Even our kids loved it.
reviewnospace:
Compared to a typical art gallery, this was very engaging and interesting throughout. A wide range of sketches, paintings, installations, jewellery, and general weirdness. We overheard a few comments from one of the guides which revealed a depth to some of the large paintings which were not immediately obvious.
Note that this is not just a building full of paintings on the walls; the art is much more integrated into the whole building and is much more of an exploration than just walking about in some dry rooms which can be the experience in some galleries.
Our kids 10,13,15 all enjoyed it and thought it was great fun, which is not their normal view of art museums. We queued only for about 10mins as we arrived at about 950am or so and were near the front of the queue. The queue seemed badly organised as those who booked in advance just queued with everyone else. Mad.
A highly enjoyed destination; also enjoyed Figuerues more generally - had a nice atmosphere and may return to just wander around some more.

quote: Must do, if you love art
reviewnospace:
Unique museum. Even if you do not want to go in or are not a fan and do not want to pay the fee which is maybe a bit steep for a whole family, it is worth just seeing the building. I made a special trip and turned it into a sightseeing afternoon at Figures.
It was maybe a little too busy. Sometimes you cannot enjoy the smaller works of art, you have to keep moving instead of stopping to look and take it in. Would try and go nearer to closing time again.
Out of season at noon, the queue was over a half hour wait.

quote: Wow is all I have to say.....this is simply one for the bucket list, a must see!
reviewnospace:
Unique, unusual, eccentric, different, brilliant, these are words you think of when you visit the museum. The Dalí Theatre-Museum is simply incredible. As the largest surrealistic object in the world, it is located in the former Municipal Theatre, a former 19th century construction that went bankrupt, destroyed at the end of the Spanish Civil War. On its ruins, Dalí decided to create his museum with careful attention to selecting everything he loved. So from the outside in, he created all the interesting details of the museum, from the funky looking gold egg shaped ornaments on the rooftop, all the other ornaments on both the outside and in. Inside are many of his famous paintings, artwork, and fun and immagination. Dali of course is buried in this museum - which is his own shrine to himself. You have to love his imagination and creativity.
We visited the spectacular Salvador Dali museum – gallery that only Dali could design. Of course it is chocker-block full of his unusual – unique…eccentric art, vending machines to put coins in to see different displays of his art. The uniqueness of his art and this museum goes on and on. The museum is located in the town of Figueres where Dali was born. We each got one of the t shirts from the gift shop....who could resist his unique design. Would recommend to anyone. Would go back again. It is the main draw to this town. We traveled from Besalu to Figures, then onto Pals and Peratallada, en route to Tossa de Mar. This is a very special museum!

reviewnospace:
The Dali Theatrie-Museum is not a "visit" but an experience! And it is an experience which challenges, entertains, baffles, pleases and teases.....

I can't imagine anyone walking in here and not being intriqued. While Dali's work might not be to everyone's liking, I would think that anyone who has an inclination toward creativity would be astounded by the vision/art of Dali.

Last note: I don't generally buy books in the gift shops -- but I did buy a book here,,and am glad that it contains images of the museum and its contents which I've yet to see portrayed elsewhere .....and those images transport me instantly to the the delightful day which I spent here.

quote: A great surreal day out from Barcelona
reviewnospace:
We got the renfe fast train from barcelona. I couldn't figure out how to do the online ticket so wants to the sants station the day before and got them from the machine. I was glad about that because this train can fill up quick. I bought my tickets online for the museum,,,also a good idea as it avoids the queues, the train to Figueres-Vilifant took about 90mins ,and the taxi from the station to the museum was about €10 and about 10mins.

The museum itself was great, a lot to see, and some good stuff ( not all of it is in museums elsewhere), and of course very quirky, what else would you expect. The town itself is nice and there are lots of cafés and restaurants near the museum - it was a relaxing change from the barcelona madness.

reviewnospace: Even though I was still really 'tired' from the night before, I still fully enjoyed visiting this awesome place. The inside of the building is as spectacular as the outside. The museum was like a labyrinth (to me) and that perfectly captured the spirit of Dalí!

But i recommend it anyway !

quote: Eye Opening - Surprisingly Intimate And Theatrical Experience
reviewnospace: Locals recommend on-street parking on the weekend but just follow signs for ample convenient car parking - don't despair even multi-storey car parking paid by the minute is a reasonable value. No prior Dali knowledge required - the layout is compact, but do take time to linger and explore as there are surprises in every room and Dali's magic commands attention as it weaves its spell. Leave an additional 15mins to view the exterior and explore the vicinity.

reviewnospace:
This is a kind of "Must see" museum! Even though I was not really a big fan of Dali, this museum is amazing, very unique and definitely worth to spend here some time and money for the entry. I would dare to say it is like no other museum worldwide.
Salvadore Dali conceived and designed himself the whole museum, so it is the way he wanted the visitor to see his work and his art. We have been there as a family with our 10 yrs old daughter and we were all impressed - for different reasons maybe.

Anyway, you will love it! Take at least 3 hours to admire the whole house / theater, there is much to see and experience ...

This museum gave me a thoroughly complete overview of Dali's career. Everyone is familiar with his surrealist pieces, but his others are just as impressive. The accompanying special exhibit of his jewelry creations showed another facet of his talent.
I'd give this a five star rating, but the lines and crowd inside were too much. We were forced to skip some pieces as we just couldn't get close enough to see them.

reviewnospace:
We booked an nighttime visit (22.00), which was good as a believe there were fewer people than during the day. Also, we booked the tickets in advance on the Internet which speeded up the process of getting in.
Once inside, it's interesting just wandering around however don't expect to see many of his most famous works.
Personally, I'm glad I went even though I preferred the building to the contents!

reviewnospace: This is a must see museum/theatre in Spain. Wonderfully surrealistically unpredictable from start to finish - with so much to take in and talk about over tapas and a drink for days afterwards. Take your time and a good friend with you. Highly, very highly recommended.
titleopinion: Eccentricity defined. This is a must see museum/theatre in Spain. Wonderfully surrealistically unpredictable from start to finish - with so much to take in and talk about over tapas and a drink for days afterwards. Take your time and a good friend with you. Highly, very highly recommended.

reviewnospace:
The Dali Theatre-Museum in Figueres (where Dali was born) is quoted as being the largest surrealistic object in the world. It occupies the former Municipal Theatre, a XIX century construction which was destroyed at the end of the Spanish Civil War.
Dali said that this was entirely appropriate as 1) He was an eminently theatrical painter, 2) It is opposite the church of Sant Pere where he was baptised and 3) In December 1918 he held his first public exhibition in the lobby of the Theatre.
It is truly an amazing building, the outside is topped with a large glass dome, the roof is lined with gigantic eggs and sylphs and the deep pink walls are decorated with pa de crostons (a Catalan loaf of bread).
The queues can be quite incredible so my tips are:
Go onto the Dali museum website www.salvador-dali.org/museus
You can book a slot in the summer months and some weekends but top tip go for the first morning slot as once inside it fills up very quickly and a small museum such as this is far better without large crowds
There are also guided night-time tours, starting at 22.30, with different languages on different days. If you are staying nearby that is worth considering.
Once booked you collect your tickets 30 minutes before your slot from the office on the main road side of the building then have a coffee at the cafe opposite the museum. Then go to the pre-booked doors on the left side of the main queue.
Once inside there are free Guide Maps with floor plans in a number of languages available by the ticket office
But, before you go, do a bit of research about Dali and his life story as it will make the exhibits mean so much more. Read about his relationship with Gala, his wife and Muse, as she features in many works.
Dali, without doubt, had great technical skill but he also had a Surrealist mindset like no other. Some of the works are truly amazing and some just confound.
He was a most prolific artist and lived a long life so this is only a small part of his work but there are some important pieces here. You can see much of what he produced in plenty of artbooks but to see it in this setting, designed by Dali himself, is special.
You can also see the Dali Jewels exhibition which is separate. It holds a collection of jewels that were made to Dali's designs, his sketches for many of these are also in the exhibition.

It occupies the former Municipal Theatre, a XIX century construction which was destroyed at the end of the Spanish Civil War. Dali said that this was entirely appropriate as 1) He was an eminently theatrical painter, 2) It is opposite the church of Sant Pere where he was baptised and 3) In December 1918 he held his first public exhibition in the lobby of the Theatre.  It is truly an amazing building, the outside is topped with a large glass dome, the roof is lined with gigantic eggs and sylphs and the deep pink walls are decorated with pa de crostons (a Catalan loaf of bread). The queues can be quite incredible so my tips are: Go onto the Dali museum website www.salvador-dali.org/museus You can book a slot in the summer months and some weekends but top tip go for the first morning slot as once inside it fills up very quickly and a small museum such as this is far better without large crowds There are also guided night-time tours, starting at 22.30, with different languages on different days. If you are staying nearby that is worth considering. Once booked you collect your tickets 30 minutes before your slot from the office on the main road side of the building then have a coffee at the cafe opposite the museum. Then go to the pre-booked doors on the left side of the main queue. Once inside there are free Guide Maps with floor plans in a number of languages available by the ticket office But, before you go, do a bit of research about Dali and his life story as it will make the exhibits mean so much more. Read about his relationship with Gala, his wife and Muse, as she features in many works. Dali, without doubt, had great technical skill but he also had a Surrealist mindset like no other. Some of the works are truly amazing and some just confound. He was a most prolific artist and lived a long life so this is only a small part of his work but there are some important pieces here. You can see much of what he produced in plenty of artbooks but to see it in this setting, designed by Dali himself, is special.  You can also see the Dali Jewels exhibition which is separate. It holds a collection of jewels that were made to Dali's designs, his sketches for many of these are also in the exhibition.

reviewnospace:
Firstly, let me say that this is quite simply the best museum I've ever been to. I didn't know too much about Dali before the visit, though I do like a few of his paintings. I certainly didn't expect to fall in love with this museum, as I did. There were paintings and sculptures and oh wow - the painted ceiling was just incredible. I'm not an art buff, and some things were just plain odd - spiders with doll's heads inside, hanging underneath a sea of sweetcorn?! Whaaaatttt? All the same, it was magical and wonderful. EVERYONE NEEDS TO SEE THIS BEFORE THEY DIE!

Having said that, I have to say something about the number of people let into the museum. As we booked in advance and were asked to reserve a specific time of 6pm to be there, naturally I assumed there would a maximum number of people allowed in. I knew, obviously, it would be busy... but this was ridiculous. It actually detracted from a lot of the paintings and installations as you could never really see the whole thing due to the sea of people everywhere. Journeys up stairs and through corridors were bordering on claustrophobic - you couldn't turn around without being bumped into three times. We waited about 40 minutes to stand in line to see the Mae West installation (it was amazing and worth the wait.)

The things I saw in this museum are now buried deep in my soul to treasure forever. I would recommend anyone - Dali fan or not - to visit. However, I just can't help but wonder what the man himself would think of the museum curators letting in hoards of people to rake in as much cash as possible, rather than limiting numbers a little more to ensure that people who pay to see the art actually get to see the art.

One last thing: be careful not to confuse the fire hose with Dali artwork. Seriously. We saw that happen.

This saves queuing up in the hot sun, especially if you have young children. From here you can pre-book a tour to suit your needs.

quote: Get a rental car and make the trip from Barcelona.
reviewnospace: We rented a car and drove along the Costa Brava stopping and drinking along the way. The museum was very interesting and totally worth the trip/day.
titleopinion: Get a rental car and make the trip from Barcelona.. We rented a car and drove along the Costa Brava stopping and drinking along the way. The museum was very interesting and totally worth the trip/day.

quote: TOTALLY WORTH THE TRIP FROM BARCELONA
reviewnospace: I really like Dali's work, been twice to see his museum in Florida. This won't disappoint you. The line up wasn't that long, about 30mins and we arrived at 10:30am. The biggest disappointment for me was the lack of large pieces that you see in his other museums. There were a few, but only 1 or 2 were great. They had some great drawings, pen and ink and small works of his. You could really see his true technical skills outside the surrealist works. They also 2-3 other artists works in areas and they were incredible! I think they are part of the permanent collection. They also had his jewellery in a separate space that were came back for after lunch in town, and it was well worth it. The building itself is quite dramatic and odd. My kids really enjoyed their time there as well.

There are lots of interesting pieces to see - albeit there is not a great deal of information about the art and it was slightly maze like. Nevertheless we enjoyed the surrealism of the art and got a good incite into Dali's work. We also went to see the Jewelry exhibition which was very interesting seeing the ideas take form. It is definitely worth spending a few hours here.

reviewnospace: Such a huge insight into this artist's works, and the vast amount of art he created - from paintings, to sculptures, murals, exhibitions, and the building itself. Worth a visit!
titleopinion: Awesome museum.. Such a huge insight into this artist's works, and the vast amount of art he created - from paintings, to sculptures, murals, exhibitions, and the building itself. Worth a visit!

quote: Out of this world - a ten star attraction!
reviewnospace:
This is one of the best museums/art galleries I have ever visited. Very competitively priced at €11 per person (including the separate jewellery exhibition).

Externally, the building itself is fantastic. Internally, a fantastic display of Dali originals and complete public access to all the exhibits. No flash photography but still plenty of camera action possible without flash. An amazing range of artwork, sculptures, drawing, objects on display. All very well laid out. An easy to follow, logical guide leaflet available free and in many languages. I would recommend that you use this to work your way round the museum.

I would advise an early arrival (we were there by 9.00am), as by the time we left at lunchtime the entrance queues to get into the museum were very long (and outside in the direct sun!). I would also recommend purchasing entry to the jewel exhibition, which is housed in a separate building less than 100m away.

If in Figueres, please do not miss this– it’s a must see!
titleopinion: Out of this world - a ten star attraction!. This is one of the best museums/art galleries I have ever visited. Very competitively priced at €11 per person (including the separate jewellery exhibition).   Externally, the building itself is fantastic. Internally, a fantastic display of Dali originals and complete public access to all the exhibits. No flash photography but still plenty of camera action possible without flash. An amazing range of artwork, sculptures, drawing, objects on display. All very well laid out. An easy to follow, logical guide leaflet available free and in many languages. I would recommend that you use this to work your way round the museum.  I would advise an early arrival (we were there by 9.00am), as by the time we left at lunchtime the entrance queues to get into the museum were very long (and outside in the direct sun!). I would also recommend purchasing entry to the jewel exhibition, which is housed in a separate building less than 100m away.   If in Figueres, please do not miss this– it’s a must see!

reviewnospace: A must to see. It was fantastic. You will spend a good 3 hours looking around at the different exhibits of paintings and sculptures.
titleopinion: Dali Theatre-Museum. A must to see. It was fantastic. You will spend a good 3 hours looking around at the different exhibits of paintings and sculptures.

quote: If you like surrealism , it is place for you
reviewnospace:
Me and my wife spent 2 great days in cadaques, figueres, pubol and Girona,With Dali.
After dali museum house in cadaques , we came to figueres for this museum.
It was a fantastic day for us, because I know and enjoy surrealism, &Dali works. I saw some of his work in paris-espace Dali, and pompido center. But in figueres we saw a fusion of works of artist.
Jewelry of dali museum attached to this, I found nothing special there..
It is better to reserve before, or stay in a long Q.Here reservation is not a must, vice versa of cadaques, but it is better to reserve.Around museum, you can find many cafe and restaurants if you need.From barcelona you can find a day tour to figueres and pubol ( Gala 's house, Dali made it for gala, and Dali live in there after Gala's death), but I cant find a tour for all this triangle for a day in barcelona, just viatour do that and it will be a hard and busy day, so I suggest stay in beautiful Girona one night at least, and devide this program in 2 days.For me the most importarnt is cadaques, second is figueres museum, third is pubul, but all is a must .As I said on my review of Dali museum house( cadaques), I enjoyed that house more, because I feel I am in private with artist , every corner of that house you can find a footstep of Dali.So I wish I had gone first to figueres, then cadaques . Don't pass and forget Girona , its is worth a day at least.
One note: In figueres train station, I don't think you can find a locker, but in Girona train station, you have no problem to put your suitcaces in a locker.

reviewnospace: Clearly the museum has a large selection of Dali's works, so if you are knowledgeable with him and his art and want to see more - great, this is a place for you. If you're more peripherally familiar with the artist - like most of us - well this just isn't that helpful. Sure you'll see rooms and rooms (and more rooms) stuffed to the gills with his art - but that's the sum of it. There generally isn't any rhyme or reason as to where a piece is placed (with some exceptions. we're guessing it was a matter of space - if there's room, then go ahead and hang it). There are no guides (well, they can be had but not easily and we certainly didn't see any on our visit. Even emailed ahead asking about availability but to no avail), and the signing is absolutely PITIFUL. Maybe a name and a year. Some rooms contained art that he collected - i.e. not by him - but it often wasnt clear. We were very disappointed.
titleopinion: Lots of  stuff . Clearly the museum has a large selection of Dali's works, so if you are knowledgeable with him and his art and want to see more - great, this is a place for you. Sure you'll see rooms and rooms (and more rooms) stuffed to the gills with his art - but that's the sum of it. There generally isn't any rhyme or reason as to where a piece is placed (with some exceptions. we're guessing it was a matter of space - if there's room, then go ahead and hang it). There are no guides (well, they can be had but not easily and we certainly didn't see any on our visit. Even emailed ahead asking about availability but to no avail), and the signing is absolutely PITIFUL. Maybe a name and a year. Some rooms contained art that he collected - i.e. not by him - but it often wasnt clear. We were very disappointed.

If you like Dali, you don't need review to go there.

Kids enjoyed it the best of all we visited in a month in Europe.

quote: Fantastic Dali Museum - from the building itself to the installations inside!
reviewnospace: Stunning collection of Dali artwork/installations showing the amazing scope and range of his work - so much to see, a feast for the eyes! The building is in itself a huge Dali installation with the giant egg battlements and tyre columns etc. Notable for me were the installations in the courtyard including the rainy cadillac. NB Large queues to get in but never felt overcrowded inside.
titleopinion: Fantastic Dali Museum - from the building itself to the installations inside!. Stunning collection of Dali artwork/installations showing the amazing scope and range of his work - so much to see, a feast for the eyes! The building is in itself a huge Dali installation with the giant egg battlements and tyre columns etc. Notable for me were the installations in the courtyard including the rainy cadillac. NB Large queues to get in but never felt overcrowded inside.

reviewnospace: The Dalí Theatre and Museum is a museum of the artist Salvador Dalí in his home town of Figueres. I can not find words to describe the genius of this unique artist.
titleopinion: IS A UNIQUE EXPERIENCE. The Dalí Theatre and Museum is a museum of the artist Salvador Dalí in his home town of Figueres. I can not find words to describe the genius of this unique artist.

quote: I hurt from smiling so much!
reviewnospace: This museum is everything it's cracked up to be. From the first exhibit in the entry, to the jewels at the finish, this museum is fascinating. We hired a guide for the day, so she could help us better understand Salador Dali and his insanity. What fun!

reviewnospace: Don't go to this museum if you are with small children and teenagers which is quite unsuitable for them:(
titleopinion: Very strange!. Don't go to this museum if you are with small children and teenagers which is quite unsuitable for them:(

reviewnospace: We are not fans of modern art but Dali certainly made us look up and take notice . Three teenage girls were completely engaged and for once not racing ahead to get out .Every which way you turn there is a feast for the eyes. Really worth the 40 minute drive from our accommodation . It is jammed pack and a bit chaotic in layout but I think it only adds to the atmosphere . We didn't have problems with queues but where there early . Would go back again !

reviewnospace:
One of the most unusual museums. Impressive outside as well as inside.
Better with a guide since there is a lot you will be impressed to her about Dali and his theatre-museum.
Great with kids even with 5yo since there are a lot of things to make them curious.
titleopinion: Must see. One of the most unusual museums. Impressive outside as well as inside. Better with a guide since there is a lot you will be impressed to her about Dali and his theatre-museum. Great with kids even with 5yo since there are a lot of things to make them curious.

reviewnospace: I'm glad I went. The art is intriguing. The experience, however, was terrible. 1) Dahi needed an editor. There is too much stuff, packed into limited space, and he refused to provide context. I wish we had hired a guide. All my learning came from overhearing guides. And that was always fascinating info I'd never have figured out on my own. 2) there are too many visitors. It's mobbed, adding to the challenge of spending time exploring and pondering how to figure out the puzzles of his work. 3) the cameras are a nightmare. In our group of 12, everyone commented on how disruptive it was to have to share viewing with people who took space just to get photos. They don't look at the art, they just snap pix which is surprisingly disruptive and takes from the experience of thinking through the images.
titleopinion: Be prepared . I'm glad I went. The art is intriguing. The experience, however, was terrible. 1) Dahi needed an editor. There is too much stuff, packed into limited space, and he refused to provide context. I wish we had hired a guide. All my learning came from overhearing guides. And that was always fascinating info I'd never have figured out on my own. 2) there are too many visitors. It's mobbed, adding to the challenge of spending time exploring and pondering how to figure out the puzzles of his work. 3) the cameras are a nightmare. In our group of 12, everyone commented on how disruptive it was to have to share viewing with people who took space just to get photos. They don't look at the art, they just snap pix which is surprisingly disruptive and takes from the experience of thinking through the images.

reviewnospace: This was a really interesting and enjoyable couple of hours - the selection of works on display and the variety and volume were incredible. I could have happily spent the entire day here - but 2 hours was the most my 13-year-old boy could take and still enjoy the experience. Try adding coins to some of the pieces where you see the slots and watch as something truly amazing happens :-) it can be busy when groups are arriving, but there is plenty to see and lots of rooms to disperse into.
titleopinion: Brilliantly bizarre - Worth a Visit!. This was a really interesting and enjoyable couple of hours - the selection of works on display and the variety and volume were incredible. I could have happily spent the entire day here - but 2 hours was the most my 13-year-old boy could take and still enjoy the experience. Try adding coins to some of the pieces where you see the slots and watch as something truly amazing happens :-) it can be busy when groups are arriving, but there is plenty to see and lots of rooms to disperse into.

reviewnospace:
Funnily enough the queue for pre paid tickets was longer than the standard door (get there early!) Even my teenage sons looked at the art :O

Completely bemused by it all of course..
titleopinion: Good. Funnily enough the queue for pre paid tickets was longer than the standard door (get there early!) Even my teenage sons looked at the art :O  Completely bemused by it all of course..

reviewnospace: Absolutely amazing place and one of the highlights of our holiday. The one big problem was the one hour queue to get in at midday, stood in a long line in the baking hot sunshine. By the time we eventually got in we were too hot and tired to enjoy it properly, but aside from that it was just wonderful. It takes a good couple of hours to go right round the place & your ticket also gets you in to the separate place where Dali's jewellery is on display.
titleopinion: Amazingly whacky place!. Absolutely amazing place and one of the highlights of our holiday. The one big problem was the one hour queue to get in at midday, stood in a long line in the baking hot sunshine. By the time we eventually got in we were too hot and tired to enjoy it properly, but aside from that it was just wonderful. It takes a good couple of hours to go right round the place & your ticket also gets you in to the separate place where Dali's jewellery is on display.

reviewnospace:
This place is just amazing. Calling it simply a museum does not do it justice really. This is a glimpse into the mind of a genius. You do not have to be an 'art lover' or a fan of Dali to visit. Just be open minded and appreciate the amazing, wide ranging creativity of one man.

This is the second time that we have been in the last 2 years and we saw different things and things in a different way this time compared to last.

Go early is probably best - the queues can get really long. We booked online, but still had to queue for 10-15 minutes to pick up our e-tickets.

reviewnospace: This museum is great if you're a Dali fan but also if you're just experiencing his art fit the first time. It's a monument to him (and Gala), and not meant to be very educational. Easy visit from Barcelona and well worth it.

reviewnospace: This museum is special, Dalí actually lived there. Inside and out, it is beautiful and interesting. A must if you visit Catalonia!!
titleopinion: A must. This museum is special, Dalí actually lived there. Inside and out, it is beautiful and interesting. A must if you visit Catalonia!!

quote: Amazing Salvador Dali Museum in Figueres !
reviewnospace: The Dali Museum was a great experience, but the crowds were a bit heavy (visit July 10th @5pm) and they could do a better job of monitoring the volume to allow for a true art experience. At times, it was so tight in the museum that we felt as though we were in a crowded subway. We extended our time at the museum so that we could get the camera shots we wanted and it was so worth it. Dali's work is amazing. In comparing the visit to the Salvador Dali house in Cadeques, I was glad that I did both the museum AND the house, and in the order that I did because the house was even more AMAZING !!!!!

reviewnospace: We visited the Dalí Museum-Theatre while staying in Barca. We had about 2 1/2 hours to explore the museum and the town around the museum. It was about right (timewise). In the museum you'll see several works of the artist from the portrait of Abraham Lincoln with a nude image of Dalí’s wife, Gala Dalí; the Mae West room; Gala’s boat with umbrella in the atrium over the Rainy Taxi; and the jewelry gallery. The one disturbing thing about our museum visit was all of the school kids who were running around and playing and not listening to their chaperones. We think it’s great for kids to get education in the arts, but think that the teachers overestimated their preparation with the students and their interest in visiting this museum. Those who are Dali fans should also visit the Museum in St. Petersburg, FL to fill some gaps of the artist's works.
titleopinion: Now that's surreal!. We visited the Dalí Museum-Theatre while staying in Barca. We had about 2 1/2 hours to explore the museum and the town around the museum. We think it’s great for kids to get education in the arts, but think that the teachers overestimated their preparation with the students and their interest in visiting this museum. Those who are Dali fans should also visit the Museum in St. Petersburg, FL to fill some gaps of the artist's works.

reviewnospace:
I went in a small group with Spanish Trails. Our guide was Richard .

He made it a very interesting and enjoyable day. He had lots of stories about Dali's life and loves and historical facts about Giroa.

The Dali Museum was wonderful. It lived up to my expectations. I found it so unusual and definitely surreal.

Giroa was very relaxing and quaint. I loved the history of all the battles and seeing where Napoleon's army made their camp. Of course there was lots more to fascinate.

So another memorable Spanish Trails event. Thanks Richard.
titleopinion: Amazing. I went in a small group with Spanish Trails. Our guide was Richard .  He made it a very interesting and enjoyable day. He had lots of stories about Dali's life and loves and historical facts about Giroa.   The Dali Museum was wonderful. It lived up to my expectations. I found it so unusual and definitely surreal.  Giroa was very relaxing and quaint. I loved the history of all the battles and seeing where Napoleon's army made their camp. Of course there was lots more to fascinate.  So another memorable Spanish Trails event. Thanks Richard.

reviewnospace:
... the place is hectic. You have been warned! There were people in a 500 metre long queue outside. There were multiple tour groups inside, which, in a museum with many corridors and few open spaces, means you are nearly one such group. The museum is a free-flowing kind of place with different routes that you can take: great for personal freedom but it does mean that there are people walking in most directions.

However, it is still a wonderful place with an extraordinary collection of art. Highly recommended.

By the way, if you are disabled and in a wheelchair then there is a back entrance in near the exit (salida). But be warned that there are A LOT of stairs and steps and people. If you can tackle steps then ignore the main queue and enter via the group door on the left. The very nice man there let me do so and then proceeded to guide me inside and give me a free ticket for entry, which was nice.

reviewnospace:
we are get from barcelona's Sants station to Figueres by local train.A round trip ticket costs 28€ and takes approximatelly 1:50 hours.The local train station is located 10 minutes on foot from the museum with clear signs pointing the direction.
Figueres is very beautiful and clean small town with many shops and cafe. It was very pleasent walking along it's narrow streets. We easily get to Dali's theatre-museum. The entrance fee is 12€.
We have seen there the broadest range of the artist's works, including everything from his earliest pieces to his final paintings and also the paintings of other artists such as El Greco and Antoni Pitxot.Everythings,what we seen,were very impressive,especially :,,face of Mae West";,,central Panel of the wind Palace Ceiling";,,Queen Esther" and ,,car NAval" in the yard of the museum,but the most impressive for me was ,,Gala Nude Looking at the Sea", Which at 18 Metres Appears the President Lincoln.Interesting was also excellent jewellery colections.
This day is unforgettable for me,it really worth to see Dali Theatre-museum.

Take my advice and book in advance

quote: Top Attraction That Attracts A Crowd
reviewnospace:
The museum is stuffed full of Dali's works (and other artists from time to time). There is plenty to see and some of the works are quite breathtaking.

This is a TOP attraction in the area, though. Lots of people come to visit and the queue to get into the museum in the middle of July on a mid-week day around lunch-time did take 30 minutes to get to the point of paying for tickets. And there were a lot of people inside the museum.

The wait and the bustle of people are worth the effort though.

NOTE: The works are a "history" of Dali's work. Some of his more famous pieces will be found elsewhere (like the museum in Florida, which I've also visited though many years ago). That said, for those interested in art, it is a "must-see"!

And there were a lot of people inside the museum.  The wait and the bustle of people are worth the effort though.  NOTE: The works are a  history  of Dali's work. Some of his more famous pieces will be found elsewhere (like the museum in Florida, which I've also visited though many years ago). That said, for those interested in art, it is a  must-see !

reviewnospace: My only regret about my visit to the Dali Museum is that I didn't do some research and reading in advance. Some of what we saw was odd to say the least and I feel I should have been more prepared. It's a wonderful experience. Don't panic if there's a queue, it moves quickly. The gift shop isn't overly priced if you'd like a souvenir of your visit. I will definitely return there but next time I'll have done my homework first!

The gift shop isn't overly priced if you'd like a souvenir of your visit. I will definitely return there but next time I'll have done my homework first!

This is a truly unique art museum experience. It really showcases the vast talent of Dali is so many different forms of art.

Buy tickets online ahead of time and make sure you don't miss the jewels section which should be included in The admission price.

titleopinion: Imaginative museum. Really interesting and well presented museum of Dali works. Avoid Sundays if possible, so many young people!

quote: Worth the early start and train journey - YOU MUST GO HERE
reviewnospace: We were unable to book our tickets in advance so got an early train to Figueres so we arrived before opening time (DEFINITELY DO THIS as the queue was massive when we left). The museum is amazing, as someone who didn't have an awful lot of knowledge about Dali and his work, the museum was so interesting and it gave me an insight into what a master Dali was. The layout is somewhat confusing but when you're walking around and taking in all of the incredible art you really don't care. The shops are brilliant as well and we made some good purchases. The whole experience was fantastic and I would urge anyone to go, we spent at least 4 hours there and had we not have been tired from the early start and having done a few days of walking already we probably could have spent more time there. Don't forget to go and see the Dali jewels as well!!

quote: You just can't be bored here, even if you're not into art
reviewnospace:
Let's start fromt he most important thing: this is a must-see when visiting northern Spain. Period.

The museum is great - surreal like Dali, very surprising and not like any museum you might have seen earlier. You will enjoy every second of it and won't be bored. It's also great for kids, since there are so may amazing things inside. You need at least 1 hour to see everything, but you may easily spend there much more time.

Some practical info: you can buy the tickets online, but there's a very limited number of tickets available that way. We went there in high season (but midweek) and online tickets were sold out, but there was no queue at all and we got the tickets and entered immediately.

Figueres is 120 kms (75 miles) from Barcelona and the best, most convenient and actually also cheapest way (when travelling in 3-5 people) is to rent a car in Barcelona. The highway to Figueres is toll road (around 12 Euros one way), but ery comfortable and with 120 kms limit, so you can actually make the trip in 1 hour - but reserve at least 30 minutes for getting out of Barcelona. The car has another advantage - you can easily add the visit at Dalí House in Portlligat, which and hour drive from Figueres. There is a parking lot (paid) just behind the Dali Museum in Figueres.

quote: Everything is not what it seems - or is it?
reviewnospace: We visited Figueres specifically to see the Dali Theatre Museum - at the last minute we decided to take the guided tour - and boy am I glad we did! Marcus, our guide, was brilliant! Incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, a little bit naughty but above all else fascinating. Unless you have studeid Dali and his works in detail, please take the guided tour before you try it solo - otherwise you will miss the whole point of what Dali was about. It has had such an impact on us that days later we are looking for Dali motifs and messages in everything we see! Brilliant way to spend a couple of hours. Then once you have learned the basics about Dali you can venture out on your own to see what else you can uncover of this crazy, mixed up genius.
titleopinion: Everything is not what it seems - or is it?. Then once you have learned the basics about Dali you can venture out on your own to see what else you can uncover of this crazy, mixed up genius.

reviewnospace: Taste Dali in his own theatre or the theatre of life. Cadillac, angels, Mae West, his view on time and so more.
titleopinion: Dali's view of life. Taste Dali in his own theatre or the theatre of life. Cadillac, angels, Mae West, his view on time and so more.

reviewnospace:
The wonderfully whimsical museum pays tribute to the life
and work of the great master surrealist artist Salvador Dali.
Located in an old burned out municipal theatre, Dali himself
was instrumental in the restoration & re-fit of the building.
We drove out here from Barcelona on a day trip which was
to include Girona, but found too much to see at the museum
and spent the day here. OK, another reason was the very
compelling 'Candy Parade' marching through town near
the museum (April).

Although many of Dali's best works are scattered all over the
world, the museum contains an impressive collection. The
'Mae West Room', 'Abraham Lincoln', 'The Labyrinth', 'The
Rainy Taxi', 'Palace of the Wind, and the series '1968 Aliyah
to Israel' are all here plus much more.

Arriving at the museum, one is greeted by the trademark
Dali Eggs on the roof and several bizarre sidewalk sculptures.
The interior exhibition space is itself a labyrinth of narrow
curved gallery walls, an open-air courtyard, subterranean
rooms (the Dali Crypt under the former stage), and many
more rooms.

This is an amazing & must-see museum. One can also visit
Dali's & Gala's house in nearby Cadaques on the coast.
titleopinion: Amazing Salvador Dali Museum . The wonderfully whimsical museum pays tribute to the life  and work of the great master surrealist artist Salvador Dali. Located in an old burned out municipal theatre, Dali himself was instrumental in the restoration & re-fit of the building. We drove out here from Barcelona on a day trip which was to include Girona, but found too much to see at the museum and spent the day here. OK, another reason was the very compelling 'Candy Parade' marching through town near the museum (April).  Although many of Dali's best works are scattered all over the world, the museum contains an impressive collection. The 'Mae West Room', 'Abraham Lincoln', 'The Labyrinth', 'The  Rainy Taxi', 'Palace of the Wind, and the series '1968 Aliyah to Israel' are all here plus much more.  Arriving at the museum, one is greeted by the trademark  Dali Eggs on the roof and several bizarre sidewalk sculptures. The interior exhibition space is itself a labyrinth of narrow curved gallery walls, an open-air courtyard, subterranean rooms (the Dali Crypt under the former stage), and many more rooms.  This is an amazing & must-see museum. One can also visit Dali's & Gala's house in nearby Cadaques on the coast.

reviewnospace: We were blown away with the exhibition ---- fantastic space to see the art work. The building itself is amazing. Just a lovely experience.
titleopinion: Wacky fun. We were blown away with the exhibition ---- fantastic space to see the art work. The building itself is amazing. Just a lovely experience.

reviewnospace: A must for any fan of Dali, of art or of eccentrics in general. Filled with a great variety of amazing pictures and artefacts showcasing the full range of Dali's genius. If possible, go when it is not too busy so you can appreciate your favourite exhibits. You will appreciate it far more if you have a guide to explain what you see etc. We went by fast train and local bus which was excellent and I recommend it but it wasn't easy to find the bus station for the ride back to the railway station.
titleopinion: Genius!. A must for any fan of Dali, of art or of eccentrics in general. Filled with a great variety of amazing pictures and artefacts showcasing the full range of Dali's genius. quote: art museum for people who don't like museums
reviewnospace: Such an unusual and interesting museum that even our daughter who claims to hate museums was won over. Surprises everywhere and many different ways to see the art - we had so much fun walking through and talking together about what we saw. Also, a tip about Figueres: there are two local markets on Thursday mornings, one for food and for clothes. The clothes market has some good bargains and a view into everyday life.

quote: Amazing must-see place for Dali lovers

reviewnospace: This is a very very easy day trip from Barcelona. You don't need to join a tour. Take a fast train from Santa Station (21euros/person) and 50 minutes later you are in Figueres. We had a nice lunch at a place that received good reviews on tripadvisor (not the places right in front of the museum) and were back in Barcelona before 4. The only thing I would have done differently was to read up more on the museum in advance as there was not a lot of information there.

quote: Amazing!! A must go once in your life
reviewnospace:
The Dali Theatre-Museum (Teatro-Museo Dali) is without any doubt one of the best museums I ever been in my life.

It's impossible to compare this place with any other famous museums around the world, as this place is UNIQUE!

The museum is very well looked after, the collection is amazing and the whole experience was very impressive. Staff is very polite and they speak english.

We did a day trip from Barcelona by train and it was very easy and fast, so if you are nearby this is a must do attraction!

Half day will be enough to enjoy the museum and to have a nice lunch nearby.

Highly recommended!

quote: Beautiful museum, but too many people
reviewnospace: This place is beautiful. You've got to love Dalí, but this museum has some fine pieces. I absolutely love the gala/Lincoln painting in the main hall. Shows how crazy, creative and talented this man was. The downside of the museum was the enormous crowd of people, most of them with absolutely no interest for the art, but being there only to take ridiculous selfies to brag on Facebook. There were some groups of kids too that were really annoying, skipping all the queues (yes there were queues for some pieces, and it wasn't even in the weekend or high season when I was there). In short: it's a must see but make sure you sleep well because you need a lot of patience to cope with the enormous number of annoying people.

reviewnospace:
We loved our visit here. Couldn't book online..booked up 2 months ahead, but there are tickets available at the door, so we arrived at 930, and got in straight away. Glad we went early because the huge guided tours started at about 1030 , 11 and it was getting very busy.
Stunning fantasy open courtyard as you go in, and it just gets better. We were delighted to go in early and see the famous Mae West settee..huge red lips, while it was quiet. Go can take a camera in, only rule no flash photos. We were pleased to have seen Dali and Galas home at Port Ligat first, this is the stunning showpiece. Loved the extraordinary huge ceiling painting of Gala and Dali ascending to heaven..dominated by the huge feet of Gala! Dalis tomb is here, sadly not in Pubol with Gala as he wished. An extraordinary place.

quote: Make sure you see the Jewel collecction
reviewnospace: While many of Dali's major paintings are in Tampa, Florida, this museum displays larger sculptures and paintings as well as earlier works which were beautiful copies of the masters (Picasso, Cezanne, Valaquez). The highlight was the Jewel Collection--39 amazing jewel sculptures housed on two floors in a separate section. Fortunately the Jewel Collection was not very crowded--quite different from the hordes of tour groups in the main theatre-museum. We had a private guide obtained through Emily Mathews, owner and manager of South O'le Spain tours which allowed us to work our way through the tour groups to see the museum's highlights and learn about this fascinating artist.
titleopinion: Make sure you see the Jewel collecction. While many of Dali's major paintings are in Tampa, Florida, this museum displays larger sculptures and paintings as well as earlier works which were beautiful copies of the masters (Picasso, Cezanne, Valaquez). The highlight was the Jewel Collection--39 amazing jewel sculptures housed on two floors in a separate section. Fortunately the Jewel Collection was not very crowded--quite different from the hordes of tour groups in the main theatre-museum. We had a private guide obtained through Emily Mathews, owner and manager of South O'le Spain tours which allowed us to work our way through the tour groups to see the museum's highlights and learn about this fascinating artist.

reviewnospace: Better if you choose a guide person. Try to go early in the morning to avoid big lines. I thing I was ging to be there like 2 hours and stay almost 5.
titleopinion: It is a BLAST. Better if you choose a guide person. Try to go early in the morning to avoid big lines. I thing I was ging to be there like 2 hours and stay almost 5.

reviewnospace: How typical that a man with the seemingly colossal ego of Dali should have thought to turn this theatre museum into such a flamboyant, monumental, commercial success. A man who insisted on driving around Paris in a grass-covered car and supported Franco would have positively delighted in a group of pre-pubescent English schoolboys gawping at his nudes. I think he would have revelled in all the young girls taking selfies in front of his paintings. Perhaps he still chuckles at all the madness from his crypt? Yeah, absurd, right? Or maybe surreal? On a mere mortal level I would have appreciated more information but there seemed to be very little on offer short of dates and titles, especially about the lesser known artist Evarist Vallès. A fascinating glimpse of a giant in the art world. Worth the queues and the crowds.
titleopinion: Dali's final master stroke. How typical that a man with the seemingly colossal ego of Dali should have thought to turn this theatre museum into such a flamboyant, monumental, commercial success. A man who insisted on driving around Paris in a grass-covered car and supported Franco would have positively delighted in a group of pre-pubescent English schoolboys gawping at his nudes. I think he would have revelled in all the young girls taking selfies in front of his paintings. Perhaps he still chuckles at all the madness from his crypt? Yeah, absurd, right? Or maybe surreal? On a mere mortal level I would have appreciated more information but there seemed to be very little on offer short of dates and titles, especially about the lesser known artist Evarist Vallès. A fascinating glimpse of a giant in the art world. Worth the queues and the crowds.

reviewnospace: Love this beautiful single artist museum. Beware that not all floors are wheelchair accessible though.
titleopinion: Beautiful little museum. Love this beautiful single artist museum. Beware that not all floors are wheelchair accessible though.

reviewnospace: I read a lot of reviews where people said that they were not impressed... it's rather strange... this amazing museum was build by Dali! It's his idea, every thing, every picture... if you want to feel genius, if you want to understand him, you must visit this place. It lives his own life and give you a chance to feel Dali and Gala. Amazing!
titleopinion: You must visit it!. I read a lot of reviews where people said that they were not impressed... it's rather strange... this amazing museum was build by Dali! Amazing!

reviewnospace: Such a great visit. Well worth the drive. Dali is a genius (self proclaimed) and if this is anything to go by, he was not wrong.
titleopinion: fantastically Surreal. Such a great visit. Well worth the drive. Dali is a genius (self proclaimed) and if this is anything to go by, he was not wrong.

reviewnospace:
A must have trip for any Dali enthusiastic!
I absolutely was dying to visit here for the last few years having fallen for Dali style many many years ago.
On entering the museum I had to take a good 10 min wait to get ready once seeing the amount of work on display. I found it all extremely interesting, interactive and mind boggling at the same time. Mad man or genius is the normal question, I can only say his technique was flawless and his choice of subject sometimes ridiculous, but it all works and I loved it! Even our none Dali friends enjoyed the experience, so give it a view!

Even our none Dali friends enjoyed the experience, so give it a view!

reviewnospace: This museum in Figueres, Dali's home town, is a big contrast if you have been visiting a lot of churches and museums containing Neo-classical and 19th century art. For the entry price of €12 you see a large collection of Dali's works, all fascinating and notable for the unusual and creative workings of his mind. Highly recommended to visit this lovely town and the amazing museum.
titleopinion: Refreshing and fascinating!. This museum in Figueres, Dali's home town, is a big contrast if you have been visiting a lot of churches and museums containing Neo-classical and 19th century art. Highly recommended to visit this lovely town and the amazing museum.

We are talking about a very talented and gifted man who could create wonders with his hands! You can take the train from Barcelona to Figueres, costing around 32 euros for a round trip.

reviewnospace: With our private guide and driver we travelled to Figueres to visit the Dali Museum. What an amazing place. His works are inspiring in particular the ones including his wife. Our guide explained all and made our trip so exciting and memorable. His works are so different and mind blowing. His jewellery designs perfection. Don't miss out on these. A great day out. Good for the soul.

quote: A place to visit if you like Dali
reviewnospace: I was visiting North Catalunya and Figueres is a nice town to visit. It has this Dali Museum with many of his pieces and a building designed for him. I am not so much fan of Dali but if you are you will love it.

reviewnospace: I had a Dali poster as a teenager and thoroughly enjoyed visiting this museum - it's very Dali. Don't miss the jewellery display that has a separate entrance and includes moving jewellery pieces.
titleopinion: A must for Dali fans. I had a Dali poster as a teenager and thoroughly enjoyed visiting this museum - it's very Dali. Don't miss the jewellery display that has a separate entrance and includes moving jewellery pieces.

reviewnospace:
As a Dali fan, I was unlikely to be disappointed. Although not as good as the museum in Florida, I loved this museum and you also got entry included to the Dali Jewellrey museum next door.
Only disappointing thing was that there were no head phones to listen to details about the art work and no obvious information about tours.
Top tips would be that this museum is closed on a Monday, and make sure that you walk all the way round the outside to fully appreciate the outside of the building too.
Also, if travelling with children, give them something to eat before you go in so that you don't rush around.
We arrived about 11.30am on a Tuesday and we were in the que for at least an hour. This is a very popular museum.
It's about a 15/20 min walk from the train station and is very well sign posted all the way.

reviewnospace: This place is a must for those who are into Dali or who want to see one wild and crazy art museum. Dali was certainly a talented fellow, but some of his stuff borders on landfill art: let's go to the dump, see what we can dig up and stick it together and voila, call it ART!! But to be serious, I am sure that there is some meaning in the art he created, but good luck trying to decipher it all. What I found impressive about this place was the range of his creative expression. The guy just had no bounds in media or imagination. Remember to visit the jewelry exhibit at the end which is worth the price of admission alone. This place is pretty big so plan on spending at least 2 hours. I leave you with this thought: if Dali had Gorilla Glue and access to Ebay, the results would've been stratospheric.
titleopinion: This was worth a visit. This place is a must for those who are into Dali or who want to see one wild and crazy art museum. Dali was certainly a talented fellow, but some of his stuff borders on landfill art: let's go to the dump, see what we can dig up and stick it together and voila, call it ART!! But to be serious, I am sure that there is some meaning in the art he created, but good luck trying to decipher it all. What I found impressive about this place was the range of his creative expression. The guy just had no bounds in media or imagination. Remember to visit the jewelry exhibit at the end which is worth the price of admission alone. This place is pretty big so plan on spending at least 2 hours. I leave you with this thought: if Dali had Gorilla Glue and access to Ebay, the results would've been stratospheric.

reviewnospace: We visited museum in morning - it gets very crowded. Loved some of his figurative paintings The building is very interesting and unusual. Designed by Dali from a ruined theatre - so naturally some of it is bizarre. Worth a visit but don't expect much of his work to be easily understood.
titleopinion: Strange but interesting. We visited museum in morning - it gets very crowded. Loved some of his figurative paintings The building is very interesting and unusual. Designed by Dali from a ruined theatre - so naturally some of it is bizarre. Worth a visit but don't expect much of his work to be easily understood.

reviewnospace:
Dali left organized his impressive works of art in the house that he lived in Figueres, Spain. According to our guide, Dali left strict orders that there should not be a guide explaining the works and that one must use our own imagination. Well, its not so easy and a bit difficult to understand.
The exhibition is perfectly set up but then again one gets lost in the maze of rooms.
It is a great museum just to see the marvelous works of art that he made.
Amongst his works , there are some paintings from other artists and they are not marked making it even more confusing.
titleopinion: INTERESTING BUT DIFFICULT TO UNDERSTAND. Dali left organized his impressive works of art in the house that he lived in Figueres, Spain. Well, its not so easy and a bit difficult to understand.  The exhibition is perfectly set up but then again one gets lost in the maze of rooms. It is a great museum just to see the marvelous works of art that he made.  Amongst his works , there are some paintings from other artists and they are not marked making it even more confusing.

quote: A Treat for the Eye and the Imagination
reviewnospace: Enter Dali's world of creativity and imagery -- you will not be disappointed. Indeed, you'll have fun as you explore both his principal museum and his Jewelry Museum, the latter of which will take your breath away. The Viatour day trip to Girona and Figueres gets you to the Dali Museums in Figueres. Overall, it's the most enjoyable, informative and economical way to partake of all that Girona and Figueres have to offer the visitor.
titleopinion: A Treat for the Eye and the Imagination. Enter Dali's world of creativity and imagery -- you will not be disappointed. Overall, it's the most enjoyable, informative and economical way to partake of all that Girona and Figueres have to offer the visitor.

quote: A must for any Dali lover
reviewnospace:
The mans life is well represented here in his childhood home of Figures.
The museum is a real look into his brilliance and love of art.
5/2015 was or second trip to Figures, and longest. If you make it here, the you must take the trip over to Cadaques, and see the home he lived in with Gala until her death.
Stay in hotel plaza inn, right next to the Museum.
Enjoy Dali heaven...

Dali last piece of art

reviewnospace: This museum has one sole aim : to make as much money as possible. The museum is small but they cram in as many people as possible. At times there are as many as three or four guided tours taking place in one small room, each guide competing to speak louder than the others. Very difficult to hear the explanations or see any of the paintings. A money-making conveyer belt which makes for a stressful and disappointing experience. There are so many great art museums in the region... avoid this one!

reviewnospace: We went to see the Dali museum when we were passing Figuerias. This was the first time I saw Dali paintings in the museum and I was amazed by what I had seen. Dali is not only a painter but a real genius.

reviewnospace: Salvador Dali was a master craftsman and creative genius. Like any artist, the more you know about the person, the more you can appreciate and enjoy their work. This particularly holds true for Dali. You may or may not enjoy his work, but unless you've studied, you probably won't understand it. More than most, this is an artist that requires some explanation so if you come to the museum that he designed himself, you'll get a lot more out of the visit if you go on a guided tour.
