The best way to see it is probably go with a group tour so you do not wait in what looks like an interminable queue. Once inside you are for a treat. Whether you are an art lover or not whether you like Dali or Surrealism this is a weird wacky and totally hilarious place to visit. It will take about two hours to get around unless you have extremely sharp elbows. You will have to wait in line at some of the rooms and exhibits but it is well worth waiting.

reviewnospace: I normally would rate this museum very highly because of Dali's importance to Catalunya and surrealism, BUT it was so overcrowded during our last visit that the experience was seriously diminished. Our most recent visit was in August, and we had to stand in a ticket line outside with nearby smokers for over an hour since online sales were suspended. Once inside there were long lines for many exhibits. There appears to be no limit on how many visitors the museum will admit at one time, and the extent of the crowding created a lot of jostling, taxed the air conditioning and even made for thoughts about crowd safety in the event of a fire or other problem. If you avoid the crowds, you will likely have a great experience, so plan around the midday body-packing of summer, especially if you want to take a serious and unhurried look at the excellent collection there.

Once inside there were long lines for many exhibits. There appears to be no limit on how many visitors the museum will admit at one time, and the extent of the crowding created a lot of jostling, taxed the air conditioning and even made for thoughts about crowd safety in the event of a fire or other problem. If you avoid the crowds, you will likely have a great experience, so plan around the midday body-packing of summer, especially if you want to take a serious and unhurried look at the excellent collection there.

reviewnospace: I hadn't seen or heard much about Dali so didn't know what to expect but the museum was one of the highlights of my holiday. Hope to return some day
titleopinion: Loved it!. I hadn't seen or heard much about Dali so didn't know what to expect but the museum was one of the highlights of my holiday. Hope to return some day

reviewnospace: This was the second trip to the Dali Museum for my family and I. The first was great as we went during June. This time it was difficult because the place was very crowded and we had to wait inlines both in and outside of the museum. It was well over an hour wait just to get in and it was extremely crowded inside. My suggestion is to definitely go to the museum as it is very interesting but not during the peak tourist month of August as it almost unbearable.

reviewnospace: We visited mid August. We had to queue for an hour to get in but it's worth it. There is so much to see. I would have liked to have an audio guide- but wasn't aware I could get one. Our group consisted in age from 40 to 9 years old. Everyone enjoyed it- even the sceptical anti surrealists.

I would have liked to have an audio guide- but wasn't aware I could get one. Our group consisted in age from 40 to 9 years old. Everyone enjoyed it- even the sceptical anti surrealists.

reviewnospace: Having pre-booked tickets we still ended up queueing twice to get in and once in it was very busy. However, it is a fascinating place and well worth the wait.
titleopinion: packed but fascinating. Having pre-booked tickets we still ended up queueing twice to get in and once in it was very busy. However, it is a fascinating place and well worth the wait.

reviewnospace: We pre-booked the night visit which is available in peak summer months. Opens at 10pm til 1am. Would highly recommend this as it was quieter than in the day and you could actually get to look at everything in reasonable peace. We loved the whole experience. It's a shame that so many of the most famous works have all ended up in New York now as Figueres is where they belong. But there is plenty to see and enjoy and you get the full experience of the Dali designed space. The separate jewels exhibition is well worth seeing and is included in the night visit price.

reviewnospace:
This is our second visit to Figueres to see Dali`s museum. On leaving the public car park the first thing one notices is the large blue glass geodisc cupola (over sized golf ball !!) surmounting the roof; this illuminates an internal court which was the stage of the original theatre. Walking around the building towards the entrance and looking up, one cannot help but smile at the oversized egg decorations and statues at parapet level--is this a sign of things to come? Then one arrives at the front façade erected in 1849; the theatre was destroyed by fire in 1939 and remained as charred walls until work began in 1970 and the museum officially opened in September 1974.
There are 22 rooms over four floors exhibiting paintings, drawings, sculptures, displayed settings and the tomb of Salvador Dali. The internal courtyard is open to the sky with displays and statues around the ivy covered walls.
One travels between the exquisite the bizarre and amusement, all of which can excite pleasure and puzzlement. If you are not a follower of Dali it is still worth a visit. We enjoy it.

The internal courtyard is open to the sky with displays and statues around the ivy covered walls. One travels between the exquisite the bizarre and amusement, all of which can excite pleasure and puzzlement. If you are not a follower of Dali it is still worth a visit. We enjoy it.

reviewnospace: If you're in Figueres, you obviously have to go! Rather than doing a day trip from Barcelona, I would recommend staying in Figueres for a night and going to the museum around 5pm so that the line is much shorter. Take your time in the museum, there is so much to see if you pay attention!

reviewnospace: By far the highlight of my Catalunian excursion. I got lost amongst the unreality for 5 hours. Missed my bus and all but it was totally worth it! The town of Figueres is also a beautiful place. Hope to return soon!

reviewnospace:
Unfortunately you most likely will have to line ut for quite a while, at least in high season. We stood in about an hour in line. The building is, as other write, crowded, but it was not too much a problem.
There are more famous Dali-work other places, but the building and the art is well worth a visit.

reviewnospace:
Not being very into Dali's work, I cannot say much about the art displayed in the museum. There is not a lot of "melted clocks", but some quite fun paintings and objects that made my children enjoy the visit. The building itself, both interior and exterior, is quite fascinating.

But: We waited for more than an hour in the sun, in a quite unorganised queue (people heading to the tourist information have to pass through the queue all the time). Finally got in, and as others have written: The house is packed. In the narrow corridors there really is far to many people, in the larger areas it is not such a big problem.

PS: It is possible to buy tickets online for weekends all year round and aternoons from 1/07 to 31/08 on the website.

reviewnospace: We arrived 1 hour after opening and the line was endless to get in. Disappointed, but we weren't willing to stand in the sun for an hour with 2 children, we headed off. On the way home, late afternoon, we gave it one more try and the line was much much shorter. You enter wondering what he was thinking with most of his art and you leave thinking the same thing but with a admiration for him and what he achieved which is both skilful and detailed. My 9 yr old loved it, especially how every piece was so different. The jewels were beautiful and this museum was almost empty which was enjoyable. Go early or late but definitely go you won't regret it.

quote: Not worth a detour, an expensive tourist trap
reviewnospace:
It is supposedly one of the most visited museums in the world. Be prepared to stand in line for more than an hour, to finally find yourself in a small museum flooded with people.

Although the exterior of the building is promising, the museum is not worth waiting in line and the entrance fee of 12 € (2013). You will not find any of the famous paintings of Dali such as "The Persistence of Memory", "Metamorphosis of Narcissus", "Sacrament of the last Supper", "Christ of Saint John of the Cross" or any painting with elephants, melting clocks, ... .
It is a collection of Dali's "second class" work: drawings, unknown paintings, early work, furniture, some fun objects.

In addition, there is no apparent organization of the exhibited work (period, year, theme, ...) and no signs explaining each object ( title of the work, year of production, ... ).

To make everything worse, the museum is filled with people ( you need to stand in line IN the museum to see artwork closer! ). No way to look to work from a distance, share ideas with your companions, ... , a rather stressful visit.
titleopinion: Not worth a detour, an expensive tourist trap. It is supposedly one of the most visited museums in the world. In addition, there is no apparent organization of the exhibited work (period, year, theme, ...) and no signs explaining each object ( title of the work, year of production, ... ).   To make everything worse, the museum is filled with people ( you need to stand in line IN the museum to see artwork closer! ). No way to look to work from a distance, share ideas with your companions, ... , a rather stressful visit.

quote: The Museum is Great, but the Crowds... UGH
reviewnospace:
I think I would have had a great time at this museum-- it's well laid out and beautifully curated. But the crowds! Good grief. Every time was trying to really look at a picture, some little kid would elbow past me. Or (and this the worst) I would be blocked by someone who wants to use his iphone to take a picture of all the pictures!

The saving grace was the optional show of Dali's jewels. There weren't a lot of people in the special exhibition, and the jewels were really amazing.

quote: A must see. If summer time go at night, it was fantastic.
reviewnospace: I thoroughly enjoyed every minute of this tour. It was so different and so interesting and often amazing. Seeing it by night was an added advantage as there are only 500 tickets sold. The entrance times are 10pm or 11pm, we had to go for the latter as the former was full but we decided to try to enter at 10:30pm and got in which was great as we were the last to leave at 01:00! There was just so much to see. It was a gorgeous way to see Dali's work and I would really highly recommend it.

reviewnospace: Quirky, fun, bizarre at the same time, this is certainly worth travelling up for. We'd taken the train from Sants to Figures and Girona, making a full day trip of it. Its the type of museum where you are left on your own to make what you want of each exhibit, but if you like Dali's style you'll enjoy it. Don't miss the jewel collection next door.

quote: A true gem, a MUST see
reviewnospace: This is one of the most impressive museums I've ever seen (and I have visited many..). So unique, so engaging, so insane and genius, at the same time. If you visit Barcelona or travel anywhere in Spain, you just have to get there. Allow yourself at least 2-3 hours to fully appreciate it and get ready to surrender to Dali's world, be puzzled and discover wonders. Practically speaking, the museum is packed with people, so try to arrive as early as you can (Opens a 9:00). We came at 10:00 a.m and by noon it became nearly impossible to move around the corridors, seriously. Try to get your tickets in advance ( we were so happy we did) as the line we saw getting out of the building included well over a hundred people who waited for a good 45-60 min in the sun (no shade) just to get to the ticket booth.

reviewnospace:
This is a very special museum, nothing you have ever seen. We visited from Barcelona a s a day trip, I would recommend taking the high speed train. We did not have any problem, at the beginning of july, to buy tickets. The plaza near the museum is nice and you can have lunch there. The rest of Figueres, or at least the part I saw when we walked from the train station to the museum is not beautiful or inviting.
The museum is very creative and reflects the personality of Dali. I am not a fan, even though I thought the museum was a must visit. Very interesting

reviewnospace:
Our visit was not well planned, and we arrived rather late, just 90 min before closing. Parking in the area was easy and not too expensive. Entrance was free for the kids, and 12 Euro per adult. Value for money!
The building itself is worth a special look, both from the outside and the inside. Salvador Dali bought the theater to install his works. The way the art is placed around the theater lets you have a proper look at all items, even the simpler sketches (with intriguing details of course). There were many visitors in the museum, but it never felt overcrowded. There were places to sit down and lovely outdoor area within the building.
It is worthwhile to have a brief idea of the person Salvador Dali, his main ideas and production, before entering the museum. The presentation contains both monumental sculptures, paintings, 3D pictures, sketches and the building is also the sarcophagi of Salvador Dali. Respect!

Visiting to the museum with two schoolchildren was a thrill. They were both horrified and amused by the objects made of a mans fantasy. The shop had the usual souvenirs, posters, books etc. The variety of literature could have been bigger, though this can easily be found elsewhere (on the internet).

Suggest if possible to go to his house outside Cadaques as well. Picturesque and different.

quote: Top marks! - even better with the guide
reviewnospace: As we had a look at the queue trailing down the street across the plaza and on out of site we noticed that the tourist information office just outside the museum offered guided tours at set times in a range of languages. So for E20 instead of E17 we got a great insight into the work of a hugely talented artist. We wouldn't have got anything like as much information by just wandering around ourselves. Following the museum tour the guide took us for a short tour around the centre of Figueres adding a lot of background to Salvador Dalí's life - it was well worth it. In addition, the ticket we got from the tourist information gave us entry to the the Dalí jewellery museum. This is a must if you're in Figueres.

reviewnospace: Even if you are not a Dali fan (I am not - husband is) this is a great museum to visit. Lots to see plenty of sitting areas and whilst busy not over crowded. We did have the advantage of a private guide - yes expensive but well worth it - who helped us round and explained lots to us but even without this it would have been great. (Guide came via Viator)

reviewnospace: Dali's Teatro- Museo in Figueres is definitely worth visiting if you have the time when you are in Spain. It is easily accessed by train or bus from southern France or from Barcelona. His works include sculpture, paintings, jewellery and clothing. This can be followed up by a visit to his house in the delightful town of Cadaques, an hour's bus ride or drive away.

This can be followed up by a visit to his house in the delightful town of Cadaques, an hour's bus ride or drive away.

reviewnospace:
We were planning on going the next morning but when we walked out for for our first look after checking into the Hotel Plaza Inn, there was no line at all. I had read it could be several hours wait so I took it for a sign. It was amazing, bizarrre, and enlightening. We didn't buy the audioguide but I feel like that was fine. You get a definite sense of mise. I didnt see a lot of bored children, either because everything was so engaging. In one room, I stuck a euro into a machine in front of a man built of circuitry and thought it didn't work. Then my boyfriend pointed out that the metal contraption on top was expanding to create a shadowed cross design on the wall behind. The room itself was draped in a heavy gray fabric. A level below, I found a machine that did the same in miniature -perhaps the practice mechanism? It wasn't too crowded; we waited about 10 minutes to get to the lens in the Mar West room but I found it fascinating from every angle. There may have a 1 person wait for some objects, but that was still fine. I also really enjoyed Joies; loved how the studies were adjacent to the actual jewels. I loved that it was looking at Dali's brain but without having explicit placards everywhere.
.

quote: If you were in town you would be a fool not to go!
reviewnospace:
If you were in town you would be a fool not to go!

I am not going to spoil the surprises, This is Dali at his best!
titleopinion: If you were in town you would be a fool not to go!. If you were in town you would be a fool not to go!  I am not going to spoil the surprises, This is Dali at his best!

reviewnospace: I went into this place with an open mind and have to say that it is the most thought-provoking experience I have had for a long time (actually since the Moscow art galleries in April 2009). It's incredibly popular and busy - the queue meant about a 40 minute wait, but it's worth it. (If you wait until later in the day the queue dies down considerably).We followed the route plan in the simple guide and saw most exhibits. The jewels in the other part of the museum are an absolute must. What a genius to have worked with so many media in such a way... and what a master, eclectic, painter (however much he 'bigged-up' his own image). Self-indulgent or creative genius? Having been through this place I'll come down on the latter!

Having been through this place I'll come down on the latter!

reviewnospace: Dali- I had always thought of him as eccentric and colourful, but until our Australian family visited this museum, I had not realized what a versatile and supremely talented craftsman he was. Often inspired by his wife, Gala, Dali created masterpieces in furniture, jewellery,mosaic, charcoal, paint, ink, photography and pretty well anything else that triggered his imagination. The museum is colourful and easy to navigate, if you follow the recommended paths. Each space is unique and quirky. Our three children, aged 12-15 were awe-struck by the magnitude and off-beat nature of Dali's works. It was definitely worth the day trip - even all the way from Carcassonne! A memory of a lifetime and one of the most memorable museums I have ever visited .PS Leave your backpack or large camera bag behind!
titleopinion: Intriguing, inspiring and unforgettable experience. Dali- I had always thought of him as eccentric and colourful, but until our Australian family visited this museum, I had not realized what a versatile and supremely talented craftsman he was. Often inspired by his wife, Gala, Dali created masterpieces in furniture, jewellery,mosaic, charcoal, paint, ink, photography and pretty well anything else that triggered his imagination. The museum is colourful and easy to navigate, if you follow the recommended paths. Each space is unique and quirky. Our three children, aged 12-15 were awe-struck by the magnitude and off-beat nature of Dali's works. It was definitely worth the day trip - even all the way from Carcassonne! A memory of a lifetime and one of the most memorable museums I have ever visited .PS Leave your backpack or large camera bag behind!

reviewnospace: What a great find in a completely obscure part of Spain. Despite having to endure a long wait [due to queuing] to get inside, the Museum is completely awe inspiring. I would not call myself artistically inclined but this is a totally interesting museum based on one man's life work and we are glad we discovered in the small town of Figueres, [150 mins north of Barcelona via AP7). The collection of art works here show someone who was either troubled, completely high most of the time or a true genius way ahead of his time. The devotion to the human form [especially female] is compelling as are the large works in the various corners or displays inside the Teatro. Make sure you also take in the jewelry collection, in a separate building.

Despite having to endure a long wait [due to queuing] to get inside, the Museum is completely awe inspiring. I would not call myself artistically inclined but this is a totally interesting museum based on one man's life work and we are glad we discovered in the small town of Figueres, [150 mins north of Barcelona via AP7). reviewnospace: Get your tickets in advance and skip the long queue in the very hot sun. There is a lot to see and the staff is friendly and helpful. But it's a nightmare to find your way around the small rooms and corridors. Take your time and be patient.
titleopinion: Crowded but interesting. Get your tickets in advance and skip the long queue in the very hot sun. There is a lot to see and the staff is friendly and helpful. But it's a nightmare to find your way around the small rooms and corridors. Take your time and be patient.

reviewnospace:
This was amazing, even with all the crowds. I'm not a great fan of Dali, not that I knew a lot about him, and was really only going because my husband wanted to, and it was raining, but the experience was just overwhelming. To see so much of his art in one place allowed me to appreciate how innovative and creative he was, and so ahead of his contemporaries. It was also possible to see just how good he was as an artist, in terms of his drawing and painting skills. But really, it is Dali's imagination and breadth of vision that was the most striking. I can't say that I really understood all that he was trying to convey, but it was liberating to get some insight into his mind and preoccupations.

Be aware, that parking can be difficult and expensive. We parked in the car park located right next to the museum and even early in the day, it was hard to find a park. Also, the spaces were very small, so if you have a large car (we only had a polo), you may find it hard to park.

As well, there was quite a long queue to get in, and we were there before the main tourist crowds, so investigate if you can pre-book. Our tickets gave us entry into another Dali exhibition of his jewellery, which was fabulous.
titleopinion: Excellent experience. This was amazing, even with all the crowds. I'm not a great fan of Dali, not that I knew a lot about him, and was really only going because my husband wanted to, and it was raining, but the experience was just overwhelming. To see so much of his art in one place allowed me to appreciate how innovative and creative he was, and so ahead of his contemporaries. It was also possible to see just how good he was as an artist, in terms of his drawing and painting skills. But really, it is Dali's imagination and breadth of vision that was the most striking. I can't say that I really understood all that he was trying to convey, but it was liberating to get some insight into his mind and preoccupations.  Be aware, that parking can be difficult and expensive. We parked in the car park located right next to the museum and even early in the day, it was hard to find a park. Also, the spaces were very small, so if you have a large car (we only had a polo), you may find it hard to park.  As well, there was quite a long queue to get in, and we were there before the main tourist crowds, so investigate if you can pre-book. Our tickets gave us entry into another Dali exhibition of his jewellery, which was fabulous.

quote: Skip the line and book on a tour instead
reviewnospace: Pop in to the tourist office and book yourself on a tour - also includes tickets for the Jewels exhibition which you can visit whilst you wait for your tour to start. That way we avoided the queue of over an hour in the midday heat, and for only a few euros more per head it was well worth it for the knowledgeable guide as we got a lot more out of the visit.
titleopinion: Skip the line and book on a tour instead. Pop in to the tourist office and book yourself on a tour - also includes tickets for the Jewels exhibition which you can visit whilst you wait for your tour to start. That way we avoided the queue of over an hour in the midday heat, and for only a few euros more per head it was well worth it for the knowledgeable guide as we got a lot more out of the visit.

quote: Great place but just a bit too confined.
reviewnospace: This was really a great place top see if you are a Dali fan.It is colourful and quirky but as it has quite small corridors , they really should introduce a one-way system around the museum - that way you would get to see everything without trying to get through throngs of people walking in all directions,I got a bit lost and when I asked for directions from a female attendant I was given such an awful look that i just moved on - i think that I interupted her reading her book !! Thankfully I found a male attendent who was so polite and helped me find my way around But all in all it was really worth seeing.I particularily enjoyed seeing Dalis jewellery which is housed in a separate area beside the museum .They were all just exquisite.
titleopinion: Great place but just a bit too confined.. This was really a great place top see if you are a Dali fan.It is colourful and quirky but as it has quite small corridors , they really should introduce a one-way system around the museum - that way you would get to see everything without trying to get through throngs of people walking in all directions,I got a bit lost and when I asked for directions from a female attendant I was given such an awful look that i just moved on - i think that I interupted her reading her book !! Thankfully I found a male attendent who was so polite and helped me find my way around But all in all it was really worth seeing.I particularily enjoyed seeing Dalis jewellery which is housed in a separate area beside the museum .They were all just exquisite.

quote: A Unique Experience -- worth the trip
reviewnospace:
Of all the museums I have seen in my life, this one I'll remember!

After seeing the Dali special exhibition with some of his most famous works at the Reina Sofia in Madrid (to Sept. 2013), Dali's scope and genius is even more apparent in this fantastic setting in Figueres. When you only see a few of Dali's works, you can mistakingly think that it is all fantasy, bizarre and egotistical. When you see so many and the variety, you realize he was a true genius (if a bit neurotic) and unmatched in technique and breath.

The collection is roughly in chronological order and the map gives clear directions (even arrows), although it says you don't have to follow them in any order. Most of the rooms have a theme. Do not miss the Mae West room! I particularly like that you can take photos and videos (no flash!) to share with friends.

There were a several children touring and they seemed to really enjoy the art. To be sure, some of his works are "adult" but usually the eroticism is even difficult for adults to see and interpret, so I don't think children under 16 can really recognize that aspect.

There was a line to get tickets at 2 pm on a July Thursday and a similar line at 5 pm. Likely even more crowded on weekends. There is no audio guide -- which might be intentional because it could slow down crowd flow -- and I'm not sure whether many of this works can really be explained anyway.
There were several tour groups, which can clog up a whole room sometimes --- my advice is just skip a room if there too many and then come back to it. The people density tends to fluctuate -- crowded one minute and nearly empty 10-15 minutes later. You can go any direction through the rooms and retrace your steps if you want.

Figure minimum of two hours -- better 3 or 4. The museum is actually rather compact and I found navigation and amount of walking reasonable (I use a cane). There are a few wicker chairs in most rooms to rest and a nice outdoor plaza on the 2nd floor. Good air conditioning, too. The jewel collection (separate entrance) is worth visiting for 30 -45 minutes. There are several cafes just outside the museum.

From Barcelona, the most convenient is the MD (media distancia) trains that run about every hour and take 110 minutes. The cheaper Regional trains take 130 minutes and are not as nice. There is very limited high speed service, too (50 minutes). The scenery is not interesting except for the last 15 miles or so. Take a book or MP3 player.

The walk from the Renfe train station is uphill -- I took a taxi for 10 euros. The walk back to the train station is about 1 km (15 minutes). The old part of Figueres and the Ramblas are typical and not particularly interesting.

Whether you like Dali or not, a day in Figueres is a day you won't forget.

reviewnospace: My fiance and I love art and could not pass up a Dali museum. It was absolutely amazing definitely worth seeing. We took a train about 200km which took about 2 hours for 15 euro a person from a local station in Barcelona (Clot-Aragos) there and back. There was about an hour line to get in the museum I think it could have been avoided if you bought your tickets online (something to look into). We ate tapas around the corner from the museum, but after that there is not much to do in Figueres so we left after being there a half day.
titleopinion: Great day trip from Barcelona. My fiance and I love art and could not pass up a Dali museum. It was absolutely amazing definitely worth seeing. We took a train about 200km which took about 2 hours for 15 euro a person from a local station in Barcelona (Clot-Aragos) there and back. There was about an hour line to get in the museum I think it could have been avoided if you bought your tickets online (something to look into). We ate tapas around the corner from the museum, but after that there is not much to do in Figueres so we left after being there a half day.

reviewnospace: This is my favourite museum ever! Completely blows your mind away, the surrealism of his paintings is a must see. If you enjoy art and like Dali, then visit this museum. It's a day trip from Barcelona. Just beware walking through the Figueres village, it's a bit dodgy, there are strange people around so hold onto your bag tight and you will be fine. The museum is about a 10-15min walk from the station.
titleopinion: Amazing!. This is my favourite museum ever! Completely blows your mind away, the surrealism of his paintings is a must see. If you enjoy art and like Dali, then visit this museum. It's a day trip from Barcelona. Just beware walking through the Figueres village, it's a bit dodgy, there are strange people around so hold onto your bag tight and you will be fine. The museum is about a 10-15min walk from the station.

reviewnospace: I liked it all an intense experience for a Dali lover like me. The entire building is a shrine to the man himself. There is humor there is darkness there is preoccupation with mortality.
titleopinion: Dali lovers must see. I liked it all an intense experience for a Dali lover like me. The entire building is a shrine to the man himself. There is humor there is darkness there is preoccupation with mortality.

reviewnospace: Prepare to spend several hours there to appreciate the great collection. You'll see something different when you look at the same exhibit again. The entrance fee includes a visit to Dali Jewels which is virtually next door. You could take a lunch break and then visit the Jewels museum in the afternoon. The collection is much more interesting than what I've expected.

The entrance fee includes a visit to Dali Jewels which is virtually next door. You could take a lunch break and then visit the Jewels museum in the afternoon. reviewnospace: Visited the Dali museum whilst on holidaying on the Costa Brava, we went with an organised tour which cost €51,00 each, this also included a stop off in Pubol, the village that Dali's wife Gala lived. Well worth the money as the tour guides give you all the information on the life and work of Dali. The only downside of this visit was that the museum was very crowded, which didnt give you the chance to observe this great artist's work.
titleopinion: Dali Museum. Visited the Dali museum whilst on holidaying on the Costa Brava, we went with an organised tour which cost €51,00 each, this also included a stop off in Pubol, the village that Dali's wife Gala lived. Well worth the money as the tour guides give you all the information on the life and work of Dali. The only downside of this visit was that the museum was very crowded, which didnt give you the chance to observe this great artist's work.

reviewnospace:
The Dali Theatre-Museum is a short 53 minute ride from Barcelona on the high speed train. The museum is fun to see even if you are not an art enthusiast. There are many crazy pieces to see and experience.
The town of Figueres is picturesque and easy to get around in.
I would recommend this as fun day trip from Barcelona.
titleopinion: Fun day trip from Barcelona. The Dali Theatre-Museum is a short 53 minute ride from Barcelona on the high speed train. The museum is fun to see even if you are not an art enthusiast. There are many crazy pieces to see and experience.  The town of Figueres is picturesque and easy to get around in.  I would recommend this as fun day trip from Barcelona.

reviewnospace: This museum is lots of fun for fans of Dali and surrealism. Don't miss it, but go early in the day to avoid the crowds. The interior can be a bit cramped.
titleopinion: Fun for the intellect!. This museum is lots of fun for fans of Dali and surrealism. Don't miss it, but go early in the day to avoid the crowds. The interior can be a bit cramped.

reviewnospace:
We stopped for the night on our way from Barcelona to Paris to visit the Dali museum. It's and easy 50 minutes train ride from Barcelona to Figueres, and well worth the time.

The museum entry was €12 which included entry to the Dali jewels, which is reached via a separate entrance and not to be missed. They are simply stunning.

The museum building is amazing and the exhibits are nicely displayed. You are allowed to take as many photos you want providing you don't use a flash.

All in all a great way to spend some time in Figueres.
titleopinion: Stunning setting and jewel collection. We stopped for the night on our way from Barcelona to Paris to visit the Dali museum. It's and easy 50 minutes train ride from Barcelona to Figueres, and well worth the time.  The museum entry was €12 which included entry to the Dali jewels, which is reached via a separate entrance and not to be missed. They are simply stunning.  The museum building is amazing and the exhibits are nicely displayed. You are allowed to take as many photos you want providing you don't use a flash.  All in all a great way to spend some time in Figueres.

quote: Being here is like getting a close look into Dalí's head
reviewnospace: Not only for Dalí fans, this museum is a real artists' tour-de-force. Orinially from Figueres, Dalí was able to convince the authorities to let him have the building (former theatre) and let him plan and design its features and the exhibition of his work, so this is probably the closest one can go to see how his mind worked. An impressive and fun collection, not to be missed if you are in the region.
titleopinion: Being here is like getting a close look into Dalí's head. Not only for Dalí fans, this museum is a real artists' tour-de-force. Orinially from Figueres, Dalí was able to convince the authorities to let him have the building (former theatre) and let him plan and design its features and the exhibition of his work, so this is probably the closest one can go to see how his mind worked. An impressive and fun collection, not to be missed if you are in the region.

reviewnospace: After visiting the Dali museum in St Petersburg in Florida we had high hopes for Salvadores own piece of work. Both we and the children got very disappointed of the whole thing. Chaotic. Unclear plan of how the public should access the site. Virtually no presentation of any of the pieces of work. In short: boring.
titleopinion: No thought, no presentation. After visiting the Dali museum in St Petersburg in Florida we had high hopes for Salvadores own piece of work. Both we and the children got very disappointed of the whole thing. Chaotic. Unclear plan of how the public should access the site. Virtually no presentation of any of the pieces of work. In short: boring.

quote: Easy to get to from Barcelona
reviewnospace:
I had a great visit at the Dali Museum while I was staying in Barcelona before a Mediterranean Cruise. The Dali Museum is only 53 minutes away if you take the high speed Ave train or 2 plus hours on the local train. There is a local bus that takes you from the Figueres Valiant(high speed) train station into the town of Figueres. From there, it's a 5 minute walk to the museum. If you take the local train, you get off in the town center.

Get to the museum early. I arrived about 10:15 and when I left around 12:30, there was a long line to get in. I spent about 2 hours in the museum and the crowds were okay. Pack your patience because the museum routes you through the exhibits in a certain order and the rooms can get crowded.
titleopinion: Easy to get to from Barcelona. I had a great visit at the Dali Museum while I was staying in Barcelona before a Mediterranean Cruise. I spent about 2 hours in the museum and the crowds were okay. Pack your patience because the museum routes you through the exhibits in a certain order and the rooms can get crowded.

quote: Not a big art fan- but loved it!
reviewnospace:
The museum is beautifull! Alot of special an great art,
The whole museum is built in a very artistic way.
Its a bit far from Barcelona (I think like 2 hours drive).
I advise to take a guided tour because the guid tells you alot of aspects about Dalis life and explains alot of meanings in the paitings.
Don't miss it!

reviewnospace: I spent 3 hours here and would have stayed longer but had to get to Valencia! If you are into Dali you must visit this beautiful place!
titleopinion: Stunning!. I spent 3 hours here and would have stayed longer but had to get to Valencia! If you are into Dali you must visit this beautiful place!

reviewnospace:
If you really like Dali's works : Under two hours by train from Barcelona ( seeing great countryside view while riding the train ) , and another 15 minutes walk from the train station to the museum : Take a slow walk around the Dali complex - it's beautiful . Once you enter the museum you have to hope there won't be too many tourist groups , and you have to be patient : some of the showrooms are small and narrow , and therefore get easily clogged with other human beings that - like youself - want to enjoy the amazing world of Dali . We have enjoyed every square meter of the museum .
Once you are back at the train station , don't go back to Barcelona yet : You must make a 2-3 hours stop at the small town of Girona (Jerrona) , and only then - take the train to Barcelona .

quote: You have no idea until you get there
reviewnospace:
Definitely worth the trip to Figueres if you are in Barcelona.

A fast train takes about an hour or so and you'll be blocks away from this marvellous museum. Not much more to say than "Dali".

Also, don't forget to visit the "Dali joies" exhibition. Dali designing jewels that are certainly not made to wear. You'll never forget this works of art.

Probably takes up half a day if you're in Barcelona.

reviewnospace: very popular site almost 2.5 hours by train from barcelona but the line in the entrance wasn't too long and i took some pictures while waiting.this museum and the little jewelery museum next to it crowded but absolutely worth it any way,one of the "must see" places outside barcelona.
titleopinion: amazing dali experience. very popular site almost 2.5 hours by train from barcelona but the line in the entrance wasn't too long and i took some pictures while waiting.this museum and the little jewelery museum next to it crowded but absolutely worth it any way,one of the  must see  places outside barcelona.

quote: Pat C: Salvatore Dali Museum , Figueras, Spain
reviewnospace:
This is a fantastic attraction ,( in its original sense). It is housed in a former theatre , which particularly lends itself to the presentation of the work of this amazing artist , sculpter ,designer, and self publicist.This collection of paintings, sketches , and sculpture contains a large number of works ,ranging from the literally huge to miniature jewels that could fit in the palm of your hand ( in the adjacent facility ).
Whilst I often find that much modern art is bland,and routine , this display hits between the eyes,( and sometimes below the belt ! ) The sheer range and diversity of talent here is enthralling.
When we visited , the building was rather crowded, with a smallish queue to get in .
Amazingly it appeared that photography is allowed.
Inside the building was cool and quite comfortable to progress through the route indicated on the given leaflet . The way is narrow in part and several steps are involved
Be sure not to miss the attached ''Jewels '' museum .

reviewnospace: I didn't really know if I would like this....it was fabulous, as well as the jewels exhibit right alongside the main museum, included in the ticket price. A beautiful and though provoking place. Only complaint was the huge amount of people there. We didn't have to wait in line long, but once inside prepare for a mob scene. Still with it....I would highly recommend. Hotels and great food within walking distance.
titleopinion: Wonderful museum. I didn't really know if I would like this....it was fabulous, as well as the jewels exhibit right alongside the main museum, included in the ticket price. A beautiful and though provoking place. Only complaint was the huge amount of people there. We didn't have to wait in line long, but once inside prepare for a mob scene. Still with it....I would highly recommend. Hotels and great food within walking distance.

quote: Love Figueres...LOVE Dali... LOOVE the museum
reviewnospace: Surreal.. you know it! One of the most amazing kookiest creative brains of the 20th century, the Dali museum doesn't disappoint! The exhibit is fun, well curated and diverse. I didn't even realize that Dali designed jewelry! It was awesome and so unique. Only piece of advice is to really take your time with certain pieces of art. He was a great fan of illusions and master of altering your optical view if you allow it. I noticed many tourists skim past many of his art work that you had to stop and look twice. Like the 3D effects on his Gala double art where you press your nose to the glass to create the effect. There's also his duality art pieces like the Lincoln portrait/naked woman on balcony... or his pieces where there's a metal vase on top... people fail to look into the vase to see the actual vision he had in store.. so when you go, take a breathe, go slow and enjoy the ride or you'll be upset you missed out.

The exhibit is fun, well curated and diverse. I didn't even realize that Dali designed jewelry! It was awesome and so unique. Only piece of advice is to really take your time with certain pieces of art. He was a great fan of illusions and master of altering your optical view if you allow it. I noticed many tourists skim past many of his art work that you had to stop and look twice. Like the 3D effects on his Gala double art where you press your nose to the glass to create the effect. There's also his duality art pieces like the Lincoln portrait/naked woman on balcony... or his pieces where there's a metal vase on top... people fail to look into the vase to see the actual vision he had in store.. so when you go, take a breathe, go slow and enjoy the ride or you'll be upset you missed out.

reviewnospace: We went specifically to Figueres to visit this museum and we weren't disappointed. It is a truly fabulous museum showing all the variety of work, this genius produced including the most exquisite jewellery.
titleopinion: A must see. We went specifically to Figueres to visit this museum and we weren't disappointed. It is a truly fabulous museum showing all the variety of work, this genius produced including the most exquisite jewellery.

reviewnospace:
Nothing to add to general consensus. Most people going will be fans of Dali and if you're a fan you'll like the museum!

Bit spoiled in England by museums being free so 12 Euros might seem a bit steep initially but it's worth it.
titleopinion: Great. Nothing to add to general consensus. Most people going will be fans of Dali and if you're a fan you'll like the museum!  Bit spoiled in England by museums being free so 12 Euros might seem a bit steep initially but it's worth it.

quote: See this, yes, but be sure to visit his house in Port Lligat too!
reviewnospace:
I visited the museum in early June. There wasn't much of a line to get in, though once we were inside it was pretty crowded.
I was impressed by the sheer volume of art on show, but it was a little difficult to spend time contemplating, which with an artist like Dali you want to do. The installations, particularly the Mae West couch, are arranged so that there is constant flow of visitors taking a quick look and being moved on. There are one or two rooms with stunning works on the ceiling.
The galleries and alcoves above the main lobby, which display any of his sketches, are a little quieter, and the staircase to the rear leads to a small treasure: Dali's private collection of work by other artists.
In hindsight, this museum in Figueres is something of a disappointment. A couple of days later I toured Dali's house in Port Lligat, about an hour's drive away, and came away from there feeling like I had learned a lot more about Dali as an artist and a person. Make time to visit his house!

In hindsight, this museum in Figueres is something of a disappointment. A couple of days later I toured Dali's house in Port Lligat, about an hour's drive away, and came away from there feeling like I had learned a lot more about Dali as an artist and a person. Make time to visit his house!

reviewnospace:
Visited the museum after a recommendation from colleagues. Outstanding presentation and very interesting. Make sure to visit the adjacent museum for a look at the jewels.

We arrived at 11:00 and the line was about a 25 minute wait. We spent an easy 3.5 hours in the museum.
titleopinion: Unexpected delight.. Visited the museum after a recommendation from colleagues. Outstanding presentation and very interesting. Make sure to visit the adjacent museum for a look at the jewels.   We arrived at 11:00 and the line was about a 25 minute wait. We spent an easy 3.5 hours in the museum.

quote: A visual treat at every corner
reviewnospace: We visited the museum from Barcelona. The train ride was easy enough, and there are many trains from Barcelona to Figueres and vice versa. Visiting this museum is like being a kid in a candy store - it is visual spectacle and without the shadow of a doubt, the most interesting museum I have visited. Dali surprises you in ways that you cannot imagine. You see the work of a great artist, and what makes the museum so special is that Dali himself was the creator of the museum. You are not just visiting the museum to admire the pieces on display - the museum itself is Dali's work of art. Make time to visit the museum, you will not regret it.
titleopinion: A visual treat at every corner. We visited the museum from Barcelona. The train ride was easy enough, and there are many trains from Barcelona to Figueres and vice versa. Visiting this museum is like being a kid in a candy store - it is visual spectacle and without the shadow of a doubt, the most interesting museum I have visited. Dali surprises you in ways that you cannot imagine. You see the work of a great artist, and what makes the museum so special is that Dali himself was the creator of the museum. You are not just visiting the museum to admire the pieces on display - the museum itself is Dali's work of art. Make time to visit the museum, you will not regret it.

quote: We had great expectations, and it met all of them!
reviewnospace:
We visited Barcelona in May and at the top of our list of things to see outside of Barcelona was Dali Museum. We were not disappointed at all. We are great fans of Dali's work and this place was perfect for us to enjoy everything we like about Dali and his originality. We visited it coming from Girona, totally worth the trip, it was one of the highlights of our trip to Catalunya
We also got to see the jewlery he designed, that is shown at another location nearby, outside of the main museum, very interesting too
titleopinion: We had great expectations, and it met all of them!. We visited Barcelona in May and at the top of our list of things to see outside of Barcelona was Dali Museum. We were not disappointed at all. We are great fans of Dali's work and this place was perfect for us to enjoy everything we like about Dali and his originality. We visited it coming from Girona, totally worth the trip, it was one of the highlights of our trip to Catalunya We also got to see the jewlery he designed, that is shown at another location nearby, outside of the main museum, very interesting too

reviewnospace: very unusual attraction, but really worth to stay a few hours. My advise to plan a longer stay, rather than hopping with a bus tour. Better yet - stay a night or two in Figueres and see the other sights too!!!
titleopinion: worth to stay longer. very unusual attraction, but really worth to stay a few hours. My advise to plan a longer stay, rather than hopping with a bus tour. Better yet - stay a night or two in Figueres and see the other sights too!!!

quote: Great experience, worth the trip, but go early
reviewnospace:
This place is what you expect it to be - engaging, mysterious, and just a bit strange. It's worth the money and the trip if you're a Dali fan - the jewelry section was the most impressive since it wasn't something I expected to see there. Note that nearly all of Dali's famous art is elsewhere (currently a lot of it at the Reina Sofia in Madrid), so you won't see that.

The afternoon visit was VERY crowded - so much so that a number of areas were pretty difficult to enjoy. If doing this again, I think we would have arrived earlier in the day.
titleopinion: Great experience, worth the trip, but go early. This place is what you expect it to be - engaging, mysterious, and just a bit strange. It's worth the money and the trip if you're a Dali fan - the jewelry section was the most impressive since it wasn't something I expected to see there. Note that nearly all of Dali's famous art is elsewhere (currently a lot of it at the Reina Sofia in Madrid), so you won't see that.  The afternoon visit was VERY crowded - so much so that a number of areas were pretty difficult to enjoy. If doing this again, I think we would have arrived earlier in the day.

quote: Maybe the only place to be visited in Figueres
reviewnospace:
The building itself is great to visit. It is in fact a theater which was transformed in a museum. The eggs on the roof and the breads on the facade combined with the funky color and the old architectural elements of the theater a great to discover.
You learn a lot about Dali and Gala and you discover much of his more unknown works. The exhibition is great, but there are some parts which did not catch my attention (other artists... sometimes a bit repetitive).
Unfortunately there an many visitors and its horribly full.
titleopinion: Maybe the only place to be visited in Figueres. The building itself is great to visit. It is in fact a theater which was transformed in a museum. The eggs on the roof and the breads on the facade combined with the funky color and the old architectural elements of the theater a great to discover. You learn a lot about Dali and Gala and you discover much of his more unknown works. The exhibition is great, but there are some parts which did not catch my attention (other artists... sometimes a bit repetitive). Unfortunately there an many visitors and its horribly full.

reviewnospace: As we love Salvador Dali before visiting Cadaques we went to this museum and found it incredibly interesting. We loved the central park inside where you feel like you are in some kind of mysterious place. The outside is also beautiful - would recommended.
titleopinion: Worth the money. As we love Salvador Dali before visiting Cadaques we went to this museum and found it incredibly interesting. We loved the central park inside where you feel like you are in some kind of mysterious place. The outside is also beautiful - would recommended.

reviewnospace: Interesting museum, even if the world famous paintings by Dali are not on display. Very crowded on a rainy sunday, even in low season (may).
titleopinion: Not on a rainy sunday. Interesting museum, even if the world famous paintings by Dali are not on display. Very crowded on a rainy sunday, even in low season (may).

quote: Wonderful place for the whole family
reviewnospace: Spent almost 4 hours in this place with 5 & 6 year old boys - a great combination of interesting and wonderful art that really captures the imagination...
titleopinion: Wonderful place for the whole family. Spent almost 4 hours in this place with 5 & 6 year old boys - a great combination of interesting and wonderful art that really captures the imagination...

reviewnospace: Who knew that in addition to his paintings, Dali designed fabulous, glorious jewelry on display in a separate part of the museum. The museum is a gem (no pun intended)!
titleopinion: Who knew?. Who knew that in addition to his paintings, Dali designed fabulous, glorious jewelry on display in a separate part of the museum. The museum is a gem (no pun intended)!

reviewnospace:
If you like Dali's art then you must visit the Teatre-Museum. Here you will find dozens of his amazing paintings, sculptures and all-things Dali, it is a wonderful way to spend a couple of hours for (current price) €12.00 admission per person. You can take photographs (without using a flash) throughout the museum.
This admission fee also gets you into the Dali Jewels exhibition. This is part of the same Museum building but entered through another outside door. I love Dali's artwork and sculpting but I never knew, until this May, that he also designed fine jewellery. Again you can take photographs in these rooms. As most paintings and artworks and jewellery are behind glass using a flash (which you are not supposed to do) gains you nothing as the flash light reflects off the glass.
titleopinion: Must See Museum. If you like Dali's art then you must visit the Teatre-Museum. Here you will find dozens of his amazing paintings, sculptures and all-things Dali, it is a wonderful way to spend a couple of hours for (current price) €12.00 admission per person. You can take photographs (without using a flash) throughout the museum. This admission fee also gets you into the Dali Jewels exhibition. This is part of the same Museum building but entered through another outside door. I love Dali's artwork and sculpting but I never knew, until this May, that he also designed fine jewellery. Again you can take photographs in these rooms. As most paintings and artworks and jewellery are behind glass using a flash (which you are not supposed to do) gains you nothing as the flash light reflects off the glass.

quote: Dali grows on you even if you are not a fan initially
reviewnospace: It is so impressive even the things you do not like. It all seems a little chaotic, as his mind of a genius may seem to us mortals, but in the end you are converted and wish to go back and spend more time there, or just become one of the exhibits.
titleopinion: Dali grows on you even if you are not a fan initially. It is so impressive even the things you do not like. It all seems a little chaotic, as his mind of a genius may seem to us mortals, but in the end you are converted and wish to go back and spend more time there, or just become one of the exhibits.

reviewnospace: When you see the extraordinary variety and profusion of Dali's work, you realise what pygmies people like Damien Hirst and the like are. He did it all earlier - and much more of it. Well worth a visit - but it must be he'll in high season. And Figueres is a pretty ugly place
titleopinion: A unique establishment. When you see the extraordinary variety and profusion of Dali's work, you realise what pygmies people like Damien Hirst and the like are. He did it all earlier - and much more of it. Well worth a visit - but it must be he'll in high season. And Figueres is a pretty ugly place

reviewnospace:
It is a very wonderful museum and it is oblished to visit it if you go to the North Costa Brava.
Dali's works are incredible and at same time completely crazy.

You must visit it.
titleopinion: Amazing. It is a very wonderful museum and it is oblished to visit it if you go to the North Costa Brava. Dali's works are incredible and at same time completely crazy.   You must visit it.

reviewnospace: When I got there it was for me like a journey through the subconscious. Objects created by this genius and a perfectionist are truly inspiring. Here you can feel what happens, when you don't limit your imagination, when you set it free. The things impressed me most of all: giant golden eggs on the roof of the museum, May West room ( a room where each element is a part of a face of this famous retro actrees) and some stereograms ( of Lincoln), the great portrait of Gala. When I left this crazy place I had a feeling that I had a dream theatre. I wonder what would Freud say about this=)
titleopinion: Surrealistic dream. When I got there it was for me like a journey through the subconscious. Objects created by this genius and a perfectionist are truly inspiring. Here you can feel what happens, when you don't limit your imagination, when you set it free. The things impressed me most of all: giant golden eggs on the roof of the museum, May West room ( a room where each element is a part of a face of this famous retro actrees) and some stereograms ( of Lincoln), the great portrait of Gala. When I left this crazy place I had a feeling that I had a dream theatre. I wonder what would Freud say about this=)

reviewnospace:
From the moment you enter the square (let alone the Theatre) you experience commences! Some parts you'll love; others you'll hate; some you'll understand; other will leave you confused - but you'll never be bored!!
A must to see in north east Spain.
titleopinion: Must Visit!. From the moment you enter the square (let alone the Theatre) you experience commences! Some parts you'll love; others you'll hate; some you'll understand; other will leave you confused - but you'll never be bored!! A must to see in north east Spain.

reviewnospace:
From the minute one stands in the queue to get tickets for this museum, one is aware that a fantastic experience is around the corner. The building itself reflects the idiosyncracies of Dali' and the interior is so delightfully quirky. His talents were so diverse and it is very worthwhile spending a good 3 hours in the Museum. The jewels that he designed are exceptional in their ornateness and detail.
As this is a very popular museum, it is worth arriving as it opens and avoiding weekends if possible.
titleopinion: Not to be missed!. From the minute one stands in the queue to get tickets for this museum, one is aware that a fantastic experience is around the corner. The building itself reflects the idiosyncracies of Dali' and the interior is so delightfully quirky. His talents were so diverse and it is very worthwhile spending a good 3 hours in the Museum. The jewels that he designed are exceptional in their ornateness and detail. As this is a very popular museum, it is worth arriving as it opens and avoiding weekends if possible.

reviewnospace:
my partner and i have always loved his works this museum is so breathtaking the jewellery museum next door was such a surprise.
we went to barcelona for the formula 1 and on our last day decided to take the 1.3hr journey
it was well worth it
it is very busy we where there most of the day and the afternoon was much busier than the morning
lovely little town and signposted well from the RENFE station
restricted wheelchair access
titleopinion: mind blowing experience. my partner and i have always loved his works this museum is so breathtaking the jewellery museum next door was such a surprise. we went to barcelona for the formula 1 and on our last day decided to take the 1.3hr journey it was well worth it it is very busy we where there most of the day and the afternoon was much busier than the morning lovely little town and signposted well from the RENFE station restricted wheelchair access

quote: Too crowded not enough room to appreciate works on view
reviewnospace: Exceptional setting but very very crowded I could not stand and look at a work without being jostled. Many school parties that rushed around and making noise. Works of art being touched and guards not interested, one guard was doing a crossword puzzle. The whole experience was a lesson on how a gallery should not be run. I went to the Guggenheim Bilbao a couple of weeks ago and that was a marvellous gallery. I will go back to Bilbao but sorry Salvador not to Figueres.
titleopinion: Too crowded not enough room to appreciate works on view. Exceptional setting but very very crowded I could not stand and look at a work without being jostled. Many school parties that rushed around and making noise. Works of art being touched and guards not interested, one guard was doing a crossword puzzle. The whole experience was a lesson on how a gallery should not be run. I went to the Guggenheim Bilbao a couple of weeks ago and that was a marvellous gallery. I will go back to Bilbao but sorry Salvador not to Figueres.

quote: Largest surrealistic object in the world. Don't miss it when you are in the neighbourhood.
reviewnospace:
The theatre-museum has a wide panorama of works of Dali and it is really amazing and impressive. You can see his progress, starting from his artistic experiences (impressionism, futurism, cubism etc.) to the works of the last years of his life. His surrealistic creations are really impressive.
If you are in the neighbourhood, make time to visit this museum but...........you may find a long queue waiting at the entrance. Either go early in the morning, just after opening hours (09.00 to 20.00 hours from 1 st July to 30th September. And From 1st October to 30th June 10.30 to 18.00 hours) or about later in the afternoon. You need approx. 1 hour to see everything.
titleopinion: Largest surrealistic object in the world. Don't miss it when you are in the neighbourhood.. The theatre-museum has a wide panorama of works of Dali and it is really amazing and impressive. You can see his progress, starting from his artistic experiences (impressionism, futurism, cubism etc.) to the works of the last years of his life. His surrealistic creations are really impressive. If you are in the neighbourhood, make time to visit this museum but...........you may find a long queue waiting at the entrance. Either go early in the morning, just after opening hours (09.00 to 20.00 hours from 1 st July to 30th September. And From 1st October to 30th June 10.30 to 18.00 hours) or about later in the afternoon. You need approx. 1 hour to see everything.

quote: Well worth the two hour trip from Barcelona.
reviewnospace:
The Metro trip is 30E return from Sants Station. Avoid this station if at all possible - its damn scary. No one spoke English even the Information people. They took my money fine but then no one could tell me which platform the train left from in this massive station. It was horrible. The ticket was unreadable as well. However once that was sorted. (I eventually found an English speaking passenger) Whew!!!. The trip was good and the Dali Meuseum spectacular. Well worth the long wait to get in. They even let you take photos which is unheard of in any gallery I've been to. This guy was surely on drugs. Amazing building as well.

The entrance fee is 12E Reasonable. Figures is surprisingly good. Much nicer than I expected.
titleopinion: Well worth the two hour trip from Barcelona.. The Metro trip is 30E return from Sants Station. Avoid this station if at all possible - its damn scary. No one spoke English even the Information people. They took my money fine but then no one could tell me which platform the train left from in this massive station. It was horrible. The ticket was unreadable as well. However once that was sorted. (I eventually found an English speaking passenger) Whew!!!. The trip was good and the Dali Meuseum spectacular. Well worth the long wait to get in. They even let you take photos which is unheard of in any gallery I've been to. This guy was surely on drugs. Amazing building as well.  The entrance fee is 12E Reasonable. Figures is surprisingly good. Much nicer than I expected.

reviewnospace: An experience into the bizarre and warped view of a genius. I had no idea how brilliant and painstaking the works of Dali were until I saw them here. Take the time to open yourself to an amazing talent.
titleopinion: Bemused. An experience into the bizarre and warped view of a genius. I had no idea how brilliant and painstaking the works of Dali were until I saw them here. Take the time to open yourself to an amazing talent.

reviewnospace: Full of noisy school children, rushing to get out to drink beer. This is the true art of rampant commercialisation all the Dali pictures worth seeing are in either New York or Madrid this has to be one of the low points of a great short break in Catalonia.
titleopinion: Crowded tourist honey trap. Full of noisy school children, rushing to get out to drink beer. This is the true art of rampant commercialisation all the Dali pictures worth seeing are in either New York or Madrid this has to be one of the low points of a great short break in Catalonia.

reviewnospace: What can one say about this artist, other than his work is very different from most. Well worth a visit.
titleopinion: Surrealistic experience. What can one say about this artist, other than his work is very different from most. Well worth a visit.

reviewnospace: Worth a visit. What was this man? You have to go to make up your own mind. Some strange exhibits-but very facinating
titleopinion: Dali Mad or Genius. Worth a visit. What was this man? You have to go to make up your own mind. Some strange exhibits-but very facinating

reviewnospace: Just can't get enough the superlatives to describe that surrealistic museum. Like Dali himself, this is not just a museum. It's an experience to live. Tickets gave also right to visit Dali's jewelry museum which was breathtaking! Take your time to admire this extraordinary places, we were little bit too hurry.
titleopinion: Fantastic!. Just can't get enough the superlatives to describe that surrealistic museum. Like Dali himself, this is not just a museum. It's an experience to live. Tickets gave also right to visit Dali's jewelry museum which was breathtaking! Take your time to admire this extraordinary places, we were little bit too hurry.

quote: I'm not an enthusiast but this place is interesting and impressive.
reviewnospace:
Would not from choice visit this place but, being outnumbered, went along. The architecture is very interesting and many of the exhibits are wonderful. The semi-precious stones with dragon figures were of particular interest to me, they are beautiful. The over-demand creating over-crowding makes it very difficult to appreciate exhibits or the building.
An artistic Philistine I am but glad to have experienced this attraction.
The town of Figueres has plentiful eateries and the town square is very nice, especially as we visited on St: George's day, a day of celebration in Catalonia.
titleopinion: I'm not an enthusiast but this place is interesting and impressive.. Would not from choice visit this place but, being outnumbered, went along. The architecture is very interesting and many of the exhibits are wonderful. The semi-precious stones with dragon figures were of particular interest to me, they are beautiful. The over-demand creating over-crowding makes it very difficult to appreciate exhibits or the building. An artistic Philistine I am but glad to have experienced this attraction. The town of Figueres has plentiful eateries and the town square is very nice, especially as we visited on St: George's day, a day of celebration in Catalonia.

reviewnospace: Having travelled a round trip of 4 hrs to see Dali's work we found a long queue for tickets. That aside once inside the volume of visitors entering in one go, eliminates any possibility of enjoying or contemplating the work of Dali. A frenzy of cameras and phones clicking around us, people running in all directions in the absence of a clearly marked viewing route. The noise and shouting. Result: a great artists work demoted to a fun fair attraction. Compared to other museums, this one needs to have a serious rethink.
titleopinion: Out of control. Having travelled a round trip of 4 hrs to see Dali's work we found a long queue for tickets. That aside once inside the volume of visitors entering in one go, eliminates any possibility of enjoying or contemplating the work of Dali. A frenzy of cameras and phones clicking around us, people running in all directions in the absence of a clearly marked viewing route. The noise and shouting. Result: a great artists work demoted to a fun fair attraction. Compared to other museums, this one needs to have a serious rethink.

quote: Great Museum. Must see not only for Dali fans
reviewnospace: Great experience! I really enjoyed both the Theatre itself and the jewelry collection. Definatelly worth a day trip from Barcelona!
titleopinion: Great Museum. Must see not only for Dali fans. Great experience! I really enjoyed both the Theatre itself and the jewelry collection. Definatelly worth a day trip from Barcelona!

reviewnospace: This was my second visit to the Dali Theatre and I enjoyed it as much as the first. Not easy to find in Figueres narrow and complicated streets. Managed to park about 10 mintues away on street. It was bust for early in the season but only a very short queue to get in. lots of student groups. Really quirky place with a great range of his work. Recommended if you like your art a little different.
titleopinion: Dali Theatre. This was my second visit to the Dali Theatre and I enjoyed it as much as the first. Not easy to find in Figueres narrow and complicated streets. Managed to park about 10 mintues away on street. It was bust for early in the season but only a very short queue to get in. lots of student groups. Really quirky place with a great range of his work. Recommended if you like your art a little different.

reviewnospace:
On the ruins of the former Municipal Theatre, Dalí arranged the largest surrealistic object in the world. This eccentric museum has to be visited and you should have at least 3 hours time to see a minimum. The best will be if you book a guided tour because then you get a much better insights some of the thousands masterpieces shown. But don't go there without a reservation for a tour because otherwise you may want some hours. So at least you should prebook your tickets online.

There is a separate Dalí Jewels exhibition which is also worth a visit. This has shouldn't be missed even if you are not a great fan of Dali.
titleopinion: Absolutely Amazing!. On the ruins of the former Municipal Theatre, Dalí arranged the largest surrealistic object in the world. This eccentric museum has to be visited and you should have at least 3 hours time to see a minimum. The best will be if you book a guided tour because then you get a much better insights some of the thousands masterpieces shown. But don't go there without a reservation for a tour because otherwise you may want some hours. So at least you should prebook your tickets online.  There is a separate Dalí Jewels exhibition which is also worth a visit. This has shouldn't be missed even if you are not a great fan of Dali.

reviewnospace: This museum is unlike anything else you will ever see. Everything about it and in it is a work of artistic imagination. Whether or not you like Dali's work, you have to marvel at this place. We went on a weekday, off season, and stood in the line to get in for 45 minutes. Once we were inside, it was pretty crowded. We were told that the line can take 3 hours in the summer. So be prepared or check in advance on how long the wait to get in will be.
titleopinion: Wild and Wonderful. This museum is unlike anything else you will ever see. Everything about it and in it is a work of artistic imagination. Whether or not you like Dali's work, you have to marvel at this place. We went on a weekday, off season, and stood in the line to get in for 45 minutes. Once we were inside, it was pretty crowded. We were told that the line can take 3 hours in the summer. So be prepared or check in advance on how long the wait to get in will be.

reviewnospace:
This has to be a joke from beyond the grave. It's quite hilarious watching all the busy fools snap away on their iPhones. If its clean lines and white walls you're after then don't go. On the other hand if its a chaotic and colourful Daliesque experience that melts your clock then you're in for a treat. Don't miss it. Oh and leave your camera in the hotel.

If it's Dali's wonderful work you want to see then go early or late.
titleopinion: Life Becomes Art. This has to be a joke from beyond the grave. It's quite hilarious watching all the busy fools snap away on their iPhones. If its clean lines and white walls you're after then don't go. On the other hand if its a chaotic and colourful Daliesque experience that melts your clock then you're in for a treat. Don't miss it. Oh and leave your camera in the hotel.  If it's Dali's wonderful work you want to see then go early or late.

reviewnospace: We were in Barcelona for a few days, pre-cruise, and my husband and I are both Dali fans, so we purchased train tickets and headed to Figueres. First of all, getting there was easy. Walking to and from the train station was no problem. As far as the museum itself goes, I was very disappointed and my husband less so, although after visiting this one, he felt the Dali museum in St. Pete, FL was far better. We both enjoyed the displays, but felt that the experience would have been better had they had descriptions for each piece. The jewelry exhibit was actually more interesting. If you have extra time on you hands and love Dali, you might want to consider the trip.
titleopinion: If You're a Fan. We were in Barcelona for a few days, pre-cruise, and my husband and I are both Dali fans, so we purchased train tickets and headed to Figueres. First of all, getting there was easy. Walking to and from the train station was no problem. As far as the museum itself goes, I was very disappointed and my husband less so, although after visiting this one, he felt the Dali museum in St. Pete, FL was far better. We both enjoyed the displays, but felt that the experience would have been better had they had descriptions for each piece. The jewelry exhibit was actually more interesting. If you have extra time on you hands and love Dali, you might want to consider the trip.

reviewnospace: I travelled up for the night from Barcelona especially to see this musuem, and man, was I glad ! This place is amazing, even if Dali isn't your thing, this entire experience would keep your attention. It's a magnificent structure, made from a damaged theatre during the Spainish revolution. Dali's vision brought this back to life and he has created an entire work of art from the ruins. The art on show is maginificant, but the building itself is the highlight. A real surrealist masterpiece. I'd recommend staying for the evening and exploring this cute little village.
titleopinion: Simply amazing.. I travelled up for the night from Barcelona especially to see this musuem, and man, was I glad ! This place is amazing, even if Dali isn't your thing, this entire experience would keep your attention. It's a magnificent structure, made from a damaged theatre during the Spainish revolution. Dali's vision brought this back to life and he has created an entire work of art from the ruins. The art on show is maginificant, but the building itself is the highlight. A real surrealist masterpiece. I'd recommend staying for the evening and exploring this cute little village.

reviewnospace:
We visited this museum with our 2 teenagers and our 7 year old. We all loved it! So many amazing exhibits - some firing the imagination, some pure genius, some quite random / crazy and a few quite 'normal'! It was very enjoyable, and it was great to follow our youngest son's shrieks of "look at this" through the many rooms and levels.
Easy to get to by train from Girona and Barcelona, it's a good day out, especially if it's raining - we were there in April, and it wasn't too crowded.
titleopinion: Brilliant and Bonkers!. We visited this museum with our 2 teenagers and our 7 year old. We all loved it! So many amazing exhibits - some firing the imagination, some pure genius, some quite random / crazy and a few quite 'normal'! It was very enjoyable, and it was great to follow our youngest son's shrieks of  look at this  through the many rooms and levels.  Easy to get to by train from Girona and Barcelona, it's a good day out, especially if it's raining - we were there in April, and it wasn't too crowded.

quote: A must see for Dali fans!
reviewnospace:
I am a Dali fan, so this museum was my main reason for my trip to this side of Spain. I wasn't disappointed! It was not just a museum full of art work on the walls and sculptors in their proper place. The building itself was turned into a work of art by Dali. Don't skip the jewelry section of the museum. Once you exit for the main art building you have to go around the corner and into another door. It is was worth finding it ( and it wasn't too hard to find, just ask the security at the exit of the art museum).

I tool the train in from Barcelona. The travel time was 2 hours each way and cost 30€ round trip. From the station it's about a 15 minute walk. It easy to find just follow the signs.
