quote: He was one of a kind
reviewnospace: The Dali Museum in Figueres is wonderful (a little expensive, but definitely worth it. If you are 65 or over, you can get a discount if you have your passport or other proof of age). In addition to Dali's amazing works of art (paintings and sculptures), the building is a unique setting. Lots of tapas places and other restaurants in surrounding streets.

reviewnospace: Everything Dali and then some! Well displayed exhibits of Dali creations! Sometimes startling and always surprising!
titleopinion: Must visit while in Figueres!. Everything Dali and then some! Well displayed exhibits of Dali creations! Sometimes startling and always surprising!

reviewnospace: a burned theatre with a very special exposition a little far from catalunya you can also take the train but a complete offer of dalis art
titleopinion: special. a burned theatre with a very special exposition a little far from catalunya you can also take the train but a complete offer of dalis art

reviewnospace: We left Besalu to visit Salvador Dali’s Teatro Museu Dali in Figueres. There was nothing special about Figures except it was the birthplace of artist Salvador Dali and home to the Dali Museum. It is an amazing building, salmon pink with giant eggs on top and small bread shapes all over the walls as well as golden stylized statues around the top. The bread shapes are reproductions of the local bread rolls, which I must admit I initially did mistake for golden stools. I put that down to my shortsightedness! It was full of surprises, inside and outside, and kept us busy exploring 22 rooms over a few hours. The raining taxi Cadillac with sculptures inside was quirky. Gala (the artist’s wife and muse) was intriguing in one major work. Looking like her gazing out to sea and at the same time, turning into Abraham Lincoln when out-of-focus through a telescope, was cleverly done.It would be a great place to take children to introduce them to art as it is a very interactive art museum.
titleopinion: A Dali Art Playground. We left Besalu to visit Salvador Dali’s Teatro Museu Dali in Figueres. There was nothing special about Figures except it was the birthplace of artist Salvador Dali and home to the Dali Museum. It is an amazing building, salmon pink with giant eggs on top and small bread shapes all over the walls as well as golden stylized statues around the top. The bread shapes are reproductions of the local bread rolls, which I must admit I initially did mistake for golden stools. I put that down to my shortsightedness! It was full of surprises, inside and outside, and kept us busy exploring 22 rooms over a few hours. The raining taxi Cadillac with sculptures inside was quirky. Gala (the artist’s wife and muse) was intriguing in one major work. Looking like her gazing out to sea and at the same time, turning into Abraham Lincoln when out-of-focus through a telescope, was cleverly done.It would be a great place to take children to introduce them to art as it is a very interactive art museum.

reviewnospace: Not previously a Dali fan but what a great museum, really worth a visit. The breadth of his work is incredible and it's clever too.
titleopinion: WOW!. Not previously a Dali fan but what a great museum, really worth a visit. The breadth of his work is incredible and it's clever too.

quote: As you would expect- completely off the wall
reviewnospace: This museum is superb could only be Dali inspired. What vision this man had to realise that a burned down derelict theatre space would make a wonderful showcase for his work. Is crowded and necessary to queue a long time for a ticket but worth the wait.
titleopinion: As you would expect- completely off the wall. This museum is superb could only be Dali inspired. Is crowded and necessary to queue a long time for a ticket but worth the wait.

quote: It's worth to visit, but pretty crowded in summer...
reviewnospace:
There are many masterpieces and art objects to see. It' s really interesting and creative exposition there. I can also recommend the Dali Jewellery Museum which is near and you will get free entrance with the Dali Museum ticket.
I would not recommend this museum to families with children, because it's really crowded and there' s a long queue outside the museum.

reviewnospace: This museum was outstanding. One of our favourite things to do in Catalonia. Our guide book said it would take an hour to go through but I think it needs at least 2-3 hours especially if you are going to see the jewels as well. I would highly recommend a guided tour or a good guide book to really understand what you are looking at. (there was one in the gift shop that explained some things). There were things we would have completely missed if not for eavesdropping on some of the art teachers and tour guides that were explaining things to their groups. Thankfully we understand French and a little Russian. The town of Figueres is also quite charming to walk around and eat at the many quaint cafes.
titleopinion: Incredible!. This museum was outstanding. One of our favourite things to do in Catalonia. Our guide book said it would take an hour to go through but I think it needs at least 2-3 hours especially if you are going to see the jewels as well. reviewnospace: Loved it all he was a true art genius. Just a pity they didn`t have some of his most famous paintings or copies. A must visit if near the area. Even if you do not understand, appreciate some of his work he was way ahead for tricking the eye into seeing images etc.
titleopinion: Salvador`s Surreal Theatre. Loved it all he was a true art genius. Just a pity they didn`t have some of his most famous paintings or copies. A must visit if near the area. Even if you do not understand, appreciate some of his work he was way ahead for tricking the eye into seeing images etc.

reviewnospace:
This is not just a Museum, this is a Life's experience!!! You are visiting a museum of superb paintings but also , you are joining the soul and the mind of an artist who ,according to my opinion is the genious of its kind. Surealism was just for Dali the tool to expose his problems ,fears and experiences that caused him pain and phobias.He is calling us to follow his way of confession of self psycho-analysis through drawings/paintings for him,for us it could be music,poetry, acts or whatever.In Brief.Don't be afraid to expose your problems.Don't hasitate to call for help!! In order to interpret his works,and understand the meaning of each object used in his works , you need to buy book before and read or visit the museum with a guide.
There are a lot of excursions from Barcelona to Figueras Dali Museum, but ask if your guide can explain to you his paintings or he will just take you there...
Otherwise ,its not worth it, as you will possibly miss the best paintigs,double images and hidden objects,that you cannot discover by yourselfs.You will need minimum 2 hours to see the most important ones.The price paid {individuals 12 euro } worths evry cent of it.If you love Art, you will agree with me .Dali is a genious

reviewnospace: The whole experience was delightful. Well worth the visit
titleopinion: Amazing. The whole experience was delightful. Well worth the visit

quote: Outstanding - the only reason for going to Figueres - but a great one
reviewnospace: I adore this Museum. I've now been twice - and I would go again. It's over the top, highly imaginative, extremely entertaining - and an absolutely must do if you are anywhere near the Costa Brava. I can't even start to recommend it enough. Any one piece of art would be worth the trip - and there are hundreds. Do get at least the guide book (an extra 6.5 euro) - you will miss so much without something to point out Dali's jokes, puns, giggles, and pokes. Go. Please Go.

reviewnospace: It does not matter you like the art or not, Dali impresses you anyway! Shocking and beautiful at the same time, shows Dali's 'twisted' imagination.
titleopinion: Very impressive!. It does not matter you like the art or not, Dali impresses you anyway! Shocking and beautiful at the same time, shows Dali's 'twisted' imagination.

reviewnospace: A very broad range of Dali's body of work is on display in this somewhat kitschy theatre/museum. The price of admission is relatively high, and many of the displays inside require some Euro coins to operate in order to get the full creative effect. While the natural light of the theatre windows gives the galleries an airy feeling, there is often glare on some of the works, which makes viewing a little awkward. But the range of Dali's talent seemed limitless, from silly and profane to vibrant and contemplative. My appreciation for his work was greatly expanded by this visit.
titleopinion: Eccentric but enjoyable. A very broad range of Dali's body of work is on display in this somewhat kitschy theatre/museum. The price of admission is relatively high, and many of the displays inside require some Euro coins to operate in order to get the full creative effect. While the natural light of the theatre windows gives the galleries an airy feeling, there is often glare on some of the works, which makes viewing a little awkward. But the range of Dali's talent seemed limitless, from silly and profane to vibrant and contemplative. My appreciation for his work was greatly expanded by this visit.

reviewnospace: A long trip from Barcelona (1 1/2 - 2 hours), very crowded in April--can't imagine what it is like in summer. Not the best museum experience due to the crowds, and not as bizarre as I would have thought. The jewlry exhibit (yes, he designed jewlry) was outstanding.
titleopinion: Dali, Dali, and more Dali. A long trip from Barcelona (1 1/2 - 2 hours), very crowded in April--can't imagine what it is like in summer. Not the best museum experience due to the crowds, and not as bizarre as I would have thought. The jewlry exhibit (yes, he designed jewlry) was outstanding.

quote: A temple to an extra-ordinary man
reviewnospace: You don't have to like the works of Dali to come here. It is Dali and so much more. And lots of things that Dali created that you never would have imagined. Not just droopy clocks! Like him or not, he was an extraordinary force on the world of art, and changed some of our perspectives. This museum was largely his own work (I believe) and is as large as his own ego. There are also other exhibits always worth seeing - and follow up with a visit to his whitewashed house by the sea at Port LLigat.
titleopinion: A temple to an extra-ordinary man. You don't have to like the works of Dali to come here. It is Dali and so much more. And lots of things that Dali created that you never would have imagined. Not just droopy clocks! quote: Interesting but not value for money
reviewnospace: It cost us 12€ each to enter, compare thos to 3€ for Cosmocaixa (Barcelona science museum) or the Picasso museum, both of which are a wonderful day out, it seems overpriced, however it is a must see. Neither of us know much about art, we had read a little about Dalí before we arrived but because the art work on display does not have any explanations next to it, and most of them don't even have titles, we were just looking at it and thinking what is this? (Some of it reminded me of Tony Hancock's 'the rebel') Because there were no guided tours or information leaflets it relly felt like a wasted opportunity to learn something. The nature of the building means that it is difficult to look at some works and you have to double back on yourself a lot, which doesn't really matter but it was so full of school trips, bored teenagers who seemed to be unsupervised and were running around not looking at anything but shouting at each other and sitting in front of things which made it a very uncomfortable experience, maybe they should limit the size of groups and take them round with a guide or only allow groups in at certains times because it really spoiled the experience. As we left we both felt disappointed, I'm sure they make plenty of money but why not put in a little extra effort and give people a really amazing experience instead of a mediocre one.

reviewnospace: It is incredible how Dali created and designed this museum for his work.

quote: really special, but... too crowded (most of the time)
reviewnospace:
Dali was pretty crazy and this museum shows. It is absolutely worth a visit. Figueres is a nice small town where you can have a nice lunch and do some shopping. The problem with the museum is that it is too popular. It is too crowded so you can't really 'suck in' the art.

So when to go? Maybe a Tuesday morning in December or January?

reviewnospace: The Dali Theatre-Museum is a day trip from Barcelona. It's definitely worth a visit and I highly recommend a guided visit. Book ahead of time. We were traveling by car and did not know our time of arrival so we did not book one. Dali's works are so complex and with so much meaning that you need clues to figure it out. Don't miss the jewelry room with the ruby hearth--it moves!
titleopinion: Worth a visit!. The Dali Theatre-Museum is a day trip from Barcelona. It's definitely worth a visit and I highly recommend a guided visit. Book ahead of time. We were traveling by car and did not know our time of arrival so we did not book one. Dali's works are so complex and with so much meaning that you need clues to figure it out. Don't miss the jewelry room with the ruby hearth--it moves!

reviewnospace: Definitely worth a visit if only to experience some of his work. Some genius pieces there indeed, with some hands on interaction although probably not a place you would take your kids. Dali was one sexual being and this is very evident in his art. I guarantee you won't be bored here, it's definitely an eye-opener ;)
titleopinion: Dali was one cryptic character. Definitely worth a visit if only to experience some of his work. Some genius pieces there indeed, with some hands on interaction although probably not a place you would take your kids. Dali was one sexual being and this is very evident in his art. I guarantee you won't be bored here, it's definitely an eye-opener ;)

reviewnospace:
We decided to do this as a day trip during a four day stay in Barcelona and so glad we did. Taking the regional train it's about 1:45 ride on the MD line (less stops) and a 10 minute walk from the Figueres station. Lovely walk through this quiet town. The Dali Museum is built in an old theater and much larger than I imagined. There are so many interesting works of art to see, please make sure that you allow yourself at the very least 2 hours (or more) to enjoy all of the differnet exhibits. Whether or not you appreciate modern art I'm sure you will walk away feeling admiration for his mad genius.

As a side note, leave some time to stop and visit the beautiful little town of Girona on the train ride back to Barcelona. A late lunch in this gem of a city made our full day trip complete!
titleopinion: Great Day Trip From Barcelona. We decided to do this as a day trip during a four day stay in Barcelona and so glad we did. Taking the regional train it's about 1:45 ride on the MD line (less stops) and a 10 minute walk from the Figueres station. Lovely walk through this quiet town. The Dali Museum is built in an old theater and much larger than I imagined. There are so many interesting works of art to see, please make sure that you allow yourself at the very least 2 hours (or more) to enjoy all of the differnet exhibits. Whether or not you appreciate modern art I'm sure you will walk away feeling admiration for his mad genius.  As a side note, leave some time to stop and visit the beautiful little town of Girona on the train ride back to Barcelona. A late lunch in this gem of a city made our full day trip complete!
